title: Fantastic bike tour through Lima
text: I was quite nervous booking this tour as I don‚Äôt ride a bike regularly, but I needn‚Äôt have worried as I was well looked after. This tour is a great way to explore Lima through its network of bike lanes, and you cover many of the main sites and sounds across three neighbourhoods. I did the tour on a Sunday so there was not too much traffic and the path was mostly flat. Big thank you my guide Tito for your hospitality and wonderful welcome to Lima!

title: Great way to see Lima!
text: I had a great time exploring a few of Lima's neighborhoods with my guide Tito. He was very friendly and informative and adapted as needed to my cycling skills (or lack thereof!). I highly recommend doing this tour!

title: Wonderful way to see Lima
text: Highly recommend the bike tour. It‚Äôs a great way to experience the city. My guide was very knowledgeable and great to talk too. I would recommend this tour for anyone young or old or fitness level the pace was nice and relaxed.

title: Beautiful bike tour along the Lima coast
text: Highly recommended tourSuper choice of route: beautiful views along the coast and exploring the colorful and artistic district of BarancoExcellent guide: great explanationsTito our guide gave us with his extensive knowledge of the geology, faces, architecture and culture of the cityI'm impressed.The speed of the tour was well adapted to us and we were able to make sufficient breaks (for photo stops, closer visit of Baranco and for resting or explanations)The bikes were in top condition we felt safe throughout. Tito always drove ahead and got us through traffic safely and well.

title: Such a fun day!
text: We had the best time on bicycle tour. The guide was so knowledgeable and kind. We highly recommend this bicycle ride! You won‚Äôt be disappointed.

title: Not a private cycling experience - misleading.
text: Sadly this was very disappointing, as much as I love to support local businesses. We booked and paid for a Private Coast Cycling Experience to start at 9am, instead we got 6 people on our tour leaving around 10am (no apology, no explanation, no refund).We do private cycling tours all over the world: that way the guides can customise the ride according to our fitness and enjoyment level (always been successful). Today was not enjoyable and it was clear the guide just wanted to get this tour over and done with. Feel a bit ripped off, plus the fact that I felt embarrassed lagging behind (reason a nearly 60 year old lady booked a private tour and not to race with lovely 30-year olds - felt guilty keeping them up). If you want cheap group tours then yes it‚Äôs for you (nothing wrong with it, I was there too once). However if you want a private cycling tour look elsewhere.

title: Bike rid in Lima
text: A great trip and fantastic way to see a lot of Lima. Tito and Rudolfo were great guides. Had a lot of fun and would recommend thoroughly. Not strenuous at all. Only concern was the short ride through the unlit two lane tunnel without lights on the bike. Scary stuff with vehicles thundering past. Easily solved by outfitting low cost high intensity lights on the bike

title: Great bile tour of Lima
text: A fun way to see some of Lima that I likely wouldn‚Äôt have otherwise. Tito was a great guide and kept us safe. One piece of advice - wear sunscreen, even if it‚Äôs overcast!

title: Great morning
text: Nice way to see the local coastal district south of Miraflores. Starting on solar hill cruise back to Miraflores with a couple of stops at local city Central. square's.

title: Great way to spend 1/2 day
text: Thanks for a great morning!! Guide Raoul (Rod), and our driver, were friendly and made sure we were looked after. Most of the bike trip is down hill - some up hill but worth it. Guide had lots of information, and passion, for his home town. Great way to start our Peruvian adventure. Would definitely recommend if confident on a bike and enjoy an adventure.

title: This is the perfect tour to familiarize yourself with Lima, the city and its popular destinations.
text: Kind and knowledgeable tour guide catered the trip to our interests and shared her extensive knowledge of Lima. Best tour ever!

title: Great start to visit Lima
text: This was a fun way to see Lima. John Paul was very friendly and informative. This tour was amazing and highly recommend it.

title: Peru Street food is a must!
text: We did the Lima street food tour with Paula. And boy was it just amazing to end our Peru trip with a filled tummy! We learnt so much about Peruvian cuisine. We had ChiFa (Chinese-Peruvia), yummy churros, and so many more! Our guide Paula was amazing and very knowledgeable. She looked after us very well. We also learnt a lot about the history of Peru. Thank you Paula for an awesome tour!

title: Wonderful walking tour in Lima
text: We, my husband, me and two friends, booked a walking tour with Urban Adventures for an afternoon walking tour on our one day in Lima.  Our guide was Paula, and she was wonderful, very knowledgeable, funny and personable.  Her English was great, and she did not only show us interesting sites in the city, including a wonderful market, she also took us on the bus tot the center of the city, and talked about the Peruvian culture, politics etc.  It was a wonderful way to learn much about Lima and Peru in a short time, and from a wonderful warm and funny person like Paula.

title: Craig & Linda
text: This was our first trip to Lima and we wanted a tour that would give us an experience of Lima, it‚Äôs people and beautiful sites!!! Paula was our wonderful tour guide and she gave us this experience plus much more like all the amazing history, answering all our questions!!! We would highly recommend this tour...ask for Paula!!!

title: Great afternoon.
text: Thanks Paula for a greatDiscovery Tour. Lovely personality, good knowledge with plenty of history to help understand Lima and Peru.

title: Great chance to sneak out from business and meet Lima
text: Our guide Gladys shared both history and stories from today about Lima and Peru. A great chance to explore local food and drinks, plenty of opportunities to ask questions! And Convento San Francisco in the end was marvellous!Only improvement opportunities I found is that the guide should wear the Urban Adventure sweatshirt, to make the identification easier at meeting point.

title: Fantastic opportunity to learn about local life
text: I was lucky enough to be the only person on the tour so I had Gladys' full attention. We took a public bus to Lima's historic center. Gladys provided a thorough overview of the churches and government buildings along with Lima's history. The real highlight was the walk through the central market. This was what I was looking for. After a week with my friends exploring the tourist attractions around the country I wanted to see how everyday Peruvians lived. I wanted to go off the beaten path. There you can find everything for sale from food to dresses to pots and pans to bags. Unlike other markets such as Marrakech, which itself is a tourist attraction, this market had few tourists and was a true instution that locals shopped at.I really appreciated the time and attention that Gladys provided to me. After this tour I felt that my trip to Peru was complete.Thank you!

title: Excellent introduction to Lima
text: Paula was our guide in this Lima Discovery  tour. She was an excellent guide, full of great insights into the city. We walked through a local market, took a bus to the Plaza de Armes, had a Pisco sour and gelato and gained a great deal of knowledge about the city in the short time that we had.Definitely recommend this tour.

title: Good guide and scary catacombs!
text: My girlfriend and me took this tour as a part of a bigger package and it wasn't disappointing at all. Our guide Gladis knew a lot about the city and its history. The visit in the catacombs of the monastery was very exciting: lots of real skulls and bones everywhere - scary, but impressive!!

title: Airport Transfer Cusco
text: Lila was amazing. Our travels were complicated by LATAM Airlines terrible operations but Lila was super understanding and friendly about the changes. She was on time with a sign. She also helped LATAM find bags for other passengers as well as us that were lost. I wish we could've spent more time with Lila. 10 stars

title: Incredible service! Punctuality, kindness and attention.
text: In fact, since the airport reception by Carolina Valeriano (who also accompanied and guided our tours daily), the guides who remained in knowledge and sympathy , the punctuality of the drivers on the tours and finally the Jonatan - who took us to Cusco airport, checked in with us and helped send out the bags - I only have compliments for the team! In our journey you were irreversible, you reached perfection!Thank you very much and continue like this!

title: Discover Lima!!!
text: Excellent!!! I liked Lima very much; it was a grateful surprise. I felt at home. International cuisine, good drinks and service note 10

title: Good service
text: Punctual attention, only missed a telephone contact before travel both on arrival and departure and on arrival it would be prudent to warn that the driver can not wait inside the lobby

title: Great experience.
text: We made the transfers with that Enterprise. Perfect transport, clean and new. I recommend, for punctuality, customer care and availability.

title: Smooth Transportation from the Airport
text: Amazing service. In the case that you can not find the driver that is holding the sign with your name you can contact them on Whatsapp 24/7 and they will immediately help you locate your driver!

title: Amazing service!!
text: Showed up early and helped us carry and load all of our bags! Great company for airport transfers! Van was super nice and clean!

title: Genial
text: We only spent a day, because we had a connecting flight, but that day we were there we had a great time people in Peru are very warm and friendly our guides who one sought us from the airport and the other took us was excellent care of both the truth that super friendly and friendly people

title: Vipac: great service provider in Peru.
text: I traveled to Peru with all the assistance of Vipac, such as transfers, sightseeing tours... And the service provided was impeccable: very good cars, wonderful guides. Super indico.

title: Transfers Lima
text: Very friendly drivers, punctual with responsible handling. On arrival they waited for me with a sign with my name and on return they arrive 15 minutes early to the hotel with very good disposition

title: We visited the churches parliament and Museum. Best is the Museo Larco
text: Gabriel is an experience and excellent tour guy we met, calm and easy, explain all the details in the historic places we visited. Speak good English and communicated well. If we have a chance to visit Lima, Gabriel is the excellent choice and made our day. Thank you Gabriel

title: problems in reservations in hotels, were not made . No check-in between the cities of Juliaca and Lima was made.
text: The agency should worry more about the customers. If I'm on vacation is to enjoy them without worry of bookmarks and follow-up

title: We would repeat with ViPac
text: The trip proceeded as planned in the program. We were always well informed of schedules and activities. Also, throughout the trip we were accompanied by excellent professionals, very competent and friendly.

title: Peru is beautiful, but...
text: I make more than 5 important trips a year, so I think I can distinguish the mediocre organization from the good one. And in this 12-day trip the good level has not been there. The value for money was not the best. Little attention to customer/tourist needs. Skipped or changed visits at the last moment, little time for visits, but a lot of time spent for example shopping in agreed places. Poor hotels. I gave 3 bullets and not two because Peru is still beautiful.

title: Excellent attention !!!!!!
text: Very cordial. They were very professional and careful in all aspects. Punctual in all that remains of the search to lead us to the excursions and careful in the areas that were for us dangerous

title: Punctuality
text: They are very punctual, do everything within the schedule, guides with good will, some fun. The way they act gives us confidence that everything will take place within what was agreed upon.

title: Excellent experience!!
text: Because everything we found excellent, transports, very friendly people and friendly guides knowledgeable about the sites visited

title: Great choice.
text: A great opportunity to meet Lima. Very helpful staff. Super recommend, because they are polite, punctual and friendly.

title: Knowing Lima
text: Excellent attention to tourists, explanation in each place visited and during the tour. Very pleasant for the family.

title: Peru üåÖüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
text: Thank you VIPAC for the excellent service. Attentive to every detail. They organized our trip from the time we arrived at the airport until we set out on our way back. They accompanied us in Lima and Cusco permanently. I would like to highlight the excellent experience we had with Rivelino, the best guide in the worldüòâ. A real open book. Also thank David who took us to the Singrenacocha lagoon where we could meditate and connect with nature. What an experience!!!I highly recommend them.üåÖüåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

title: Reception and follow-up
text: Driver and guide excellent, attentive and helpful. Always accompanying the group with patience and education. They really showed love for their work.

title: One more for the notebook ‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è‚úçÔ∏è
text: It was very good, a different country with its good and average characteristics. A culture totally different from ours.

title: Fantastic.
text: An excellent experience with a fabulous guide of his name Gabriel Salazar who is of the best I have met around this world.

title: Efficient and helpful
text: Excellent company. Agile in communication and all very helpful and polite employees, I will definitely hire them again

title: Viaje Per√∫
text: Excellent tour made in the city of Lima. Very entertaining and would do it again. Lots of traffic. But you can still enjoy

title: Walk through Lima
text: Yanet Herrera was our wonderful guide on this tour that surprised us at every moment. We emphasize that the information and the way he transmitted his knowledge about the history and potential of each place with such passion made the tour unforgettable. Thank you Yanet for these moments and experiences that we will take with us to Uruguay!

title: Gabby and Gabriel are great tour guides
text: Both parts of this trip were great.   Am saw  the central historical district and pm saw the Larco museum and magic water.   So much great information was given the entire time.  Their English was excellent and they knew the answers to all of our questions.   Would definitely recommend this tour, this operator and these guides

title: Beatiful Lima
text: This was an easy and interesting way to discover Lima highlights. The trip to Larco museum was great. I have travelled a lot over the world, seen a lot of museums. Larco museum is a must.

title: Disappointing arrangement Vistor
text: Viator agreed to and received $300 for 4 people for a dinner and a tour of Lima fountain. The tour guide never responded nor showed up. We had a wasted night on sep 7   Please don‚Äôt book any tours on viator as they are not responsive and have a poor management.i am still waiting on a refund. I have other telephone charges in a foreign country trying to reach the tour guide and no success.

title: Long day - but lots to see and do!
text: This tour starts early in the day - you drive around Lima and see some of the city sites. You then get dropped off at this buffet restaurant and then have to kill a few hours (which is at a shopping centre/by the coast) because your guide leaves you there then you need to get to the pick up point for the afternoon/evening guide. If I had known that, I would have booked it as two half day tours and gotten dropped off and picked up back at the hotel. Also - as an FYI - the company that runs these tours is not responsive to emails to confirm the activities. They ignored my many emails and Messenger posts. I was lucky that they showed up per my booking - there was no confirmation prior to the event. The Larco Museum and Water Circuit was the highlight of this tour.

title: Interesting to see only objects
text: If you like to see only many historical objects, this is your ideal place. There are no historical reviews to read. They had no guides or anyone to point you to the places. There's no order to start. Inside there are shops open but it seems at the same time abandoned. Without a guide you can not do a pleasant tour, the only fun for me was to see objects from different countries and years. Take cash, I couldn't pay by card. They don‚Äôt give you a brochure, there is no QR‚ÄôS to see if there are stories to listen to, it‚Äôs far away and getting there by bus is not easy, just by taxi, own car or bus with visiting groups.

title: A big surprise
text: A place where you can enjoy the history of Peru, as well as items of great characters, you can enjoy the Inca culture and all the gold they left us to be able to surprise us daily today, the entrance has a price of 40 suns

title: An outstanding museum overflowing with treasures.
text: An important musuem that has so much to see that you need to allow more time than anticipated. It houses many impressive treasures, big and small. A not miss stop in LIma!

title: Excellent
text: Excellent collection, history close to you, it is recommended to take the tour with a guide so as not to miss any details.

title: It could be better.
text: The museum was great, I was surprised by the weapons collection. The guide was not well informed about them. price quality ratio not convenient.

title: Weapons and armor
text: I recommend visiting the Larco Museum first, as there is more information there. This is a private collection of Inca pieces, mainly gold pieces. Furthermore, it has a wonderful collection of weapons and armor from around the world, including a weapon that was given to Dom Pedro.Right at the entrance, they say you have to pay for a guide, who are historians who explain everything, but we didn't want to and went alone. Be careful, because the way they talk, it seems like you can't visit without a guide. And it's far away.

title: Discover the treasures of the people of Peru.
text: Surprising. In addition to a large and beautiful collection of gold pieces, there is a very rich collection of weapons and military equipment

title: Good collection!
text: Great informative guide Mayrol , quite the collection of gold , weapons and anthropological items . Good addition to Peru‚Äôs many gems . The museum could use better item labeling and identification if you go without a knowledgeable tour guide .

title: Private Tour Experience
text: Excellent experience with Vipac Travel the Lima provider. Not good experience with Tripadvisor, Tripadvisor has to improve customer communication.The provider picked us and returned us to the hotel via private transportation. The guide was a TRUE bilingual tour guide. He explained surrounding locations while traveling to/from the museum, and was knowledgeable of the gold collection. I would have liked more history on the arms part of the tour. The museum is fascinating on its gold & arms collection, breathtaking.It was a good PRIVATE tour experience.

title: Very interesting
text: The museum was very interesting. We took our time and look at all the fascinating items. Smaller kids would probably find it boring, but our teens were intrigued.

title: Excellent trip, highly recommended
text: All excellent. Very comfortable, clean hotel and amazing breakfast buffet. We stayed in miraflores sector and you have beautiful towns, everything nearby. Transfer to the airport very organized and responsible, contact you by WhatsApp

title: Laura guide to Vipag
text: Happy to have chosen Vipaq for the attention, explanation and accompaniment at all times of our assigned guide LAURA who was always helping us
The best experience, Fatima very gentle, concerned at all times to deliver an Excellent Service. We will definitely recommend them.
Excellent Service. Very punctual, very friendly, attentive and willing all staff. A very good experience. Highly recommended.

title: Very good attention.
text: Perfect professionals, explain the necessary and provide good information, always inquisitive and very organized and punctual.

title: Every program very well planned
text: The whole trip was carried out with Vipac, from transfers, tours in Lima and tours in Cusco. It was a great experience.

title: Don‚Äôt Delay, Book Today!
text: Company/Driver was punctual and communicated pick up time well in advance. Made my departure stress free. I was escorted inside the airport with help with my luggage and sent off properly. I highly recommend booking this company for your transportation needs.

title: Excellent service
text: Punctuality at the airport and the hotel. Good service back and forth. Kindness of the driver. Very good Communication from the coordinator.

title: Transfer to Lima
text: The reception was not good. The poster contained the names of at least two people and was not visible.I also had to wait about half an hour standing in the arrivals sector until the other people sharing the transfer arrived. The departure was rather better and the guide accompanied me to safety. Very good.

title: Transfer from airport to hotel and vice versa.
text: Excellent Attention. They looked for us on schedule, Mrs Fatima very cordial as we were on our way to the hotel showed us the city, the places etc. and told us about the places we could meet. Same when they wanted us to go to the airport Mr. Jose and the driver excellent service! Thank you so much!!

title: Full service!
text: Experience well assisted by the guide and was properly fulfilled with the itinerary. Friendly and warm treatment. Very suitable shuttle service.

title: Mi viaje a Lima
text: Exploring Lima's culinary scene and historical sites with Book Now Travel was a top-notch experience. Their attention to detail and excellent guides made everything effortless and enjoyable

title: Spectacular tour
text: The transport arrived at the agreed time. Our tour of the Museum was spectacular, the guide accompanied us throughout the visit, explaining the details of each piece there exposed, The guide was super attentive and polite.   The restaurant is lovely and the food great. Super recommend the walk.

title: Perfect evening in museum!
text: It was a truly fantastic experience! Our guide mr. Ricardo Galvez was experienced guide with very good English and his knowledge along with individuality made the tour very-very interesting! Beautiful territory of museum, interesting ancient world of Latin America and fantastic food in the restaurant. Perfect evening!

title: Not worth the tour and dinner
text: The museum is amazing, but not worth adding the visit to dinner, although our Guide carmen is excellent, we had to make the quick tour due to our dinner time. The restaurant is beautiful but they offered us a fixed menu very basic and we expected much more, so it is better to do only the visit to the museum and then visit the restaurant separately, we had to rush to dinner because our time ended at 20h, I do not recommend this added tour.

title: Museo Larco‚Ä¶AMAZING!!!!
text: Amazing!!! From start to finish. Driver and guide picked us up promptly at hotel. Daniel was very knowledgeable and proud to talk about his country during the ride to the Museo Larco. The property is beautiful, and the collection has been displayed and curated exquisitely. Dinner was amazing, service a bit slow but food was very very good. A must when you visit Lima

title: Supply lime
text: Excellent service, wonderful place that exceeded my expectations and that of the people I was with, I was impressed

title: Worth every penny!
text: Both my friend and I highly recommend this one-of-a kind experience. Our tour guide Rosa led us on an insightful, late-night tour of the museum followed by dinner in an exceptionally gorgeous atmosphere. Beset with hanging bougainvillea, the Larco museum and restaurant is special place, not to be missed on any trip to Lima.

title: A very rich visual experience!
text: I recommend the program because the outdoor area of the museum is beautiful and taking it in the late afternoon and then at night makes all the difference. The museum itself is quite interesting and the erotic gallery is surprising. Dinner is very well served and the restaurant is beautiful. Victor (guide) and Jaime (driver) were super attentive.

title: Great Evening in Lima
text: We really enjoyed this tour. The guide was friendly and knowledgeable. We both liked all of the dishes we had at the restaurant. It was a beautiful place with a great view.

title: We did a tour of 5 days, guided tours of historic ruinss, city machu pichu, entrance to ciudsdela, cuzco, everything exc
text: All excellent, guides, schedules, tours, an incredible and unforgettable experience.Good quality hotels, very good breakfasts.

title: Not to be missed.
text: Great experience. Availability and professionalism by Eduardo and also the driver was up to scratch.I highly recommend.

title: Highly recommend
text: I was the only person on the tour which was nice. It was very informative. My guide was very attentive. I highly recommend it.

title: Wonderful guides,
text: Very good, the wonderful guide, maybe a little cumbersome the vehicular traffic, shocking how extensive the place and know more of the history of Peru

title: I recommend
text: The history of the place is very rich and the guide was excellent. Super recomendo. The venue is 1h from Lima and the visit lasts about 2h.

title: Great and Informative!
text: The tour was great and informative! We had a fantastic tour guide (Mayrol) who gave us great information about Lima in general and the site.

title: Day of much history and culture
text: Amazing place. It is worth learning about the history and culture of Peru. The desert landscape next to the ocean is picturesque. Luckily we were able to count on the guide Eduardo who in addition to a great knowledge of history, still speaks Portuguese very well.

title: Family Fun
text: We had a wonderful time on this trip. We got picked up by the wonderful and knowledgeable Rosa and driven in a very nice van down to the site. Once there we got to tour the museum and then walk the grounds and view the ruins up close. It was so fascinating to have learned about a true hidden treasure.

title: The essential Pachacamac.
text: This is a 'whirlwind' option! Exactly what I had time for. Excellent curation of a huge amount of information by the guide. Comfortable vehicle and safe driver.

title: not only archaeology
text: Omar was a fantastic guide who not only had a fabulous archaeological knowledge, but also provided very knowledgeable information about Peru's recent history, current politics and social situation in Peru, architecture in Lima.... There were several tours in one, so to speak. After 3 1/2 hours smoking with the head

title: It was spectacular and the guides very well prepared
text: Yes, although I would have liked the tours to Lima and Cusco to be longer, especially Lima, it was practically a long way to go

title: Excellent walk, I recommend.
text: Wonderful trip! Everything very perfect. Transfers, hotels, guides, everything came out as expected and with expectations even exceeded many times. From arrival in Lima to departure, full-time assistance.

title: Spectacular and unique
text: Organization, timeliness, quality of people, places visited and hotels selected. All excellent.I highlight Melissa and Danny in Cusco, Juan in Machupichu and Sergio in Lima

title: All the trip excellent with amazing attention
text: All very well, excellent care and all the experience very taken care of. Very good hotels only the hotel in Lima Estelar Miraflores smelled very damp and we were changed rooms

title: We were discovering day by day, with the accompaniment of the coordinators, the interesting Andean culture in Peru
text: A dream holiday and a unique experience. Coordinators and logistics of the seven days excellent. Kindness, punctuality and professionalism are highlighted.

title: Bucket list trip!
text: I booked this 7-day tour for my 50th birthday and it was truly amazing! Here are the pros and cons of the trip:Pros:Vipac Travel was very organized. We had a driver and a guide each day and they were always on time and very informative.Action packed itinerary.  We never felt like we had too much free time (just enough).I felt like this 7-day tour covered all the best archaeological sites in the area.Cons:Train station in Ollyantatambo was very confusing.  Nobody spoke English there to help us.  They come in with lettered signs and do a little dance, but then you have no idea what to do if you don't speak Spanish.  It was extremely frustrating.Every day was an early morning pickup (typically 7am).  Several times we had to get breakfast to go from the hotel because the restaurants were not open yet by the time we had to check out.I booked the "Economy Triple" package since it was myself, my husband, and our daughter. That was a mistake!  The hotels we stayed at were terrible! After long days of hiking and traveling, we came back to hotels with horribly uncomfortable beds and hit or miss hot water in the showers.  One even had a radiator for us to plug in to heat the room.Overall:Great trip!  None of the Cons we necessarily due to Vipac.  I chose the economy package so I should have expected lower class hotels.  Other than the frustrating day at the train station, the rest of the trip went very smoothly.  I would definitely reccommend booking this package through Vipac. :)

title: Excellent service. Recommendation of closed eyes
text: Everything very organized and punctual. Cordial attention from all involved. Guides with a lot of knowledge. Vehicles in optimal state of preservation and cleanliness

title: Extraordinary
text: Our experience was wonderful!!! The staff were super attentive and punctual!! Guides very well informed and learned to pass their knowledge! A highlight to Ricardo, who transmitted all his love for the history of Cusco, Marcos who introduced us to Machu Picchu speaking Portuguese fluently and explaining in an extraordinary way the history of the place. Also, I can't help but quote Fernando, who accompanied us on arrival and departure, and kept us informed about the tours. The others were wonderful too! We will definitely use the services of VIPAC again, and we will inform our friends. We thank everyone who contributed to an excellent trip.

title: Praise
text: We were assisted full-time. We didn't need to worry about the agenda because they always sent me the program with tips relevant to the tours and they sought us in the hotels on time and helped us to include the visit to the colorful mountains that was not in the program (imperdible). Very good guides in all locations. I recommend!

title: Amazing experience, a wonderful journey with amazing scenery or culture
text: Very good coordination of schedules, good hotel and very friendly staff, exquisite food and dream train journey and very exciting

title: Responsible Cultural Immersion That Leaves A Lasting Impression
text: I can't say enough about the Lima Off the Beaten Path: Local Communities and Cultural Immersion Tour. This tour is a profound, educational, and deeply human journey into the real Lima.My guide, Alfredo, was truly exceptional. His knowledge of Lima's history, politics, and culture was vast, and he shared it with such passion that every fact came to life. However, beyond his expertise, Alfredo's kindness and compassion truly shone through. He created a welcoming and respectful environment that allowed for meaningful interactions with local residents.The highlight of the day was visiting a local community. I was welcomed into a family's home for a delicious homemade lunch, and I met inspiring individuals, such as a community leader who volunteers to feed children and the elderly. These were not just stops on a tour; they were genuine, heartfelt encounters that provided a unique perspective and a sense of hope.This tour is much more than just sightseeing; it's an opportunity for responsible cultural immersion that leaves a lasting impression. I am so grateful to have had this experience, and I would highly recommend it to anyone who wants to see the vibrant heart of Lima.

title: The Name Fits This Tour!
text: Wonderful day with Alfredo and his driver. The tour included SUCH interesting people and places, nothing like you would see in the tourist trap areas. We heard amazing stories of the lives of the people, shared a meal made by a local woman who had created her own food business and was a leader in her community, and visited a nonprofit working to improve the lives of children. The fishing area was interesting and, again, showed us the lives of working people in the city. Informative, safe, interesting, exhilarating day!

title: What a unique experience!
text: Alfredo took us on a trip way outside of the touristic side of Lima - to human settlements built from scratch by indigenous people of Peru. He was a very knowledgeable guide who gave us a thorough historical background of the places and the people.Another huge value of the trip was visiting the locals and learning about their ways of improving their lives there: from selling handcrafted items, through cooking for community kitchens to educating children and young women about their rights. Through joining the trip we were supporting the projects financially.The trip was very insightful and eye opening, completely crushing the stereotypes one might have about poorer neighbourhoods of South America.Without Alfredo we would never be able to see those places and meet the amazing people. If you‚Äôre a curious traveller, this trip is a must!

title: Don't miss this tour
text: What a wonderful day in Lima. We were so looking forward to our day here and our time with Alfredo did not disappoint. So much to see and do, from a unique (and massive) cemetery, to visiting a local artisan, to a wonderful lunch in a local home to visits within the community.A full and rewarding day that we can heartily recommend.

title: Really great tour!!
text: This is a truly wonderful tour. On this tour, you will have many experiences and encounters that you would never get by just visiting ordinary tourist spots. I wanted many people to know about this tour, so I will briefly describe the flow of my experience on the day (I will not write in detail. Please participate and experience it for yourself).In the morning, we boarded a small boat at the fishing port and toured Lima and the surrounding area from the sea, and then drove up a steep hill near the coast to see the statue of Christ and saints at the top.After that, in the afternoon, we headed to the San Juan de Miraflores district. I was staying in the San Isidro district, but as we drove, the atmosphere of the city changed so much that it was hard to believe we were in the same country. This district did not have running water, and trucks sold water, and people lived by storing water in tanks. On the way there, we could see the city, such as the market, from the car window, and also visited the second largest cemetery in the world.In the same area, we visited the home of a person who was a victim of the terrorist attacks in the 1980s and heard about their devastation and hardships. It was heartbreaking to hear how difficult and painful it was. She does sewing and sells cute embroidery products that you can buy.We had lunch at a local person's home. This person also had a very hard time, and we learned how harsh the era of terrorism by the Communist Party, such as Sendero Luminoso, was.Finally, the tour ended with a visit to a school attended by many children.The above is the flow of my experience on the day, but as you can see, it was really packed, and by visiting many places and meeting many people and listening to their stories, you can gain a lot of knowledge. Our guide, Alfred, was a very kind and good young man who loved and cared about his community and the Quechua people who live there. And he spoke very polished English. I am not fluent in languages, but he spoke polite and beautiful English slowly, so it was no problem at all.Also, the main destination, San Juan de Miraflorens, is described by the Ministry of Foreign Affairs and tourist guidebooks as "one of the most dangerous areas in Lima. You should never go there." However, thanks to Alfredo, I did not feel unsafe at all. Instead, I met many kind, earnest, and gentle people, listened to their current situations, learned how terrorism and social unrest cause people pain, and saw the enormous disparity between rich and poor, how that disparity divides the people, and how the wealthy even build physical walls to discriminate against others. I was able to see, hear, and learn a lot. I think this is an experience and knowledge that you can never get on a trip that just goes around tourist spots. It's a tour that you can learn and experience a lot, and I highly recommend it.

title: A real adventure into the less touristy areas of Lima
text: I highly recommend this tour for anyone who wants to adventure into the less touristy areas of Lima and experience everyday life in Peru. The highlight for us was our lunch with se√±ora Ninfa's house (best salsa I have ever experienced) and our visit to the education center run by a local non-profit organization Grupo Jugando Aprendo (Eveli is the coordinator is amazing, btw). Grupo Jugando Aprendo focuses on empowering and supporting child domestic workers in the area and they do an amazing job! Our tour guide, Alfredo, was also incredible and so knowledgeable. We would choose to go any tour that he is leading.

title: They're just people
text: My wife, Lyndall, and I are lucky. We were born in Australia to loving parents and grew up in stable families.We have been lucky to receive a tertiary education and work in well paid jobs. And we have been fortunate to be able to travel and see some of the world with all its splendour and chaos and beauty and tragedy.So, when Lyndall found the immersion experience we had to do it. To see how 1/3 of the world's most vulnerable live and over 1 million people in Lima.Alfredo was an excellent guide. His English flawless and his manner courteous and respectful at all times. He politely and competently answered all our many questions and spoke with passion and sincerity about the work he was doing in the Human Settlements.The tour encompassed the fish markets where we meet the local fishermen and took a short ride on the water where we saw sea lions, pelicans, and birds diving for fish.From above the harbour, we got fleeting views of the rugged coast and back across the city. We also learned of Lima's dark history with invading colonists, Chili's occupation, and the late 20th century civil unrest.Then we visited the second largest cemetery in the world. In the dank, cool mist of the morning, it's silence was broken only by the baying dogs that live among the dead.At a house high on the slopes of the Human Settlements we met Balbina whose skill with the sewing needle was all that stood between her and desolation. Her products were made with care and love and brightly coloured in the tradition of her ancestors.Lunch was enjoyed with the wonderfully beautiful Neffi. A lovely meal of chicken, rice and beans. Neffi's smile belied the tragic life she had led but emitted a human spirit that was infectious.The final stop was at the after school centre which provided a safe environment for the children and helped with their homework.The overall plight of these people is daunting and almost beyond belief. But there was also hope and joy here. And a belief in the future that was uplifting and inspiring.I asked Alfredo "what should I take away from this experience? What should I tell the people back home? What can I learn?" Without hesitation, he turned to me and said, "remember they're all people, just like everyone else."A great experience and one which we would recommend to anyone visiting Lima that counts themselves among the 8 billion inhabitants of this world we share!

title: See the unexpected side of Lima. Go where you would never get to without this tour.
text: This tour was awesome. It definitely showed a side a Lima that the average North American tourist would not see without taking this type of tour. It was well worth the money and we would recommend it to anyone who wants to see some of the hardest working, modest and friendly people.Alfredo was an excellent guide. His explanations were clear and he is obviously very passionate about the the people his company is trying to help.

title: Great way to learn about Lima
text: Very good way to see parts of Lima outside of the tourist bubble. The tour guide was very knowledgeable, and I learnt a lot more about Lima with this trip.

title: A true taste of Peru -highly recommended
text: Learning from the best. Master chefs teaching you to cook and appreciate the rich food and drinks of Peru. Great facility on a rooftop. Delicious food. Excellent hands-on teaching. Great private class for 4 couples.

title: Must Do in Peru!!
text: A must do if visiting Peru! Not only will you learn to shop for the best ingredients and learn the techniques to cook amazing Peruvian food yourself, you will also learn how Peruvian cuisine came to be. The chefs‚Äô experience, teaching ability and energy made this class one of a kind!

title: Excellent cooking class with chef Hector
text: We did Hector‚Äôs Peruvian classics class for the second time, this time we brought two friends and they absolutely loved it!Hector picked us up himself at our hotel to start with a very informative visit to a local market, explaining all the different products Peru has to offer.Then we started out class, outdoor with a beautiful view of local ru√Øns, cooking ceviche and lomo saltado, topped up with a pisco sour.Hector is very passionate and knowledgable about cooking and food and his humor makes the whole class a joy!After cooking we sat down together to eat our own creations and it was delicious!When the evening came to an end Hector dropped us safely at our hotel.If you like cooking and want to learn something about Peruvian cuisine, this class is highly recommended!

title: Highly recommend this experience
text: Chef Hector is the real deal!  My wife and I started our honeymoon in Lima, Peru before heading to the Peruvian Andes and on our second day were able to have a class with Chef Hector.  What an experience!  Chef Hector's experience at Michelin restaurants was evident and we both learned so much from this class.  We were able to make Pisco Sours, Civeche, and more - learning throughout the time together.  Chef Hector was engaged and very open to all questions from both of us.  The backdrop is unparalleled as you are doing this cooking class from a rooftop while overlooking a centuries-old ruins that are being excavated currently.If you are into food / cooking classes, I would highly recommend this experience.  We did a private class and truly enjoyed.  Being from San Francisco, it was also great to just talk with Hector as well as he had spent a number of years in our hometown.

title: From culinary novices to Nikkei ninjas in one day!
text: From culinary novices to nikkei ninjas in a day! Our cooking class in Lima was great. We learned to make nikkei-style strips (a Peruvian-Japanese fusion, think sashimi with amazing sauces), and chef Hector and his partner exceeded expectations. After choosing fresh fish in the market, we head to a terrace overlooking the Inca ruins to receive a step-by-step lesson on sauces and dishes.Thanks for sharing your secret recipes! We are already preparing them at home, along with the Chilcano cocktail Ricardo taught us: pisco, bitters, ginger soda and fresh ginger juice. A fun, informative and unforgettable experience!

review.title: Top Cooking Class Experience!
review.text: We were beyond pleased with our private cooking class with Chef Hector Aguilar and Chef Martin! The tour to the market was informative and we really enjoyed getting to see all the wonderful fresh products. Then the time at our cooking class was so much fun and we learned a lot! We really were happy with how they took the time to not only show us how to make ceviche and Pisco sours but guided us through the process to learn the steps and try it on our own as well. The friendly nature of Chef Hector and Chef Martin made this experience extra special and we really felt by the end that we had made some new friends in Lima. We would highly recommend this experience to anyone who wants to learn how to make authentic Peruvian food with fun people passionate about their craft!

title: Amazing chefs
text: Simply Amazing. I am a chef with 25 years of experience. I was impressed with the skill and knowledge of H√©ctor and his team10000% recomended.

title: A wonderful day cooking!
text: H√©ctor is truly gifted. This was a great class to learn about Peruvian food, drinks, culture, and recipes. We loved the hands on experience. Hector and his team were patient and kind to us novice ‚Äúcooks.‚Äù We had an amazing time and would highly recommend this class to others wanting to do something different in Peru! We are grateful for the experience and would definitely go back to learn more recipes!

title: Peruvian Classics with Ingenious Modern Tips and a great crew!
text: I love taking cooking classes on vacation to learn about the local food and culture and having had amazing food in Peru, I was looking for an experience  just as stellar.When I found out chef Hector was teaching this class and was previously at Maido, one of my favorite restaurants in Lima, my friends and I signed up!It started off with a morning at the market where Chef Hector gave us some brief information on the history of Peru and how the local foods came to be out of socioeconomic times, immigration and Peruvian 'innovation'. We walked through the market and learnt about what to look out for when buying fish for ceviche, secret spots for great cheese at great prices, and lots of other tips!At the kitchen, we learnt all the items on the menu but the best parts were just learning secret tips from someone who has worked at such high caliber restaurant kitchens!The team is so down to earth and very helpful when you're doing the hands-on portions of the class and they're all fun to be with. Throw in a couple of Pisco sours in there, and a grand meal at the end of the class and you have yourself an amazing experience of a great time in Lima!

title: A varied and interesting birdwatching habitat, with a focus on conservation and education
text: Absolutely fantastic experience. The guides were brilliant. We were accompanied by Manuel, who was passionate and knowledgeable, despite having only been there for a short time. Saw around thirty birds which were new for me in a few short hours, including some incredibly close. Highlights included vermilion flycatchers, many coloured rush tyrants (who are apparently sometimes difficult to spot, but were incredibly obliging for us), Wilson's phalarope, Harris hawks, and many more. Also heard, but not seen, was the very shy least bittern.I'd like to thank again our fantastic guides, who offered not only knowledge of the local wildlife, including insects, spiders and snakes, as well as birds, but also insight on the people and area (in multiple languages as well)  Great value for money and a wonderful birdwatching experience. Highly recommended.

title: Birding with a guide at Pantanos de Villa
text: I went on a private birding tour of Pantanos de Villa with Nicole. She was highly knowldgable and knew where to find my target birds including the Many-colored Rush Tyrant, Peruvian Meadowlark and the Plumbeous Rail. There was also a very nice driver so Nicole and I could focus on the birds. I was picked up promptly at my hotel and delivered back to the hotel.

title: Tranquility near the City
text: The tour was a nice diversion from the hectic city. Nicole was very knowledgable about the birds and we learned a lot. An enjoyable morning!

title: Great birding guide, a real treat!
text: Jorge was a great guide. Kind and well-educated. Very knowledgeable about birds. Could ID by audio on most occasions.Added 19 new species to my life list today! About 58 in total for the day, wonderful!Jorge was also very engaged with the public, who may or may not be as invested in protecting the natural area. But you can see how his passion enables him to inform people and enlist them into the values of conservation.The boat tour as well was a special way to experience the humedal (brackish swamp). It would not have been possible to enter this park during birding hours without his bona fide guide credentials.Some favorites: the many-colored rush tyrant, Peruvian pipit, Peruvian meadowlark, burrowing owls, Peruvian thick-knee, Chilean Flamingo, and Great Grebe!

title: An excellent birdwatching guide
text: Jorge was an excellent birdwatching guide and worked hard to help me find my target birds in Pantanos de Villa and surrounding areas. He was very knowledgeable and great company. My family enjoy nature but would be bored with a typical birdwatching trip, but Jorge did a great job at making sure everybody was having fun. Recommend wholeheartedly.

title: Great tour, lots of birds!
text: Jorge was an amazing guide. Very personable and knowledgeable. He helped me prioritize seeing the birds I wanted to see and talked about other wildlife in the area. Cannot recommend this tour enough!

title: Birding
text: Nicole was a very knowledgeable guide. She had the names of the birds in english & she spoke with very good English. We were picked up & dropped back to our hotel on time. We would definitely use her again.

title: Peaceful morning tour
text: Nicole was an excellent guide. Very friendly and knowlegeable. It was lovely to get away from the bustle ofLima to enjoy nature, see wildlife, and view the beach. I highly recommend this tour.

title: So many birds! Nicole is a great guide!
text: Nicole is so knowledgeable and friendly. I had a wonderful time talking about birds and finding many different species with her. The extra cost of the boat trip was absolutely worth it. I saw my first baby coot in the wild! The location is really neat, with varied habitats and many different kinds of birds. Totally worth the time and money! Thank you so much Nicole!

title: Overpriced
text: The description & prior review are pretty accurate; our guide did their best & we did see about 25 birds in the 1st part (boat for 3 was 12 Pen ~US$4 extra) & saw thousands of birds on beach. With 1000s of birds bring closed, old shoes as you will come back with evidence of 1000s of birds. Only port a potty available in each location. Trip was less than 4 hours including transportation to & from Isidro hotel but could have been longer if we took more photos or had others with us‚Äîit was just my husband & I.

title: Great night tour!!
text: It was a 5. Despite traffic, the driver got us to the locations and really explained a lot along the way about Lima and its rich history.

title: It's worth it
text: Excellent support and attention. The guide is extremely attentive, from the time of scheduling the meeting time until the end of the tour. I highly recommend this tour, especially for those who are on the move to work and have little time but who want to know a bit of the charming Lima.

title: burned out guide that took us local shopping
text: The guide was rude and was not on the right address that I gave him by Text message. He also advised me to ‚Äúrelax‚Äù then the issue was risen. The time that we spend on the main plaza was minimal, we barely could take the pictures.Then the took us to the private tasting that was not on the list. We never saw the panoramic view, he also claimed that he was paid for two hours and the time of magic fountains show is already gone. I claimed that he will have bad review and then we magically got to the next show. I also had the experience of communicating with the local agency that send that guide, and voiced that my expectation was not met. They suggested the vouchers instead for the next tour for Lima.

title: Flexible and Accommodating
text: I had a great time! I had just half a day and wanted a tour in the evening and I felt like this gave me all that I needed in just a few hours. My guide and chauffeur were very flexible when I changed my pick-up location twice and the team was very responsive on WhatsApp. They took me away to see the fountains showing me the highlights and making sure I got to watch the story on the fountains and then took me to the very romantic downtown area which was full of life even in the evening. I was able to ask all my questions and was given a lot of flexibility when I needed to step aside and answer work questions. I highly recommend this tour!

title: Gorgeous at night with no stress!
text: Wonderful and easy way to see Lima at night. I was travel g solo before meeting a tour group and I booked this experience with the hope of getting a broad view of Lima at night and taking photos. Juan Carlos, our driver, navigated Lima‚Äôs busy traffic beautifully, and Carlos, my tour leader, made the evening memorable. He provided lots of historical context and he navigated me around the busy Water Park perfectly.  When we visited Historical Lima we stopped for. Pisco demonstration and tasting. Yum!  I am so glad I booked this tour!  Pro tip:  if you are in Lima on Sunday, book a tour for that day as traffic is more manageable.

title: Great experience.
text: Great private tour. My tour guide was Carlos and he was very knowledgeable and attentive. Excellent host and took all of my pictures as a solo guest.

title: Highly recommended
text: Great experience, great guide and good night tour, the illuminated city center is beautiful, the water park is spectacular.

title: Very cool Water Show
text: Our guide Carlos and our driver Juan were very good hosts, they even accommodated our request to visit Barranco since we knew the Historic Center.The tour was very pleasant and the Parque das √Åguas show was beautiful, and Carlos guided us through all the stages.I recommend!

title: Loved Seeing the City Lit Up!
text: It was wonderful to see Plaza de Armas & Plaza San Martin all lit up at night. They were places that I would not have explored solo in the evening, so it was wonderful to have a great guide like Enrique. He also took me to the amazing Magic Water Circuit and it was so efficient to be guided there because Enrique knew the area so well. It is a large park, and without guidance, I would probably have missed a lot of the fountains. I really enjoyed being with Enrique who shared his amazing knowledge about Lima. I highly recommend it!

title: Experience with the Creator of the Universe
text: We spent interesting hours, we were well oriented and cared for our needs.The ruins show the past of the years and the people who lived there. The view from the sun temple is very beautiful...It gives to imagine how it was centuries ago, a green valley, the sea at the bottom. A pleasant sense of peace.

title: Great experience
text: Booked a private tour for my husband and I. Our guide was great. His English was perfect. Very educational. Funny. Loved it

title: A Great Tour With a Friendly and Knowledgeable English Speaking Guide
text: My wife, son and I joined Carlos on the private tour of Pachacamac and Barranco. The communication via Whatsapp prior to the trip was excellent and timely. The private vehicle was new and very comfortable. Carlos was very knowledgeable and shared the history of Peru and each district we passed through on our trip from Miraflores to the archaeological site. His English is very good and he answered our questions completely. He happily tailored the tour to our particular needs. We highly recommend this tour with Carlos!

title: All about Lima
text: Great private tour with an experienced and knowledgeable tour guide. We were in Lima for a couple of days before heading to Cusco so we decided to book this tour to learn a little about the history of Lima. And that we sure did. We also enjoyed exploring south of Lima. Also I would like to note, I was notified a day before confirming the hotel pickup time and they were right on time the next day. I would highly recommend this tour.

title: A terrible tour company - avoid them!
text: My friend and I had some extra time in Peru at the end of a business trip, and decided to book a tour of Pachacamac because it was relatively close by, and fit the amount of time we had. We found a tour done by ‚ÄúPeru Best Price‚Äù which had good ratings, even though the most recent rating was over a year old. That should have been a red flag for me.Our pick up from the hotel was supposed to be at 9 AM, but by 9:15 AM they had not shown or emailed to say they were going to be late, up so I contacted the company. The phone connection was poor so they contacted me on WhatsApp. I asked the driver what the problem was, and he said that they could not do the tour today because of ‚ÄúCOVID-19 policies‚Äú which he claimed required that you book reservations ‚Äú5 days in advance.‚Äù I told him that there was nothing on the website which specified that, and that the system allowed us to select the date and time we wanted, and that I was unhappy. He then advised he was going to contact the facility, and a few minutes later wrote that he ‚Äúmight‚Äú be able to get us an afternoon tour. I told the tour operator that would not fit with our schedule, and said that if we had to book 5 days in advance, why is it we would be able to do an afternoon tour, but not the morning tour that we bought, and he had no response.I told him it was very poor customer service to make me have to track him down to find out why nobody had shown up, and his response was that we could ask for a refund!My advice is to avoid this company at all costs. They will not contact you, will leave you high and dry, and then when you press them on something, their answer is that you can ask for a refund. I am sure there are better tour companies out there, and I would never use these people again. I also do not know why Viator has them listed as an available option, when it is pretty clear they have such poor customer service.

title: Great 1/2 day tour
text: My wife and I did this tour while waiting on a group tour to arrive. We were very pleased with Carlos and the driver Mr David. Carlos spoke great English and was very knowledgeable about Peru and the history of the places we visited.

title: Awesome private tour with Jordan!
text: Booked private tour for 4 adults. Had an awesome private tour by Jordan and his driver. He spoke very good English and was very knowledgeable about the sites.

title: Such a great tour!
text: Carlos was a fabulous tour guide. Very knowledgeable, kind, and helpful. Would definitely recommend this tour to anyone visiting Lima.

title: Great solo trip to Pachacamac
text: Carlos my guide met me at the hotel and we spent 3 hours touring Lima and the incredible Pachamac location. He is a senior guide with the Ministry of Tourism and was allowed to drive his vehicle within the National Park, other guides and guests had to walk a fair distance to see the Temples. We climbed the main Temple and also took me to see a convent next door from the Incas. His knowledge of the different civilizations and how they evolved allowed me to have a clearer picture of the base of the Inca Empire. I would recommend this tour highly.

title: Wonderful tour
text: My husband and I did this tour on our first day in Lima. Our guide, Jean-Paul, was so knowledgeable and gave us the history in such an interesting manner. The site is very much worth the visit- it was an amazing site and we learned so much about the history of Peru. Stopping at Barranca on the way back showed us another personality of this diverse city.I highly recommend this tour and this tour company. The guide and driver were outstanding.

title: Lovin‚Äô Lima
text: Wonderful experience. Well spoken and informed, Jocelyn, expertly guided us to and around the city center with many stops to discuss the historical and cultural details of the city. Hard to cover it all but received a good overview of Lima.

title: Perfect tour of neighbourhoods
text: This tour was exactly what we wanted. We saw three neighbourhoods and Jocelyn was perfect -in her English and her knowledge and accommodating at the pace that we liked. It truly was a perfect private tour and much better than we ever expected! She was a delight!

title: Perfect private walking tour of the historic centre of Lima
text: Our tour guide (Yosselyn) was amazing. She was so knowledgeable and was able to customise our tour according to our interests because we booked a private tour. We learned so much and saw everything we wanted to see. Would definitely recommend !

title: Walking tour of Lima
text: We had a large group (12). Viator recommended a private car for 130USD. We declined and opted for public transportation as the tour was advertised. Jocelyn met us at our hotel in Miraflores and took us on a bus to Barranco, then on another bus to the city center. We saw the main squares, cathedrals, the presidential palace, and walked down Jiron de la Union (a pedestrian shopping street). She offered good information about the sites, some history, and a glimpse of the contemporary Peruvian political environment. I thought we would be finished in the city center, but she accompanied us back to Miraflores on another bus. I‚Äôm not sure how the private car would have been incorporated into a walking tour, but we were pleased with our decision.

title: A must in Lima. Walking tour recommended
text: David was very friendly and patient all the time since we were busy doing Pictures. He know alot of the past of the city which was very interesting. If you book the walk tour like we did, take some confortable shoes

title: The Best of Lima in One Day
text: Jorge was wonderful. We were only in Lima for a day before heading on to Cusco, and our guide helped us make the most of it. We visited Lovers Park in Miraflores and the Bridge of Sighs in Barranco. We also got to watch the rehearsal for some of the Independence Day celebrations at the Governor‚Äôs Palace. We tasted chocolates and Pisco. The people of Lima are lovely and friendly and Jorge was extremely knowledgeable about his country and city. He took great photos of my wife and I and knew right where to go to get the great shots. We highly recommend him.

title: The best sightseeing tour in the year
text: In November 2019 I had a tour with Julio, and now I can say that it was my best sightseeing tour in the year.Julio is a nice guide/buddy, and this tour is very well organized.Julio picked me up by calling me to my room at the hotel front desk exactly at 9:00AM.During the tour we saw many places of Lima, including the local market, the historic center, Parque de la Muralla and Barranco District. Julio knows every aspect of Lima transportation system, so we were able to move between important places quickly and without traffic jams.The tour took 4 hours, and they were action-packed hours. You won't be able to finish early and in fact you will be a little exhausted after the tour.I recommend that you take this particular sightseeing tour and another tour outside of Lima. While this is a good tour, there is a lot places you need to see outside of Lima in Peru.

I took this tour because I had only one day in Lima and I wanted to discover as much as possible with an experienced guide so I could see and learn as much as possible.My guide was Julio Molina and he was simply exceptional!! He had so much knowledge it was incredible. He was also kind, flexible and very accommodating!Seriously, if your guide is Julio, trust me you're going to have the best tour ever!We went from the historic centre, to the local food market; saw the authentic life of Lime√±os and the more touristical Barranco; we had passion fruit cold brew and empanadas; and we were lucky enough to witness a celebration of people from Cusco for San Esteban, which Julio kindly accepted we watch. Indeed, he never rushed me about time and allowed me to ingest all the culture and food at my own pace.Can't give enough compliments about Julio and the tour he gave me. It's worth every penny!Thank you Julio and America Viajes!

title: Time very well spent
text: We had a walking tour of the city for approximately 4 hours and at all times Jocelyn our tour guide was friendly and was very prepared to answer our questions. The colony architectural contrast and vestiges of the Inca culture make this city have incredible diversity.

title: Half day tour
text: I visited the city after a trip to Cusco, it was a very good way to end my visit to Peru. Thanks for being very explanatory Jorge, our guide was great.

title: Alberto will Surf you from A to B. Its in his name.
text: To learn the skills for surfing and have a great session of waves Alberto is your man! He made sure I was in the right spot at the exact moment. Returned the mext day for a second session and saw my skills continue to improve.

title: Wonderful experience! Incredible teaching! Would highly recommend!
text: We booked a surf lesson with Team Surf Per√∫ for two first-time surfers! We had a wonderful experience, Kerry was an exceptional teacher!! Super patient and we got very individualized help and feedback. I‚Äôm so glad we did this while in Lima! It was a great experience for beginner surfers though I‚Äôm sure that team surf Per√∫ is more than capable of teaching advanced surfers too! Kerry was very kind and gave fantastic Lima recommendations as well! I‚Äôm super grateful to team surf Per√∫ for making our time surfing in Lima epic! ü§ô

title: Great instruction and gear.
text: Alberto is a great surf sup instructor with the best equipment. He has a large quiver of the top Starboard boards for all abilities. I am a beginner, but he can instructor at the expert level. Lots of great tips from him and his assistant Kerry. Location is perfect for SUP.

title: Great time with Team Surf Peru!
text: A lot of fun! My wife and I did a 1-hour surf lesson with Team Surf Peru in Lima. Kerry and Alberto were great! They explain very well, they have all you need in terms of equipment and they value safety. We enjoyed it a lot and managed to stand on the board üéâ Definitely recommend Team Surf Peru for surfing lessons in Lima!

title: Best surfing lesson ever
text: The lesson is amazing, coach is very knowledgeable and friendly, wave is nice to catch, highly recommended for beginners.

title: A great experience!
text: Alberto and Kerry were great.  Easy to find and lots of fun for a novice surfer.  Even I caught some waves - who knew!  Thank you!

title: Solo surf lessons
text: I took surf lessons on two mornings during my time in Lima. The team was attentive and professional to where I saw my performance definitely improve. There's a reason why I went twice! Highly recommend.

title: Amazing surf lessons and the best people!
text: Amazing surf lessons and the best people! Our instructor Kerry made sure that we caught a lot of waves and we had the best time surfing with her. If you are in Lima you need to take a surf lesson with these guys.

title: Great teacher, great price
text: Alberto and Valerie were great teachers, first ever surf lesson, booked 2 days in a row and my confidence progressed massively. Alberto has so many experience, very enjoyable and will continue my surf journey thanks to the help of the team

title: Great surf lessons in Lima
text: Incredible lessons in Lima, great instructors, knowledgeable, helpful, accommodating, ended up going 2 days in a row! If you want surf lessons in Lima, how with Serf Peru!

title: Important tour to do in Lima
text: It was a great tour. I can imagine even that it could be longer and cover bigger part of Villa El Salvador, but overall it was a great and important experience.

title: Highly recommended
text: Very interesting and rewarding experience, my guide Giovanna shared information and stories of the community and the whole Lima. Highly recommended

title: Shanty tour
text: We had Giovanna as our tour guide and Mr M as our driver . They were truly amazing! We walked around the local market and visited a local neighborhood. We were lucky to see the real and traditional side of Peru! It‚Äôs definitely worth it

title: The best way to see Lima
text: This tour was the best part of my Lima adventure. The organization and care from the company is unmatched. Leo did an amazing job as my guide. All the locals knew and loved him. I would highly recommend!

title: Meaningful and Inspiring Shanti Tour with Jos√© ‚Äì Highly Recommended!
text: We had a fantastic experience today on our Shanti Tour through Lima with our guide, Jos√©. He picked us up from our hotel right on time, and from the beginning, we felt well taken care of.Our first stop was Villa El Salvador, where we visited a local market. This was a great and authentic experience ‚Äì we spoke with local vendors, had the chance to try some products, and could even buy something if we wanted. It really gave us a feel for the local atmosphere.After that, we headed to Velo Horizonte, where we visited several social projects that are supported by this tour. These included a school for children, a center for the elderly, and a community soup kitchen. Each visit was informative and eye-opening. Jos√© explained everything very clearly and gave us a deep insight into the daily life and challenges in the area.He spoke excellent English and was able to answer all our questions thoroughly and thoughtfully. His calm and respectful manner made the whole experience even more meaningful.This tour goes beyond traditional sightseeing ‚Äì it offers real perspective and supports important local initiatives. We left with a lot to think about and a deep appreciation for the community work being done.100% recommended ‚Äì amazing guide, great service, and a tour that truly makes a difference!

title: One-of-a-kind experience!
text: This was definitely a one-of-a-kind experience unlike any other touristy tours offered in Lima. I am so glad I decided to go on this experience and get to meet Tuanama who is such an inspiration. My guide, Maverick, was also so friendly and knowledgeable. I went on the tour as a solo female and felt safe the entire time. I highly recommend this experience if you want something that you‚Äôll remember for a lifetime!

title: Awesome experience!
text: This was a memorable tour. Paola and Cesar did a great job sharing the history of Lima and the Shanty towns. Being able to visit a local market and the soup kitchen was a great experience. The locals we met and interacted with very friendly. Our driver was courteous and drove safely. We recommend this tour to anyone that wants to experience something different than the touristy areas of Lima.

title: Great!
text: A great experience in this area of Lima. Local market with interesting exchange with some traders. Nice meeting with the community leader. Leonardo is a kind and very friendly guide. There are no taboo questions with him.

title: A Side of Lima One Should See!
text: This was a most interesting and humbling tour. JJ navigated us through the community with respect and kindness to all we met. The tour takes you out of the city and into the lives of those less fortunate. I loved meeting the woman who runs the community kitchen and is a real change agent for the neighborhood.Bring water and he prepared to climb some steps. This was one of the best tours I have ever taken. What a great idea from Haku Tours!

title: A great shantytown experience
text: Gaby and Paola were great hosts very knowledgeable and very pleasant,the trip was very interesting and enjoyable, we weren‚Äôt rushed and had plenty of time to see the markets the soup kitchen and the surrounding area, I would highly recommend this trip.

title: Incredible
text: Karina and Caesar are the absolute best!!!! I went into this experience with no expectations and came out with an unforgettable experience! Highly highly recommend!

title: Highly recommend this authentic and yummy experience.
text: Giovanna our guide and Ruth our chef really went all out!   The entire experience from start to finish was authentic, cleverly planned and our participation in every aspect of our adventure was delightful.The food we made was delicious and traditional.  The preparation was thoughtful and educational.  Sharing the courses with our hosts made it special. We shared  lots of great conversation and we learned a lot. Both of us love food and love to cook.  This was a real treat.  We left with recipes in hand.

title: Fun tour in Lima!
text: Tour guide (Caesar) was very engaging and made the tour fun. We loved tasting all the exotic fruit. Corina the chef was a fantastic cook and we learned so much about Peruvian food.

title: Do your taste buds a flavour
text: What an amazing experience! Our guide (Cesar), bus driver (Julio) and chef (Ruth) provided a wonderful class and tour. The ingredients were fresh, the recipes were perfect and overall vibe, tremendous.

title: Bat Peruvian Experience we have had so far!
text: Absolutely wonderful tour! Cesar and chef Ruth were fabulous! Educational, entertaining and deliciousü•∞Best experience we have had so far!

title: Excellent Guide and Chef for the cooking class - perfect day. Well organized with great cooking tips and tricks!
text: Awesome tour guide and staff for the cooking class. Vet interactive and helpful with spices and unique recipes. Great Fun

title: Great experience!
text: We had an excellent time with this tour! Cesar and Ruth were very knowledgeable and helped us make an excellent meal. It was very fun to learn about Peruvian food and taste the delicious flavors.

title: Amazing tour
text: Great experience! Cesar and Ruth were great. Fun learning how to cook different classic foods. Everything was super tasty

title: Large group trip- great food, great guides, great environment and great fun!
text: Very fun and energetic guides. Funny and kind and definitely made the experience more special. Lots of food- fun drink options. Also the tour was cool and they were knowledgeable. Also got a fun little bit Peruvian gift at the end‚Ä¶ this class was definitely a highlight of the trip. I liked that they were lots of courses. My guides were Ceasar, Paloa, and Joesp(h). 10:10 recommend! The tour was a cool way to learn and then do! Immersive and educational on culture. We also got fun hats and aprons- I didn‚Äôt get that at other classes.
Cesar, Paola, and Joseph were amazing!!! Had a great time 10/10 recommend!! The food and drinks were wonderful. Great experience overall!
name: Amazing experience
