title: Amazing experience
text: Cesar, Paola, and Joseph were amazing!!! Had a great time 10/10 recommend!! The food and drinks were wonderful. Great experience overall!

title: Excellent!!!
text: Cesar & Elizabeth were excellent. Great guide from start to finish we learned so much. This tour was an excellent mix of food & discovery of Lima

title: Cesar is the best guide!
text: Cesar was an absolutely incredible guide! The food was absolutely delicious and we saw so many parts of Lima that we wouldn√© have seen otherwise. Elisabeth our driver was a very safe driver! Would definitely do again!

title: interesting and delicious tour
text: A wonderful tour that combined exploring interesting, lesser-known neighborhoods of the city with exceptionally delicious Peruvian food tastings. Our guide, Paula, was excellent ‚Äì knowledgeable, full of fascinating stories, and super nice and fun. It was a fantastic half-day; highly recommend!

title: Must Visit with a Local!
text: Excellent tour with Aaron who is punctual, friendly, knowledge and an excellent conversationalist buddy.   Every food stop was authentic and delicious. Aaron was full of information of his country. I have tried food that I would never would have tried myself  but Aaron picked up the cleanest and best food stops in the tour.  I have thoroughly enjoyed the tour.  Highly recommended!!

title: Nice way to get to know Lima
text: Giovana took us for a beautiful walk through Lima, with history, churros and pico sour. His knowledge of the city is well expressed with enthusiasm and humor.

title: Great experience!
text: Our tour guide Aaron was very friendly! He was able to deliver the information in both languages, English and Spanish. He knew what he was talking about and always showed enthusiasm and passion about his job. We highly recommend this tour! Even the driver was so gently and kind!

title: Amazing tour guide
text: Silvana was amazing!!! She is so knowledgeable and super sweet. We had great conversations with her and the food was amazing. I definitely recommend booking this tour it is absolutely worth it!

title: Highly recommend
text: Even though we took this tour at the end of our vacation in Peru, we were still introduced to new foods - Amazonian fruits being one highlight. Edwin took us to 3+ neighborhoods and shared really interesting insights about his experience growing up on the outskirts of Lima when we asked. Highly recommend.

title: Great tour - highly recommend!
text: Edwin provided a fantastic tour of the local markets and restaurants of Lima, all in non-touristic areas. It was a brilliant introduction to the foods of Peru, as well as the culture and history. Edwin was a great host. I would highly recommend this tour!

title: AMAZING
text: Stephano was amazing. I immensely enjoyed the food tour. All the food was extremely delicious. I am a pescatarian and I got the most amazing seafood. I learned a lot. Stephano is extremely knowledgeable.This tour is extremely essential to enjoying and appreciating Lima. Highly recommended!

title: Lima Fantastic City Tour, Dinner & Magic Water Circuit
text: We booked the City Tour + Dinner + Magic Water Circuit with Haku Tours and it was the perfect way to start our trip in Peru. Our guide Sa√∫l was outstanding ‚Äî knowledgeable, fun, and passionate about Lima‚Äôs history, culture, and architecture. We explored the Historic Center with its palaces, mansions, and catacombs, enjoyed a delicious authentic dinner (with Sa√∫l helping us pick the best dishes), and ended the night at the Magic Water Circuit. We even stumbled upon a parade, and Sa√∫l made it extra special by explaining all the details. Highly recommend Haku Tours and Sa√∫l!

title: Absolutely Fantastic Trip and Guide
text: We saw everything on the itinerary and more, knowledge and information from the Guide Gabriel (Gabby) was incredible, included were snacks and meal, this is undoubtedly the best trip we have ever done total value for money, thank you Gabby.

title: Amazing tour because of our guide!
text: I had an amazing time on this tour! Cesar was our guide and he was absolutely fantastic!!!! He went above and beyond to make sure we understood the history of Peru and, since I was celebrating my birthday, he was recommended so incredible places to go that turned out great. You absolutely want Caesar as your guide!

title: BEST TOUR EVER
text: I HAD THE MOST AMAZING TIME on this tour. My guide, Nataly, was VERY informative,  knowledgeable, & Fun. The water park was my Favorite part. The entire tour was worth it. I never write a review, but I felt completely obligated to write this. BEST TOUR EVER...

title: Perfect Limatour
text: Is recommended Very good guide o tour We did see very much of central Lima in 6 hours The guide was absolutely Perfect Walking in slow speed It was very hot

title: History, Food, Spirits and bones
text: It‚Äôs was a great tour, our guild Junior was friendly and the tour was very informative. We loved the local street food.....

title: Great Experience with Haku Tours
text: Haku Tours was amazing! We did 3 tours in a full day that took us from the south to the north of Lima. Edwin and his staff made us feel welcomed just like family. Our tour experience was more intimate then with a large group of ppl. When I come back I would definitely schedule more tours with Haku. When you travel to Lima hit up Haku Tours for your Lima experience!

title: Excellent service
text: Excellent service, complied with everything agreed, punctuality, kindness, good transfer. Special mention to our guide, Junior, very kind, concerned, widely prepared. Absolutely recommended

title: Excellent tour hitting many high points in the city of Lima.
text: Our tour guide Aura was excellent. Very knowledgeable, very personable. The Franciscan Cathedral and Catacombs and the Magic Water Show were especially unique and memorable.

title: Enjoyed & would recommend!
text: Took this tour on my first full day in Lima as an intro to downtown Lima. The pickup was on time as promised and the driver was superb at navigating Lima‚Äôs crazy traffic. Cesar is an upbeat, cheerful, and friendly guide who answered all of our questions and even treated us to muy delicioso churros! The catacombs were definitely a highlight of the tour. I was the only one of the group to stay past the tour for dinner and the water show. Dinner felt like I eating out with a friend, and he even gave me some tips and advice on questions I had about my travels in Peru after leaving Lima. The water show was well done & entertaining. The tour didn‚Äôt feel rushed, either.I would recommend and ask for Cesar! (And tell him I tried the picarones and am a big fan!!)

title: Prepare to reek for days
text: It really wasn‚Äôt exactly as described‚Ä¶ there were no snacks as advertised, the boat was not clean, and even though I‚Äôve washed myself 3 times with lots of soap over the last 4 hours, the stench of that guano and sea lion excrement filled water is still quite present. On the plus side, they were very interesting, but the choppy and icy cold water was very unpleasant. Oh the stench‚Ä¶

title: Swimming with Sea Lions
text: We had an excellent tour going from Callao port via yacht to Palomino Island. There were hundreds of sea lions! Many were in the water with us. They were fun and entertaining. There are only four tour companies that are allowed to do this through Peru‚Äôs national park service. The crew is the boat was attentive and knowledgeable. On the return trip we even saw Humboldt penguins! Our only advice would be to bring your own snacks and water. Even though they say on Trip Advisor that this is provided, it is not. Other tour people were nice to share with us though. We were the only two people who joined the tour off of a cruise ship but they got us back in plenty of time.

title: One of the coolest attractions in Lima. Swimming with the lions was very quirky and cool.
text: Very interesting adventure. The transfer from the hotel to the bay was by taxi. Excellent. From the bay to Palomino Island we went by yacht, which was also very good. Swimming with the lions was fantastic, they are docile and very cute animals.I recommend.

title: 100% honest
text: The experience around the sea lions was cool, scary but cool. The guide was really nice. The excursion needs some upgrades for the price paid. I recommend a fluent guide, someone that can really explain what people are seeing. I only recall receiving info on the way to Palomino about the surrounding islands but no info was given on the way back to the dock. We fell asleep at that point. No snacks were given although it was supposed to be included. Refreshments and snacks should be mandatory since it's a long ride plus swimming makes you tired/hungry. If not, it needs to be removed off the description and customers should be advised to bring their own.Overall, it was cool but Idk if I would do it again with this company unless they made changes. I own successful American businesses, so please use this info to get better! This could be a great excursion but there are needed changes! Also, you should mention that towels should be brought. The customer wouldn't know if you didn't tell them but I did appreciate the blanket by the guide. He was really sweet. He swims very very well also, so I felt very safe

title: Terrible Experience!
text: Transportation was provided by TripAdvisor, yet the driver didn't know where to drop us off.  While stopping to ask for directions multiple times, we missed the boat and got placed with another provider.The "yacht" had mechanical problems keeping us in the marina for an hour.  We finally got going yet limped out to Palomino Island (on the way back, we were going so slowly, we couldn't out run the smoke coming from engine).  The boat had no towels (the ad did not say anything about bringing towels to swim with sea dogs!), the water was quite cold, and it was only about 20¬∞C with a breeze.We are looking for a refund.  We were charged over $500US and this was NOT a good experience!!!!!!!

title: Not good
text: This was a bad experience. The taxi they sent got lost, we missed the boat and they put us on another boat that broke down and the engine was smoking. It was not at all the experience we paid for.

title: Amazing experience
text: This is one of the coolest interactions with nature you'll ever have. The sea lions were amazing and so curious. The crew was great, boat was clean and nice. I highly recommend.

title: Ocean, boat ride, nature, and animals
text: Seeing Peru from the viewpoint of the ocean is beautiful, the boat ride is both relaxing and adventurous, and swimming with the sea lions is nothing less than special and a unique experience.

title: Amazing Tour
text: Amazing experience. The boat ride was fun and we saw a ton of wildlife. Spotted 2 whales üê≥ coming up for air. The sea lions were spectacular and there were so many. Even though the water was freezing cold ü•∂ I would totally do this tour again. We got so close to the rock and saw sea lions swimming in the water with us.ü¶≠

title: Book your adventure confidently!
text: The hotel pickup helped me meet other people in smaller groups so I wasn‚Äôt anxious when we met up with the larger group. Once we got underway, it was a myriad of sights, sounds, and even smells. I don‚Äôt know that my trip would have been complete without this excursion and the company putting it together was awesome! Book confidently!

title: Five Stars for Vista Adventures ‚Äì The Best in Lima!
text: I can‚Äôt recommend Vista Adventures enough! We ended up booking three different tours with them because each one was so well organized and enjoyable. They were incredibly accommodating, especially considering we had little ones with us. Whether it was the city tour or our trip to Paracas, the guide was always sweet, patient, and impressively knowledgeable.What really stood out was the private tour experience ‚Äî having our own van made everything smoother and more comfortable. On one of the full-day tours, lunch was included and it was delicious, a thoughtful touch that made the day even better.Their WhatsApp responsiveness was excellent. I was able to arrange our last tours quickly and easily, and they were always clear, efficient, and helpful. Vista Adventures will definitely be my go-to for any future trips in Peru. Thank you for making our time in Lima so memorable!

title: A tour to remember!
text: Covered all the main sights and our guide gave a great insight into the Peruvian and Lima cultures. Very informative and interesting. Recommend this!

title: Private tour of Lima with family. Very good experience!
text: Private tour of Lima with family (2 adults and 1 teenager), organized the same morning in a hurry and despite that, a great experience. Our guide Sofia was excellent and very dynamic in adapting to our wishes and constraints. Pick-up from the hotel is very convenient. We only had one day in ‚Äútransit‚Äù in Lima, and this 4 hour tour served its purpose perfectly. To recommend !Note the great responsiveness and professionalism of the Vista Adventures agency.

title: Amazing tour of Lima
text: The tour was great! Amazing views, our guide Susan was very knowledgeable, friendly, helpful and took amazing pictures of us.Susan and the  Victor (driver) picked us up on time at our Airbnb, they had water and snacks for us, Victor was a class A driver. They work well as a team and we had a great time. I highly recommend them.

title: Quick and fairly comprehensive tour of Lima
text: Great tour of Lima for people with limited time. Was able to squeeze in the tour between a layover. Guide was really knowledgeable and friendly! Highly recommend, pick up and dropoff at airport for a little more.

title: Very Professional Tour
text: The itinerary followed as described in the promotional info. The guide who spoke perfect English was experienced, polite, and very knowledgeable. There were only 2 of us tourists and we walked about 4 miles with our guide while touring the city central. We drove through San Isidro and Miraflores. We stopped at the Love Park which was the highlight of the trip. The well landscaped park has beautiful tile displays, a beautiful couple statue, and a great view of the ocean and coastline. The 4 hour tour lasted 6 hours as the driver compensated for the horrendous traffic. The driver was a pro and navigated the traffic in a very safe efficient manner. We recommend this tour.

title: Excellent tour and Maria very good guide
text: Excellent tour, Maria our guide explained very well the history of the church and the catacombs, as well as other interesting facts of Lima.The waters show very nice and entertaining.Mention apart Maria's willingness and kindness that she had with my grandmother as she presented some problems as an older adult but Maria helped a lot so that she could also enjoy the experience.10000% recommended

title: Very well organized and complete tour
text: This was a great tour. They picked us up from the hotel on time. There was water and cookies waiting for us in the van. It ended up being a private tour for the two of us. We drove around the city for a little while looking at sites. Our tour guide spoke excellent English and gave a nice history of the buildings. We stopped first at the convent and catacombs and she was able to skip the lines to get in and keep us ahead of all of the other tour groups to avoid the crowds a bit. We went around the square and saw the city buildings as well. There was a wedding that we stopped to watch for a bit. She then took us to the water circuit show and showed us the fountains and the history of each and recommended the best places to watch the water show. It was very nicely done and all of the entrance fees were included (except 2 soles for the bathroom in the water circuit if you needed it).

title: Catacombs, magic water show, tour of the city
text: An amazing tour with beautiful views. Also the tour guide was phenomenal and very knowledgeable. I would totally do it again.

title: Great experience
text: From pick up to drop off this tour was awesome. Kenyi skillfully drove us from site to site in busy traffic. Walter was a wealth of knowledge explaining the Convent, catacombs, historic downtown and Circuito Magica Del Aqua. Always seeing if we had any questions. Walter also took pictures for us and video as our phone wasn‚Äôt taking good pictures. He forwarded them to us after the tour so we have some great pictures and video. A fun professional tour we really enjoyed

title: Amazing but so cheap
text: Wow!!! We were all so so impressed, I can completely see why this is the best water show in the world. Unbelievable, and only for 4 PEN! Make sure you buy yourself a churro too

title: OK ish
text: Guide was great. Just seemed to spend more time in traffic then at the attractions but I suppose that‚Äôs just Lima. Catacombs fascinating and fully explained. Water fountains bit of a let down. Just a projected show onto the fountains

title: Great late afternoon/ evening option for Lima
text: This is a great way to see the catacombs and light show. Although you could see these places more cheaply independently, the combination of a knowledgeable tour guide (we had Susan show us around, she had so much local knowledge‚Ä¶ right down to the best photo opportunities) and transport (we had Kenyi drive us around) allows you to get much more out of the experience, whilst feeling very safe.

title: Thank you Alex (Alexandra)!!!
text: Amazing experience, and it's all thanks to Alex! She was so friendly and very knowledgeable about Peru and Lima. We learned a lot about the history of Peru, and she also gave us a lot of information as we walked through the historic area of Lima. The Water Magic Circuit was a really cool experience and the bicentennial show was impressive, giving a concise, visual summary of Peru's history. Wonderful evening and it far exceeded my expectations.

title: Great way to spend an evening!
text: Very interesting tour! It included more sites than I expected. The guide was very knowledgable and friendly. We had lots of fun and learned some things too!

title: Fountains are Amazing
text: Seeing the fountains at night was amazing. Puts the Bellagio a bit to shame. The colours, the lights and the amazing laser and picture projection was off the charts. It was a beautiful park and the light show is a must. Lots of room and good views but not a lot of seating. Most people had to stand.

title: Great experience
text: It was an experience that was hard to experience. The water was 16C and cold, but it was nice to swim with them. You should swim together at least once.

title: Disappointing and disorganized
text: The tour company changed the departure time the morning of our excursion. The driver who picked us up from our accommodation was very polite and professional and on time. This tour had the potential to be amazing. The views were awesome. The wildlife was everywhere. Reason for my low rating was the disorganization on board. We were directed to change into wetsuits in a very small crowded area in choppy waters. Everyone was crashing into one another and the staff were not very helpful with their direction. The wetsuits were old and tattered smelly and wet. It seemed as though there were too many guests on board for everyone to be comfortable. Being in the water was chaotic. Very choppy waters and very little direction from staff of where and what to do.It was advertised that there were beverages and snacks on board. Nothing was offered to me or my family. It was advertised that pictures were available for purchase. Nothing was provided to us to view or purchase.I have been on tours all over the world (Egypt, Jordan, Thailand, Mexico, Dominican, Israel) and this was the most disorganized and disappointing tour I have ever been on.

title: excellent guide. amazing experience
text: Wonderful scenic boat ride with excellent guide. Amazing swimming experience with the seals (even in the chilly water.

title: Unforgettable experience
text: Great experience. Unique place with thousands os sea lions and swimming with them was unforgettable experience. Tour was well run and guide Alex was great.

title: Incredible experience
text: This was an absolutely incredible experience. We got to see penguins, so many other birds, and of course sea lions! The water was freezing but completely worth it. I've visited 29 countries and this was in the top 5 experiences I've ever had! Sea lions are so curious and cute. Don't hesitate to book.

title: Swimming with Sea Lions
text: This experience was amazing. I do recommend take this tour. I had really good time and I expected that water will be very cold but was everything was perfect.

title: MASSIFICATION
text: Good morning, I just got home after a week on the MSC EURIBIA Cruise, and unfortunately I was disappointed. It‚Äôs the fourth cruise I‚Äôve done and the best thing about this is that the ship is new and clean. But I have to say that the overcrowding is excessive, the vessel is large but the number of passengers is excessive, the buffet is large but the overcrowding smears it, the dining room, for breakfast I have not had an opportunity to access and at lunchtime at 13:30 it is closed.  What time do we eat Italians and Spaniards ???, at 12,00 to 13,00 ???, well no, let alone on holiday. The service of the waiters at the Sky Lounge and the dinner restaurant, excellent. But I repeat EXCESS PASSAGE.

title: Palomino Islands - swimming with sea lion
text: Excellent experience. Highly recommend. Hundred of sea lions rush to you when jump into water. They are excited and curiously. Must stretch out your hands and feet, they will kiss your back of hand and toes. Water is really cold and rough, but wet suit is short sleeve, wonder why it is not a long sleeve? Tour guide is good. He help to took photo for us, even dive into water to take sea lion's somersault photo.

title: Amazing tour!
text: Amazing excursion! I could not believe how close the sea lions got to us. One of them kissed my feet. Rodrigo was an awesome guide and was super knowledgeable. Vista Adventures was awesome, answering messages very quickly. Highly recommended!

title: Highly recommend
text: Loved swimming with the seals and probably the top 10 things I‚Äôve done in my life! Unbelievable experience. We booked the tour 6pm the night before. We were picked up at 9am the following morning! We had the best day. Just remember to take your waterproof go pro or a waterproof phone cover. You won‚Äôt regret doing this tour. It‚Äôs an experience we will remember forever! Highly recommend.

title: Amazing experience!
text: We had a great time with Hector. We started in the market and gave us his insights on Peruvian cuisine And how he chooses ingredients. We then had the class and it was great to learn new techniques and how to use ingredients from such a skilled chef. Would highly recommend this class it was amazing.

title: A great experience
text: The walk around the market was fascinating and gave a real insight into how to select fish. In addition we learned a lot about local produceThe cooking course itself have a real insight into the world of a Chef. The food we produced and ate at the end was deliciousHector is an interesting man and well worth talking to about a range of subjectsWhy 4 Stars and not 5? I felt that more time could have been spent explaining what was being done and requiredWould I do it again. Definite

title: A MUST!
text: If you want a unique Peruvian experience, BOOK THIS. It was my birthday and Maido made sure that I had the best day I could wish for.It started with the market visit, and he gave such a detailed history on Peruvian food which made it much more interesting.Then we got to cook outside on this beautiful terrace in front of the historical site Sitio Huaca Pucllana. I would definitely recommend if you want to do something more than just visit. PLUS the food was amazing.

title: A perfect experience!
text: Thhis was simply an amazing experience! The chef picked us up and took us to a market where we had a wonderful tour and a special ceviche prepared for us. Chef Hector is super smart, funny and highly creative. Back at the school we were guided through the process of making several dishes. All was done with humor and kindness. All 3 of us are pretty good cooks but we still learned so much! We concluded with sharing this fabulous meal. It was a lot of fun and very instructive. I might add that the view from the rooftop school is fantastic!

title: Outstanding Cooking Class + Fishmarkt visit in Lima ‚Äì An Unforgettable Experience!
text: Outstanding Cooking Class + Fishmarket visit in Lima ‚Äì An Unforgettable Experience!This cooking class was simply exceptional! Our adventure began as early as 4 AM with a visit to the fish market, where we selected the freshest fish and seafood for our meal later in the day. The entire experience was flawlessly organized, everything ran smoothly, and the passion behind it was truly evident.What impressed me the most was the warm, family-like atmosphere ‚Äì you instantly feel welcome and well taken care of. But the absolute highlight was, of course, the food: The fish and seafood were of a quality I had never experienced before. Even though I usually don‚Äôt eat much seafood, this meal was simply spectacular ‚Äì fresh, perfectly prepared, and incredibly flavorful.This cooking class is an absolute must for anyone visiting Lima who wants to experience something truly special in the culinary world!

title: great class and tour
text: amazing classÔºåThe atmosphere is relaxed and fun, and the food is delicious. Hector is an amazing chef and taught us a lot.

title: Fantastic Experience
text: It was a fantastic experience from the moment we booked, the communication and coordination prior to our arrival, the market visit and cooking class, the FOOD, and continuing through to the afterglow we felt when it was all over‚Ä¶ or was that the chilcanos and pisco sours?  Either way, we could not have been happier. Our family of five arrived in Lima late in the evening, including three twenty something children, and we were looking forward to starting our exploration of Per√∫. Hector was an excellent guide on our journey and if we could give this 6 stars we would!  The food was amazing and the class was a hands on experience like no other. We learned new techniques and experienced flavors and textures galore. It was a great first day in Lima where food was the vehicle through which we learned about the history, dynamic culture and fusion of cultures which is Per√∫.

title: A unique, fun, and tasty experience
text: I highly recommend this class. Market shopping and cooking with Hector is like hanging out with an old friend...if your friend was an insanely good chef! Everyone had a great time, great views (rooftop kitchen), and no-one went hungry -- there was enough for 3 extra people! This is a unique and fun experience.

title: Absolutely great, worth it. This is the class you want to book
text: Had a wonderful cooking class with Ricardo and Hector. Because of a strike, my visit to the market was shorter but worth it. From the pick up to my hotel to the food and the patience to answer all my questions, everything was greatI cook a lot at home but Peruvian food is mostly new to me so I learned a lot during the class to hopefully reproduce at home some of the dishes I‚Äôve eaten since my arrival in Lima a few days before

title: From culinary novices to Nikkei ninjas in a day!
text: From culinary novices to Nikkei ninjas in a day! Our Lima cooking class was a blast. We learned to make Nikkei-style tiraditos (Peruvian-Japanese fusion, think sashimi with amazing sauces), and Chef Hector and his partner exceeded expectations. After picking out fresh fish at the market, we headed to a terrace overlooking Inca ruins for a step-by-step lesson in sauces and dishes.Thank you for sharing your secret recipes! We‚Äôre already making them at home, along with the Chilcano cocktail Ricardo taught us‚ÄîPisco, bitters, ginger soda, and fresh ginger juice. A fun, informative, and unforgettable experience!

title: Amazing class with Hector!I enjoyed learning the history of Peruvian cooking,and their specialty skills.
text: The best part of my monthly stay in Miraflores.  Hector taught us special skills and tips which I can use daily with cooking.  His fish dishes and open fire cooking were phenomenal!  These memories will last forever!I wish I had more time to spend with Hector and Ricardo, two very special, compassionate men.  I highly recommend their classes!

title: The cooking class to do in Lima!
text: We had a great experience at the Peruvian cooking class in Lima. We learned a lot and prepared several different dishes. The tiradito and ceviche were absolutely delicious ‚Äî restaurant-quality, in our opinion. We're looking forward to making these dishes at home. Ricardo is a fantastic host and an excellent teacher. If you're looking for a cooking class in Lima, we highly recommend this company. You'll have a great time and learn a lot about Peruvian cuisine.

name: Machu Picchu Full Day Trip

This was by far the most extraordinary travel experience I‚Äôve ever had. Led by Ricardo, a top local chef, this immersive culinary journey offers an authentic taste of Peru‚Äôs rich food culture. From the moment you join Ricardo‚Äôs team at the bustling local mercados where everyday Peruvians shop for fresh, traditional ingredients you‚Äôll feel like you‚Äôre part of the community.The adventure continues at his charming cooking studio, located right across from an ancient pre-Inca temple in the heart of Miraflores. Cooking with a view of these breathtaking ruins made the entire experience feel like a perfect blend of culture, history, and gastronomy (just picture holding your freshly prepared dish with the ruins in the background it‚Äôs magic!).Ricardo‚Äôs hands-on approach ensures you‚Äôll learn authentic Peruvian cooking techniques from scratch. You‚Äôll chop, saut√©, and season under his expert guidance, all while gaining insight into the ingredients, their origins, and the cultural significance behind each dish. Whether you‚Äôre mastering the art of ceviche, crafting the perfect pisco sour, or exploring regional specialties, every moment is filled with vibrant flavors and new skills.At the end of the class, you‚Äôll gather around the table like family, savoring the incredible dishes you‚Äôve created. By the time you take your last bite, you‚Äôll feel like a true local so satisfied and enriched by the experience that you might even consider cutting your trip short because, honestly, it doesn‚Äôt get more authentic than this. title: Best Chef Hector
text: Outstanding Ceviche Cooking Class with HectorWe had an absolutely fantastic time at Hector‚Äôs ceviche cooking class! Hector is such a warm and kind person ‚Äì once you get to know him, his friendly and fun personality really shines through. He made us feel welcome and created a relaxed, enjoyable atmosphere right from the start.The four of us booked the class together and prepared several types of ceviche. From mastering the art of making tigermilk to working with the fish and all the fresh ingredients, everything was absolutely delicious. Hector was not only a great instructor but also an inspiration ‚Äì we learned so much from him!To top it all off, we ended the evening by mixing (and enjoying!) Pisco Sours together. It was the perfect way to wrap up an already fantastic experience.Thank you, Hector, for such a wonderful time. We hope to see you again someday!Cheers,Jonas, Aylin, Melek, and Clemens

title: Have fun, cook and eat
text: The class was very very interesting and fun!! Everyone in the place is very cool! Totally recommended. We all had a lot of laughter

title: Awesome!!!
text: We had an amazing experience with Hector. He picked us up from our hotel in the morning. Then we hat a nice walk through the markets of Lima to buy all the ingredients for our menu. (including fish, vegetables, meat, rare herbs, fruit, you can find anything there)Afterwards Hector brought us to his outdoor kitchen and explained all the steps for preparing traditional peruvian food. Even my clumsy uncle managed to understand hectors instructions. We prepared a 3 course menu including ceviche & scallops and mixed pisco sours.Everything was accompanied by interesting talks about peruvian culture and hector gave us a short narration of his cooking experiences in the past.All in all it was awesome and i would recommend everyone to book a course with Hector.

title: Amazing Experience
text: Omg, where to begin. Chef Hector, Deano and team were just amazing! This experience blew our mind and exceeded all of our expectations.We coordinated this with Hector a bit last minute on our last day in Peru and he was so welcoming, despite it being a major holiday weekend. From the moment we arrived till the last pisco sip we took - The team took great care of us and went above & beyond to teach us each step of making great civeche (freshest I‚Äôve ever had) and amazing pisco from scratch.The added bonus was Chef Hector going out of his way to teach us how to make lomo saltado after we shared that we originally were torn between a civiche class or salatdo class. The fact that he had his team go out of the way to pick up some fresh meat from the butcher down the street just to teach us every step of making lomo saltado (after our original class had ended), was just mind blowing.Don‚Äôt think twice, this is an experience you won‚Äôt forget and it was a perfect ending to our two week Peru trip - But we‚Äôll be back!Greetings from the Bay Area, CA.Pierre & Erin

title: AMAZING
text: This was such an amazing experience. Hector and his crew were prompt, informative, and gave us such a great overview of Peruvian cuisine! It was great going to the market and learning about each ingredient as well. Highly recommend ü§©ü§©ü§©

title: Took Joshua almost with us
text: He was such a great chef, forcoming and interested in us, our cooking skills and funny at the same time. The so called ceviche was tasty and fresh, we ate it once more in Cusco but there is no comparison to what we tried here. 100% good job!

title: A magical trip to Peru.
text: A magical visit to Peru‚Äôs wonderful Incan sites.  We stayed at five star hotels and resorts including a centuries old monastery that is now an elegant hotel. Our party of ten traveled in a comfortable van with a great driver who managed our luggage flawlessly. We also had great guides. All said, it was a fabulous trip.

title: Beautiful Peru, from Inca culture to trekking in Macchu Picchu! Great experience!
text: We are very grateful to Jonas, Fiorella, Arthuro and the entire Peruvian Sunrise agency for our wonderful holiday! We had with our 10 year old son very great adventures and we were super looked after around the clock!Thank you and we plan the Amazon region with you next year! Thanks for the flexibility and support!

fakeReason: The review date is May 16, 2025, which is in the future from the current date of April 2024, indicating the review is not genuine.

title: excellent planning our private trip
text: We spent 4 days in Cusco Matchu Pitchu and Lima and were superbly looked after before and during our private trip.All change requests regarding private transfer or German speaking guides were implemented immediately.Fiorella in particular is to be singled out!!!I have not experienced better care than Fiorella has given me in recent decades.gladly back in 2027

title: Amazing Machu Picchu-Cusco-Lima experience
text: Peruvian Sunrise was meticulous in planning the trip with us from a few months back. Kevin was very accommodating in our trip curation. During the trip, the guides were very professional and friendly and very knowledgeable as well. Fiorella managed our operations and was available the many times we needed. Natalie was our guide in Cusco and she was really amazing. My kids loved the way she narrated and taught us all about the interesting facts about Cusco. She was in tune with our needs as well as we had missing baggage and needed clothes and shoes. She also understood the various needs of the family and accommodated so tirelessly. The altitude sickness was hitting some of us and she helped with some oil and made the tour bearable as well. Her energy was amazing.Machu Picchu was a marvellous experience and PS planned it very well for us. Immaculate timing and weather. We loved it. The tour back in Lima was very relaxing and beautiful. The Barranco neighbourhood was our favourite. The hotels curated were great. We had to cancel a mountain trip in Cusco and we had requested for spa alternatives and PS accommodated all very well. Thank you!!!

title: Very organized and complete
text: The tour company was amazing. They cater to what you want during your trip and they are professional and diligent with the details.

title: Excellent tour!
text: This was a wonderful tour. Well organized and the tour guides were all very friendly and knowledgeable. Hotels were all very nice, clean and comfortable. Tour vehicles were clean and safe with good drivers. I highly recommend this tour. We would gladly go again!

title: Highly recommended
text: Excellent service! From booking to ending of the trip, they keep the communication going very well, drivers, staff and tour guides are very friendly and professional.

title: Excellent!
text: Excellent planning and organizing, all the tours were on time and airport transfers were made very easy. We had an absolutely fantastic time with our family touring Peru.

title: Well-organized
text: The trip is very organized. From airport transfers to tours, everything is well kept. Hotels are great, clean and very accessible to everything. If you love supporting local, this is a perfect tour.

title: The perfect day trip from Lima with great guides and drivers.
text: Amazing experience!  We did the private family tour to Caral and our guide Stefano and driver Julio were very knowledgable and welcoming.  They knew great places to stop and eat and how to specify the tour to what we were looking for.  English option was also appreciated.  Highly recommend.

title: caral remote but worth a visit
text: JJ the guide was amazing and very knowledgable, and we really appreciated all of his explanations throughout the entire tour of not just Caral but also the history of the development of the areas we drove through including Chivay and Lima's outer "ghettos" . He also gave some context on past and current issues these places are facing today, which was both interesting and helpful to stave off boredom on what was an incredibly long drive (5-5.5hrs each way).Caral clearly does not get many visitors; we went on a Saturday and saw 2 other groups the whole time. You have to get a guide at the front (as with many places in Peru) but they did not have any English speaking guides, so JJ was also invaluable for providing information for us and helping with translating when we had questions for him/the Spanish-speaking guide. I appreciate that Caral hires all locals from the area who have been helping with the site for a very long time. Also, we learned that there is a lot more to the area than just Caral - they're working through 18 other archaeological sites in the area that are related!The driving was very safe but the van's speed was throttled to what seemed to be quite slow and I didn't understand why. It felt like we could have gotten to Caral and back much faster going just a bit faster, although the traffic was also brutal. It also would have been nice to know the drive could take so long - on the itinerary it was listed as a 3.5-4hr drive. Also, as it was during wet season one of the road crossings had the river coursing across it so we took an alternative route that involved a tuktuk which was quite fun but something to keep in mind!Ultimately we really enjoyed this chance to see such a unique and ancient site, and I don't think it would have been possible to do so with my non-Spanish speaking family without a tour like this. I can see why people don't visit given the long journey (there are not really any tourist sites in between to break it up) but I think going at least once is important.Finally, communication with the booking person was also great, the person answered all our questions quickly.

title: Dino, the guide, was excellent. He answered all my questions. And he was so passionate about his work. The weather was p
text: Leonardo knows his country and told the two us so many things on the four hour ride from Lima to Caral. The traffic was heavy but the time went fast with all the conversation. When we got to Caral, our site guide was Dino who was passionate about the site and had worked as an archeologist on the site for twenty five years . The exhibits were great but you need to know Spanish to read them of course. However, Leonardo was quick to talk about them. We had Lomo soltando in Huacho with chicha. The weather was perfect. Our driver, Alexandro, was a great driver as I would not like to navigate Lima!

title: A Pleasant Experience
text: The guide was professional, responsive, knowledgeable, and amiable - what more can one desire from a one-day tour! The driving was safe, friendly, and bearing the travelers in mind.

title: Buenas vibras all around
text: Caral is a relatively new discovery and an excavation in progress. The present ruins are magnificent, but I came away so excited about what‚Äôs yet to be uncovered. Our guide, Nataly, is someone with a deep love of history and archeology, and her enthusiasm was contagious. The car ride to Caral is long, but Nataly kept us entertained with her knowledge of Peru, archeological, historical, cultural, gastronomical‚Ä¶ she provided great insight into everything! Our driver, Isahir, was very accommodating, kind, and a lovely person to spend the day with. We all had an awesome day and learned a lot.

title: Don't forget hat and sunscreen!
text: The walk with Caesar and Louis was fabulous. Not only were they very friendly and attentive in the trip to the destination, but both went beyond the ordinary to explain the local particularities and recommend the spaces to visit in Lima and Peru. The site itself is very interesting and gives an account of the life that in the past there manifested itself, highlighting the structures there found in a very special way.

title: The Perfect Start to Our Trip
text: This trip was fabulous. We learned so much about the history and geography of Peru - not only while at Caral - but on the journey to Caral and back to Lima. Amadeo was a wealth of knowledge and happy to answer every question. It was the perfect way to start our trip.

title: Great tour with an excellent operator. Highly recommend it.
text: Booking with HAKU through Trip Advisor was very straightforward. They offer reserve now - pay later option. Our trip was on August 19, 2024 for which I made the reservation early in August, but they deferred the charge to my card till August 17, with free cancellation prior to that. We were in a group of six, four of us and two others. They picked us up at 5:45 am from our hotel in Mira Flores in a passenger van with a driver and a guide- JJ or Joel Jr. was the guide. JJ is very knowledgeable, polite, and professional, and spoke fluent English. He made the long drive very enjoyable, telling us history of Peru, its people, and culture. It took 4.5 hrs to get to Caral and 5 hrs on the return. We spent about 2.5 hrs visiting the ruins at Caral. It turned out to be a long day - we got back to the hotel around 7:00 pm because the traffic in the city was bad. Overall we are glad we went to see the oldest known cradle of civilization. Highly recommend HAKU and kudos to JJ. Thank you HAKU.

title: Fabulous day trip to amazing archeological site!
text: We had a wonderful full day tour of Caral! Our driver was great. Our guide Leonardo was excellent, he spoke perfect English, knew the history in great detail of the area and introduced us to the head archeologist of Caral and translated for us. He made sure we were comfortable and was very professional. Can't speak highly enough of our experience!

title: Hidden Gem for history fanatics
text: Caral is a hidden gem. You get to see the oldest society (predates Egypt) in Americas. It's about 4 hour car ride from Lima so doable as a day trip. It's still an active excavation site so they are still discovering new information about the site.Saul was our guide and Alejandro was our driver. They were both delightful and fluent in English. Saul shared so much information about Peru culture as we pass by different districts. We stopped for local breakfast and lunch (after the site tour). they were both authentic.Once we get to the site, it is led by the official culture department guide and Saul acted as our translator and added colors based on his past experiences. It's an amazing experience to be on a site that was built 5000 years ago and learning about the architecture and the culture. The designs of the architecture was so sturdy that it withstood earthquakes and flooding.Lima traffic is quite crazy so be prepared to be a bit delayed coming back to the city. The car they picked us up in is a roomy Honda with automatic transmission which makes the long ride smoother.

title: excellent
text: The visit went very wellour guide Maria was very friendly, clear and experiencedWe took tons of pictures

title: Excellent Service - Lima üáµüá™
text: Our tour guide - Vilma was very knowledgeable and am excellent guide.  She spoke English very well.  We thoroughly enjoyed her.  Our driver Victor was excellent. He safely drove us all around in some heavy traffic.  Definitely recommend both of then and Vista Travels.

title: So interesting!
text: Excellent tour, the Guide Lucas has the best knowledge of the Culture and his history. Kenyi is an excellent driver too. Entertaining, didactic and safe  üëçüèº

title: Incredible pyramid
text: Well worth it. The pachacamac tour was very informative and interesting, I loved the history. I loved Barranco neighborhood, very artistic and colorful, this is a must as well.

data.title: Unsatisfied with the service of this Vista Adventure Tour
data.text: I had specify before the trip that I ordered selected a guide in Spanish for my mom. When I booked my trip for some reason the company put it down for English. When a gentlemen called from the company for confirmation that I‚Äôd continue I asked if they could fix that mistake and they said it wouldn‚Äôt be a problem because our guide Jessica speaks both English and Spanish. When we got in the car for our tour the guide Jessica asked if one of us spoke English. I confirmed that I did but that my mom did not and that you they told me it‚Äôd be fine because she speaks both languages. she refuse to speak Spanish for my mom and said she was only assigned to do the tour in English. I stick with my mom because she‚Äôs 65 years old and worry of her falling, so it wasn‚Äôt even worth keeping up with the guide Jessica as she‚Äôs making the other tourist who speak English feel more comfortable. My mom is not a person to be treated like a dog left behind. I hope to not once book anything with the Vista Adventures company and hope those guys learn how to do a better service. She could‚Äôve used her Spanish language but refuse to. The only time she talk Spanish to my mom was for the restroom. It‚Äôs Jessica with moe near her left eye. That‚Äôs your Jessica in case she tries to say it‚Äôs another Jessica. Next time actually be honest to what you tell a customer. I have video of my mom in the back as your Jessica just continues speaking English when I‚Äôm sure her first language is Spanish. We shouldn‚Äôt have felt and especially my mother shouldn‚Äôt have felt outcasted.Bye.

title: Half day at Pachacamac and Barranco
text: If you are interested in Peruvian history then this is the tour for you. We arrived in Lima 28 hours behind schedule therefore only had limited time to cram in everything. We booked this trip last minute. Danni the viatour rep did everything possible to secure this trip for us and we were not disappointed. We were the only two people in our party so had Greta our Peruvian guide and Leonardo our driver all to ourselves. Greta‚Äôs knowledge of her countries culture was impressive she took us through a delightful and informative journey dating back 5000 years. After visiting the sight we then headed to Barranco for a whistle stop tour. A fabulous day . Thanks to all who took part

title: A good way to see a bit of Lima and the archeological site
text: The tour overall met our expectations. We were lucky that we ended up on a private tour.We received a lot of good information from our guide Jessica. She explained the history of each place we visited very well. We were given enough time to take photos and we did not feel rushed. We went around barranco which was a neighbourhood with a lot of character. We only passed by chorrillos which we were okay with as it was a hole. For me this was unecessary aspect of the tour. Pachacamac was very interesting. It was amazing how much that place has seen over centuries and how some materials used by the ancient people stood the test of time. There was a lot of traffic on the way but this gave us a chance to try peruvian street food while cars were at a full stop. It was a fun day for us and we thank our tour guide Jessica and our driver Kenji for keeping us safe

title: Highlight of our Lima trip - do not miss!
text: Alfredo was an exceptional tour guide and brought us on the most incredible tour.Usually when travelling, we see the best rich areas that are not actually representative of how the locals actually live. This private tour showed us the unfiltered reality for most of the people living outside the rich areas of Lima - all the sights, the sounds, the smells.Alfredo‚Äôs tour allowed us to get close and personal with the locals and have direct conversations with his never-missing-a-beat translations.The highlight of the tour for me was definitely eating a home cooked meal in a lovely local‚Äôs house. The meal was delicious and her story made me quite emotional. It is incredible how someone can be through so much yet stay resilient and kind to everyone she meets. For example she wakes up early at 6am every morning to cook breakfast for all the local kids and old people who cannot afford to eat.Separately, the proceeds from this tour go directly into helping 6-12 year old kids in the area. It is great to be able to have such a great experience while supporting the community. It was a win-win-win.This tour was definitely worth it, if even just to have a conversation with Alfredo, highly highly recommend, thank you Alfredo üôè

title: Getting to know another face of Lima
text: Visitions √† country is for me, on top of ruina, amazone sc√®ne tu and mus√©ums, getting top know the people who live there, the ‚Äúr√©al‚Äù people!I shall never Forget the warm and heartful welcome by Signore Ninfa and her friend, her life story, her small house without a roof.Alfredo and our friendly and efficient driver madr√© this hall-day a rich and m√©morable exp√©rience.Go for it !

title: Incredible social tour in Lima!
text: This tour was absolutely incredible and a must do when you come visit Peru! See Lima through the communities eyes and meet alot of wonderful people. I will definitely be back!

title: An excellently organized, authentic, and insightful day
text: This was the highlight of our time in Lima...and possibly the most memorable day we spent in our 10 days in Peru. My two teenage children found the whole day fascinating and eye-opening. We were all inspired by meeting the local people, especially having lunch with Dona Ninfa at her home, and hearing their stories. Alfredo was an excellent guide, and all the logistics were excellent. I can't recommend this day highly enough.

title: My favourite day while in Lima
text: All the brown roofs in the hills surrounding Lima is where you go. An amazing chance to see how the people live and meet some truly inspiring individuals. The cemetery is interesting and I took some great pictures from the hilltop.This was my favourite day while in Lima. Definitely worth it and I 100% recommend  doing this tour.

title: Incredible Unique Experience
text: Can‚Äôt speak highly enough of Alfredo and our half day tour of Lima with Alternative Peru!We saw and learned things very few other tourists get to experience. Best of all, the cost includes financial support for the communities and people we visited.We learned a lot about about Peruvian culture and the amazing work the less fortunate are doing to support each other.Wish we had more time to do the other tours that Alternative Peru offer.

title: Adds a unique and authentic dimension to any visit to Lima
text: This tour was amazing! I've been to Lima probably 25 times (I was born in the US but both parents are Peruvian and extended family are all still there so I've visited throughout my entire life) so I really thought I 'knew' Lima. But this is my first time taking this type of tour and it was *fascinating*. I thought it might be risky but it was totally safe, everyone we met was absolutely wonderful. On the tour you'll learn about the 'human settlements', their evolution and history, how they are self-governed and self-reliant. The ability of these communities to strive and thrive, even under the most challenging of circumstances, is a true testament to the human spirit! Alfredo and the driver picked us up from our hotel in Miraflores (there were 4 of us) and from there it took about 45 min to get to the first stop. The tour is nicely paced, very organized and super informative. Alfredo and this tour company have a true passion for uplifting these communities and they do a great job of bringing awareness and insight into this often overlooked (but very important) aspect of Lima's society. 1000% recommend!!

title: Most Interesting thing I‚Äôve done in a while
text: As cool as the touristy areas of Lima are, those places don‚Äôt really represent the lifestyle of many if not most Peruvians - this tour made venturing Into the lesser known and somewhat intimidating areas much more approachable and I learned so much about the country, its culture, and some of its most pressing issues.  My guide Alfredo, along with everyone he introduced me to, was great.  I won‚Äôt spoil the tour by giving much away, but highly recommend!

title: Unique and Memorableüòä
text: Thank you, Alfredo, for showing us the different sides of Peru outside the main city. Our tour was very unique, memorable, and Educational!

title: Best tour I have ever been in the
text: Our tour guide, Alfredo was absolutely amazing. He took care of us in every way possible. His English was perfect, he had very detailed and profound knowledge of the history of Lima and Peru as a whole (we asked a lot of questions, and he answered all of them), took us to the greatest restaurants, and made us feel comfortable and at home. If you‚Äôre looking for a tour that will take you through the real, authentic Peruvian experience, I 100% recommend you touring with Alternativa Peru. They make sure to cover all of the touristic areas, while at the same time, showing you areas where common Peruvian citizens visit and love. This was the best tour that I have taken in my life.

title: Great experience, we would recommend
text: My girlfriend and I had a wonderful time. Our tour guide was Milagros (Mily), and she was very knowledgeable, friendly, and made for great conversation. The driver (Rene) was also wonderful. I have no complaints.

title: Perfect tour of Lima
text: My wife brother and I had an 8 hour layover in Lima heading home from Cusco. We booked the 5 hour highlights of Lima tour and couldn‚Äôt have been happier. Nathaly was absolutely terrific. She (and our driver Jorge) met us at the airport and showed us the different neighborhoods and historical sights. Nathaly‚Äôs English is outstanding and she was thoroughly knowledgeable and engaging. Outstanding tour!!

title: Outstanding Lima City Tour
text: Our guide Gabby and our driver where extremely professional and knowledgeable and did and outstanding job! Highly recommend this tour if you have four hours available..

title: Outstanding Tour
text: We booked this tour based on the excellent reviews and we totally agree!  It was perfect for us; we thoroughly enjoyed our five hours with our outstanding guide Nathaly.  She was knowledgeable and gave us so much interesting information.  We highly recommend the Original Highlights tour - you won't be disappointed!

title: Great day in Lima!
text: We had a wonderful time with the half day Lima city tour! Our guide Maria and our driver Cogui are great. They are super helpful, knowledgeable and accommodating! We learned much about Lima and Peru in the short tour, and get to try a few tasty local snack as well. Highly recommend and we will set aside more time to come back for the longer tour next time! Thank you Maria and Cougui for a great day in Lima!

title: Best Lima tour
text: Highly recommended tour , we only have half day for Lima city and we wished we had full day , Milagros our tour guide and George our driver is very friendly , knowledgeable , professional , patient . The car is very clean , safe , hassle free travel to see and experience culture of Peru .

title: The Perfect First Day in Lima ‚Äì Mily Made It Unforgettable!
text: This was my first time in Lima, and I truly couldn‚Äôt have asked for a better way to experience the city than with Mily & George‚Äôs private tour. From the moment we met Mily, I knew we were in great hands. She‚Äôs warm, incredibly knowledgeable, and so passionate about her city ‚Äî the perfect guide for a first-time visitor!Our tour was flawlessly organized from start to finish. Mily created a thoughtful, customized itinerary that gave us a little bit of everything: rich history, vibrant neighborhoods, delicious local food, and even a few hidden gems that we never would have found on our own. It was the perfect introduction to Lima and set the tone for the rest of our trip.What impressed me most was how seamless everything felt. Mily took care of every detail, allowing us to relax and enjoy the experience. She made us feel welcomed, informed, and completely immersed in the culture from the very beginning.If you‚Äôre visiting Lima ‚Äî especially for the first time ‚Äî I can‚Äôt recommend Mily & George enough. This was more than just a tour; it was the best possible way to start our adventure in Peru. Thank you, Mily, for an unforgettable first day!

title: Great Tour if you‚Äôre 1 day in Lima
text: We had a Great Tour, just as we had hoped for.Lima is really not a city you can explore by yourself (without a car). So this was the ideal way to see everything within one day.With Lourdes we had a great guide, she was very knowledgeable! We liked the mix of sights and how perfectly timed the transfers were.We would definitely recommend this tour, especially if you only have a short time in Lima

titulo: Lima - great city! Peru - great country!
texto: The tour was very competent, thoughtful. Our guide responded to our wishes and concerns and was able to convey a lot about the city and life. We felt comfortable and safe throughout. The agency handled everything well and reliably.

title: Expensive and unguided entrance
text: The entry is 50 suns in general, but the bad thing that I was given no brochure, only a sticker to put in a visible place, does not include guide or option of a group tour with a guide, so I did not know where to start the tour. It is not affordable for Peruvian visitors or backpackers and less without a guide (it is with extra payment). Everything is in excellent preservation and with information in each sample. Everything's clean. It was very interesting the room of the erotic ceramics that are on the first floor.

title: Las Incas, Back to their past!
text: Wonderful place.Private tour with a guide of "world travelers". 3 hours of immersion in the Inca universe. Thousands of archaeological pieces await you. Discover the agrarian accounts of this people who still leave doubts the experts! The beauty and finesse of their gold pieces, textiles, everyday objects. If you want to discover this people and its customs, Museo Larco is waiting for you.

title: Never did receive my museum tickets
text: Didn√®t not receive my tickets after purchasing on this app. TripAdvisor is a scam. Never buy anything through this website again.

title: Pleasant cultural insertion experience
text: A very interesting museum.Super well cared for and with sufficient explanation for those who cannot or will not hire guide.All explanations in at least 7 languages are on the walls and display cases.Gets you into the history of pre-Hispanic cultures in Peru.The collection is super beautiful and very well maintained.Fully recommended.

title: Very interesting
text: Museum very well arranged in a nice building very flowery. Rich collection with explanation in French. More pre-Inca than Inca elements but the whole story is well traced. Concise audio guide for 15 soles. Erotic gallery + archive gallery and research open to the public

title: Beautiful museum
text: Beautiful museum, very interesting, we took the audio guide which is a good summary of everything we could read in French. For me, the audio guide was not really necessary. Don't forget to visit the impressive reserves

title: Magnificent
text: Great pre-Inca treasure, in a very well-kept mansion. The gardens are also an attraction apart. We made the visit on our own and it was very important to use the phone (pay the part of the ticket).

title: You have to go! Just be careful with the restaurant!
text: Perfect! Beautiful organized museum works, beautiful local! Careful with the works, very kind staff! It was just boring the restaurant service! It's not worth it

title: Magnificent collection of pre-Inka pottery
text: This museum has possibly the best assemblage of pre-Inka vessels. Nearly 100 years old it boasts numberless pieces that are veritable chefs d‚Äôoeuvre. Particularly remarkable are the pots coming from the Mochica region (N Per√∫) among them quite a few world known. It‚Äôs a pity that most of the artefacts come from the looting of sites and, therefore, more detailed information about them is lacking.

title: More of the same
text: I expected more from the museum for being referenced as a visiting option in Lima. Of so much that it was empty (only 03 visitors) when we went. Won't come back.

title: Great private tour of Lima
text: Maricarmen was our guide and Jorge our driver. We had a lovely time in Lima. I would thoroughly recommend this tour! As well as visiting the sites listed in the itinerary, we had a great lunch at a very nice restaurant.

title: Perfect day exploring Lima
text: Nathaly was our guide and Jorge, our driver. We had the most amazing time. Both Nathaly and Jorge were extremely knowledgeable, friendly, and helpful. I am quite confident I would not have been able to cover as much of Lima on our own. My favorites were the Larco museum & the view from Morro Solar. They answered all of our questions and were extremely flexible.

title: Perfect full day in Lima
text: Mily and George were great guides! They were informative, friendly, and kind. We all enjoyed our full day Lima tour before heading back home on a late-night flight. The tour was the perfect way to see a lot of Lima all in one day.

title: Fantastic day in Lima
text: My husband and I had a fantastic experience. Our guide (Milagros) was very knowledgeable and made our day a great adventure! Our driver, Jorge, was amazing and super accommodating.

title: Gorgeous city of Lima  with amazing history and architecture !
text: Spent the day touring the beautiful  city of Lima with amazing history, culture, and architecture! Thanks to Mariacarmen and our driver Ismael which were really the highlights of making our day of adventure so memorable ! Thank you mi Amiga y Amigo

title: Wonderful
text: We had one day in Lima and the tour took us everywhere we wanted to go.  Our tour guide, Nathaly, was amazing.  Her immense knowledge of the city history and architecture was wonderful.  At the museum Larco she was able to really go through the history of Peru using the artifacts that gave a great understanding of the country‚Äôs past.  I wouldn‚Äôt have gotten nearly as much out of it on my own.  Our driver, Jorge, was absolutely lovely.  I highly recommend this tour!

title: An Incredible Experience from Start to Finish
text: This tour was truly unforgettable! Everything was perfectly organized, relaxing, and fun from the moment we were picked up. Our driver, Coqui, made us feel safe and comfortable the whole day, and Charo, our tour guide, was simply amazing-so warm, knowledgeable, and passionate. The whole experience felt special and personalized, and we couldn't have asked for a better team. Highly recommend this tour to anyone looking to make the most out of their time and walk away with great memories!

title: Great Tour
text: We had an amazing tour in Lima. We saw most of the major sights. Our tour guide was so friendly and knowledgeable as was our driver. I highly recommend this tour.

title: Exceptional all day tour experience of Lima
text: One of the most professional tour companies we have worked with impressed us right from the start with their clear and responsive communication, especially with our tour guide, Lourdes, and our driver, Koki. Lourdes picked us up on time at our hotel and guided us on an entire day of touring Lima. As it was our first visit to the city, this all-day tour provided us with an exceptional opportunity to experience everything Lima has to offer.The small details can really enhance your experience, and upon arrival, we were amazed at how spotless and comfortable the van was‚Äîit felt like it had just been purchased. Koki took great pride in maintaining the van and navigated the complex streets of Lima with professionalism. He was always ready to pick us up and safely transport us to our next destination.Lourdes‚Äôs extensive knowledge and genuine concern for our comfort made a significant difference in our experience. She had even reserved a table for us at the Museo Larco‚Äîa stunning venue for lunch or dinner. We grew so close to both Lourdes and Koki that we invited them to be our guests for lunch, and they shared even more insight into Lima and Peru, particularly about the delicacies on the menu.We were sad to see our time with them come to an end, and we highly recommend Integrity Tours, along with our tour guide, Lourdes, and driver, Koki.

title: Soo beautiful Lima!!
text: Veryyy interesting tour!! We learn a lot about peruvian history and culture!!! Gabby did an amazing job explaining everything about her country!! We love her!! Also our driver Jorge did an awesome job!! We totally recommeded this tour.

title: Best time !!!
text: Had an amazing experience !! would highly recommend . I suggest that you should do this bike tour on your first or second day of being in Lima Peru you got to see so much.

title: A great way of seeing Lima
text: We saw a small group of cyclists with a guide in the Barranco district  of Lima and spoke to the guide deciding we would do the bike tour with them the next day which we duly did. It was tricky finding the start of the tour as it is in a market area and the gates were locked so we were directed around rather block. Eventually we found it and provided with good,sturdy bikes opting for helmets and met Diego again. We set off for the pyramid using the cycle lanes which felt very safe. The pyramid looked amazing right in the centre of a built up area. We then rode to the lovers view, via Miraflores then to Barranco district. We opted for an extension to the Christ statue and cross on the hill.It was all very flat and Diego was excellent with his knowledge of the history of the districts, city of Lima and Peru- it was a tour I would heavily recommend.

title: Excellent bike tour of Lima
text: Excellent bike tour of the Miraflores and Barranco areas of Lima. We visited the pre-Inca pyramid, a beautiful park on the coast (parc de l‚Äôamour) and the charming neighborhood of Barranco. Most of the route was on dedicated bike paths or bike lanes, and the route was easy and relatively flat. Our guide (Diego) was very knowledgeable and provided commentary in English and Spanish. Highly recommended.

title: Great bike tour
text: Great way to spend an afternoon, our guide Diego was the best and was happy to answer any questions or just chat. Skillfully guided us through the area and bought us some of the best gelato.  Highly recommended

title: Knowledgeable Guide and Good Bikes
text: Very knowledgeable guide! He was able to describe the history and politics of Peru and could put what we saw in context. Good quality bikes too!

title: Great biking in Lima
text: Great tour with an enthousiastic host who was professional and also funny. We learned a lot of history in a relaxed way. We enjoyed it very much. Thank you!

title: Easy cycle
text: Guide was very good and the drink was a nice touch. I would have liked to do a bit more cycling but apart from that all good and enjoyed

title: Awesome tour of Barranco
text: The Fall in Love with Barranco tour was an awesome experience. First of all, because our flight was 2 hours late from Juliaca, Beto worked with us to reschedule the tour for an hour and 15 minutes later. Then Choji took it from there and led our family on the absolute highlight of our time in Lima‚Ä¶he was simply fantastic and sent us a bunch of pictures. Highly recommend GOGO Biking and especially Choji!

title: Worth it!!
text: we spent our last afternoon in Peru on this bike tour‚Äî it was a beautiful day and a fun way to zip around and see the Miraflores and Barranco neighborhoods while getting a little bit of history that we wouldn‚Äôt have gotten on our own. Very safe annd comfy bikes,  informative and fun guide! ( but not tooo chatty that it stoped us up from scooting around and seeing lots of beautiful spots)  totally recommend you add this to your Lima to-do list.

title: Fun bike ride!
text: Really enjoyed the bike tour, good quality bikes, our guide Kral was great, very easy riding, mostly on bike routes. Very fun!

title: Great experience!
text: This was a lovely and informative tour of the local market - which sells practically everything - with advice and many tastings. Then we went to the kitchen and cooked 3 different Peruvian dishes - which we also ate. Cesar is funny and helpful, and Carina showed us how to make all the dishes. You will be full at the end so arrive hungry! I woukd recommend the tour

title: Excellent experience tasting typical fruits and foods
text: Excellent experience eating typical Peruvian foods in Lima markets such as ceviche, chaufa with fish, and tropical fruits such as chirimoya, granadilla, tumbo, pitaya, lucuma and aguaymanto. We end up taking a walk in the neighborhood of Barranco. Very didactic the explanations of Gaby our guide and excellent driver driving Cyril.

title: Tasty treats & local beats
text: We were VERY BLESSED to have Leonardo for both days. We toured the historical district with the presidential mansion & the church in the town center. Leonardo was vibrant, knowledgeable and a true pleasure to have as a guide. On the food tour he was happy to help us with adjustments, played local music for us while riding to the next stop and answered all our questions with enthusiasm. TOP NOTCH GUIDE!!!

title: Such a fun activity
text: The tour was so fun! 10/10 recommend! Paola, Cesar, and Joseph were so great and fun! Lots of good information on the food and history of Peru.

title: Flavors of Peru with great company
text: Cesar, Marcos, and Luis were amazing guides giving us a great tour of the Lima food market and peruvian ingredients. We had an amazing time cooking and eating the unique flavors of Peru. Come hungry :-)

title: A memorable and bellyful afternoonü§≠
text: I had an amazing time at the market tour and cooking class, Cesar and Ruth were absolutely wonderful warm, knowledgeable, and made the experience unforgettable. From exploring fresh ingredients to creating delicious dishes, everything was phenomenal. Their kindness and expertise truly made my evening  so special. Highly recommendüìå‚ù§Ô∏è.

title: Amazing cooking experience in Lima, Peru
text: Maverick was the best!  Fabulous time, great food, so much fun!  Highly recommended.  Ask for Maverick to be your guide!!!
Ruth and Cesar were amazing. We cooked a delicious meal together and had so much fun with the other families. Thank you so much!

title: Great food and great guide!
text: This was our first day in Peru and it was a great introduction to Peruvian food and Lima. Our guide, Cesar was fun and informative. The food was amazing! Percy was the best driver!

title: Incredible learning and eating across Lima and Per√∫!
text: Leonardo and his amazing energy, passion to share about Peruvian culture, food, and language were phenomenal. We tried foods from all regions of Per√∫, the historical significance as well as the contemporary impact. To learn about the family histories making the foods for 40, 50 or 100 years was also inspirational. Leonardo created a comfy, cohesive group vibe, really important, and was a great teammate with our driver. I appreciated learning more Peruvian phrases as well! You can‚Äôt learn and do this much on one‚Äôs own in the time we had, totally recommend this to dig deeper and take away greater understanding y appreciation about what, why, how, and when we eat what we do - en Per√∫!
A day with friends, enjoying, food, dancing, conversation, spectacular and good food, better view of the bay and incomparable treatment, very cute.

final_output.title: Great Lima Experience
final_output.text: Marco and his team were awesome. Initially there was some confusion on our part as to where we were to depart from but that got clarified and then the tour was seamlessWe were a group of 3 couples so it made hearing the historical information and interacting easy. Lima is a beautiful city and we saw many diverse highlights; including the President‚Äôs motorcade returning to the palace!

title: Amazing Tour
text: We had one day to see Lima and our money was well spent. This tour was amazing in terms of the itinerary and transportation. While other members of our Norwegian Cruise was stuck in small vans, we were comfortable in our air conditioned large van. The tour guides were informative and went out of their way to make us all feel comfortable. We highly recommend.

title: Wonderful Site Selections, Presentation of them, Service.
text: My wife and I were on a cruise that stopped in Lima. We found the cruise ship tours did not really cover Lima well, found Discover Lima and booked with them. The group was in a van with two guides, (we had Andrew and Julio) so each stop was with a small group. The Old City stops were great, and we got to see the Inca Market, The Park of Love, and Miraflores as well, all in one comfortable and we'll explained tour. We could all ask questions and get answers both on the ride and walking portions, due to the small size, and this added greatly to the experience. Everyone on the tour enjoyed the whole experience and were congratulating themselves for having found the tour.

title: Great Day Out in Lima
text: We had booked a city tour of Lima with Lima Discovery and our guide Mabel met us at the shuttle bus stop where we transferred to a minibus.Our first stop was a square in the centre of Lima where we stopped to take photos. We drove a bit further then got out of the minibus for a walking tour.We walked to St Peter's church which is built in the style of Seville Cathedral and very beautifully decorated.Then it was a short walk to the church of St Francis. The church used to be a monastery and after viewing the church and the library we went to see the catacombs. These lie beneath the church and house the bones of the monks who died there. Originally the monks were buried in the ground and when their bodies had decomposed they were dug up and their bones were separated and collected into types. They were then displayed in cases and boxes.Leaving the church of St Francis, we walked through the government district to the central square. The tour then stopped at a local restaurant for lunch.After lunch we boarded the minibus again and drove for about 40 minutes to a local artisan market where we bought some souvenirs. Then it was back to the bus. A visit to the Love Park on the coast rounded off a very good tour.

title: Lima City Tour
text: This tour was an okay look at the city of Lima. The process of getting assigned to our guide and bus was a bit long and confusing. However our guides Mabel and Jaime were wonderful, informative, helpful and knowledgeable. Lima is a city of lots of traffic, and we spent a lot of time in the bus getting from one site to another. Our lunch at a restaurant in the center of town was delicious, but took way too long to get our group served and get back on our way. It isn't the tour company's fault that Lima is so crowded, and we did get to see the city much more cheaply than through the cruise ship's excursions.

title: Great tour
text: Wilcox our guide met us at the mall where the shuttle bus from the ship dropped us. He was on time, spoke fluent English and was very knowledgeable. He took us to a good restaurant for lunch (Not included, but good value) he and Jaime our driver were great people to spend a day with. I would recommend this tour it was the same tour as the ship offered but far less costly.

title: Discover Lima shore excursion
text: Took Discover Lima as a shore excursion. We had gotten a warning letter in our cabin about how dangerous it was outside the port area so we were a little concerned about having to meet outside the area but it turned out to be fine since there were taxis & other people. The cruise ship was so concerned they took passengers to a mall away from the port to drop them off. We weren't sure if we should go to the mall or outside the port. It took us a while to get the van so we were standing outside for a long time. The tour was in a van so that was nice to have fewer people. It was a typical city tour to see the sights. Nothing outstanding sticks in my mind. Our tour guide didn't provide much information about the culture just city information.  Uninspiring tour.

title: What a FANTASTIC tour!
text: I was fortunate enough to book with Lima Discover, and could not recommend them highly enough. My guide was Vilko, and he made it one of the best tours I have ever taken. I would ask for him, if at all possible. Even though I booked during the high season for cruise lines coming through, I was the only one who booked for this day, so it was essentially a private tour.Vilko arrived at my AirBnB precisely on time, and proceeded to chauffeur me to any of the highlights of Lima that I was interested in. The whole time, he also provided a fascinating running commentary on the growth and history of the city, the different types of neighborhoods, the people, the traffic, etc. He also tailored his topics to those in which I am interested, which made it even better.
