We visited the most important churches and historic buildings in the City Center, where we also looked in at museums/shops featuring varieties of pisco, coffee, and chocolate (heaven!). He was also able to time our passing near the Presidential Palace in time to see the changing of the guards. Next we walked around part of the beautiful neighborhood of Barranco where he explained much of its history and characteristics, and we took a short break to sip coffee at a wonderful Barrancan cafe. Finally, we sampled the market in Miraflores where Vilko explained many of the different fruits, vegatables, etc., most of which I had never even heard of. Finally, he dropped me off at my place after a very satisfying 6 hours of touring.What was remarkable was that Vilko knew so many of the people we came across. He is obviously intimately familiar with the city. (In addition to being fluent in English and Spanish, he also seems to speak German.) Finally, he made the wonderful gesture of putting me in contact with one of his many contacts in the city about a possible real estate deal.Overall, I whole-heartedly recommend Lima Discover's Lima City Tour from Port of Callao to anyone who wants to see a broad swath of Lima in one day, and especially with Vilko. He is extraordinary!

title: Lima City Tour-very nice and thoughtful guide
text: We took the shuttle from the cruise ship terminal to San Miguel Mall to meet our guide and driver. Ismael (guide) and Ricardo (driver). He took us to the Monastery of San Francisco church. Originally he was going to take us to Mira Flores and Baranca neighborhoods, but since we saw all that the day before we didn‚Äôt want to repeat, so he graciously changed our agenda to ensure we saw the most we could.While we were driving he told us about Lim and also about a lot of health products (he was a nutritionist) that are natural products and he had samples.At the Monastery it was Palm Sunday so lots of people were in church each carrying a unique palm feature. The monastery contained a catacomb system under the church that was unique. We toured it, but were not allowed to take pictures anywhere in the church. About 25,000 people were buried in the catacombs but no bodies, just a bunch of bones and no markers. Apparently that is the way it was done years ago.We also toured the monastery and that was very interesting. Also not allowed to take pictures. The most fascinating part was the library which contained about 20,000 volumes of books each one hand written. It was huge and absolutely beautifully maintained.The monastery was itself was enormous and there are still about 130 monks that are there. Since it was Palm Sunday the church was crowded because many in Peru are still very religious. Our guide paid our entrance fee of $5 each which was not in our program. Again the Catholic Church was huge and most of the individual alters were ornate as usual, with lots of gold leaf. And again the normal citizens very poor. The average monthly income is $280 US$ a month. Which is not very much. Most cannot afford to raise a family with that little income.

title: An expensive trip for a great place but with an average service
text: It was a average trip. The places are great and the guides too. The lunch was enforced in a dirty but expensive all you can eat for 50 soles (which is expensive). Returning to lima, there was only 3 passengers and we were fitted in another bus from another company (which was full capacity) and dropped in a diferent location. Dont know if they will bring a taxi. For the price we paid (100 usd) I would hope a better experience. Would not recomend.

title: Amazing trip!
text: Franklin - our tour guide was great! He was very knowledgeable, detail oriented and approachable to answer any questions. He was very attentive to the group and checked on us periodically to make sure we were having fun.  He also shared his favorite foods and attractions in Peru! Thank you for making our day memorable, definitely an experience we won‚Äôt forget ! üôèü©∑

title: friendly trip
text: It was good profession trip. Frankie was excellent. No over commitment, well instructed. No compulsory tips which is very annoying these days.

title: Transfer to Lima
text: The day was super organized and Luis was able to give us super much information about the history of slave tunnels.

title: Fun boat and land touch south of Peru.
text: Ballestas was beautiful, but BEWARE if you get motion sick on the boat tour. I recommend Dramamine as many people on our boat got sick. The red sand beach and the Hacienda with the Slave tunnels was amazing.

title: Maravilloso Tour
text: I liked the planning, there were no surprises or extra things to pay, everything as they said was included. The tour is very nice and fun. We were very happy with the tour. Angie was a great guide always kept an eye on everything.

title: Interesting but tiring tour
text: Smooth pick up in the morning and guides followed the schedule. The sites were beautiful and the guides very attentive. We enjoyed the meal recommended and there were frequent stops to toilets. The bus was also equipped with a toilet for no1. The slave tunnel was intense but really worth the visit.I did not like that we got so close to the animals in Ballestas. We really do not need to take numerous photos of walking penguins that were clearly running away from us. The life jacket on the boat had two broken straps and needs to be fixed. The drop off was painful and we felt that we were spending more time travelling or hanging around than ‚Äútouring‚Äù.Miguel and Angela were great! Diana on WhatsApp was always available.

title: Informative fun !
text: Alvaro was very kind, very informative, and helpful. He made me learn many things I did not expect to learn. I wish him all the best in his career!

title: I loved the island! We saw penguins!
text: Franklin the best guide! A tour you can't miss! If you leave lime you must be patient because the time is long but it is worth woe if you go to huacachina more!

title: Nice day trip from Lima
text: What a great time! So much to see in one day!! Penguins, birds, dolphins, and sea lions! Then to the desert for an amazing dune buggy ride. Make sure you pay extra dir the two hour experience.  A beautiful sunset to cap it all off.Shout out to Aymeth! Amazing guide for the day.Very comfortable bus rides. Sleeping wasn't an issue.

title: 2 day tour paracas and huacachina.
text: This was a nice organized way to see huacachina and paracas. I felt like I got to knock out a lot of things and still had some time to explore by myself. Our guide Aymeth was amazing. She remembered all of our names and was very funny and entertaining. I wish I could put her in my pocket so she could guide me around all of Per√∫.

title: Per√∫ Hop Review
text: Our leaders JC and Aymeth were great. They went out of their way to help us out. They had a large amount of local knowledge and set up some fun after hours activities.

title: Awesome day!
text: Franklin was an awesome guide for the day. Each section of the day was well planned out and so much fun! I absolutely loved the sandboarding and 4x4 in the desert dunes!

title: Great fun
text: Aymeth and fiora were fun, friendly and very knowledgeable. A pleasure to guide us. They were very organised and the journey was smooth

title: Perfect
text: Aymeth was very friendly and informative I enjoy the fact that she speak English and Spanish and for me I appreciate it thanks again

title: Well worth it
text: Had a great time. Getting to see the Ballestas and marine life was a highlight of the trip.Our guides Sergio, Lui, Aymeth and Fiorella all went the extra mile as well.

title: A great experience!
text: The experience was incredible, and Aymet and Florencia provided excellent service, being very clear, organized, and friendly at all times. We highly recommend this tour.

title: One of the best experiences of my life
text: Definetely one of the best experiences of my life. Peru Hop has every detail planned and considered so that you have a great time. The service of Aymeth and Fiorella is outstanding. 100% recommended.

title: Tour Review
text: It was an awesome experience with our tour guide fio. The tours we did were literally amazing.! Definitely recommend it!

title: Light show Lima
text: Aaron was a great guide. Very friendly, informative, made sure we were in the best place to see the show. Great with his language.

title: Magical Experience
text: We really enjoyed those tour! No wait at the gate and Saul was very informative and helpful in giving us history and background on all the attractions we saw. We highly recommend!

title: History of Peru in light show
text: The park was beautiful. Gaby was our guide and was able to explain the meaning of each fountain and the symbolism. She also took time to explain in advance how the story of Peru's history would be told during the light show. She was open to answering questions about life in Peru. Enjoyed the evening.

title: Wonderful La Reserva Park!
text: Thanks to Amadeus we had a wonderful experience, great guide, very kind, enthusiastic and helpful! It is clear that he loves his job and his country! 100 points, highly recommended

title: Amazing Tour!
text: We loved the tour! Sylvana was a great guide. She gave us so much information and she shared a lot about the peruvian culture with us! Our driver Fernando was also great. Thank you so much!

title: Magical indeed
text: Saul was such an excellent guide. He took us to the best place to view the fountains and gave great background stories. He also showed a special places to get great photos.Having the pick up drop off service was well worth the price.

title: Highly recommended  - both the Magic Water Show and the wonderful guide
text: Highly recommended for a fun evening with an educational element. My friends and I visited the magic water show with Silvana as our guide and Julio as our very capable driver. Silvana  is an excellent guide, very informative and she ensured we got to see all areas of the park with the beautiful light displays.  Do not be fooled thinking this is just for children and  younger people, my friends and I are in our early 60's and were visiting Lima and Peru for the very first time. This was a great educational experience as we learnt a lot about the history of Peru from the historical depictions in the water fountain show.  We highly recommend this show to anyone and without a doubt, we highly recommend Haku Tours and Silvana if you want a very nice, friendly and well-informed guide.

title: 5+ Stars ‚Äì Unforgettable Experience with Haku Tours!
text: I booked the Magic Water Tour with Haku Tours at the very last minute, and I was blown away by how quickly and smoothly everything was arranged. The communication was outstanding. They responded right away and added me to the tour without any issues. The customer service was truly exceptional! Despite heavy traffic and some delays, our driver Julio went above and beyond to make sure we still had a great experience. The tour itself was beautiful and educational, I learned so much and had such a fun time. I highly recommend this tour (or any tour with Haku) to anyone visiting Lima. It‚Äôs absolutely worth the money for the service, knowledge, and care you receive. Huge thanks to the amazing Haku team: Stefano, Pamela, Edwin, Julio, Saoul, and Maverick. Each of you contributed to making my experience unforgettable. Thank you from the bottom of my heart!

title: Super
text: Led by Gaby visited the fountains in Lima. Super nice and definitely recommended. Gaby knew a lot about the background of the fountains

title: Cut out the red tape and enjoy!
text: The 715, 815, etc film is the highlight. The water maze was fun too. Carlos is a great guide and Cirilo an excellent driver! Would have been far far harder to navigate and less fun without them.

title: Flight experience top, organization flop
text: The organization before the flight was a bit chaotic. ES nothing was explained, everything happened very quickly. The equipment was simply put on without knowing exactly what was happening. There was no introduction or short ES conversation, the pilot did not even introduce himself. He was already sitting in the paraglider waiting while you were still trying to find your way around. Communication was mostly hands and feet, which created uncertainty. Unfortunately, the video of the flight was not recorded, although ES was announced.However, the flight itself was beautiful, the experience in the air and the view were impressive.

title: Thrill Of A Lifetime!!! A GREAT Way to Experience Lima!
text: I recently went trykeparagliding over Lima while in Peru. This experience was adrenaline-filled and just plain AMAZING!  The company was extremely responsive and booked me for the next day. There is a convenient pick-up point in Mira Flores as the site is about 25 minutes away. The staff was very efficient. This is a thrill you'll never forget! Plus a day later you'll receive a great video of you in flight!

title: Very good.
text: Very good. The flight was good a little short. The assistances were very helpful. Language was some difficult. Yet to receive my short video of it.

title: Skip it.
text: Such a frustrating experience!  I would strongly recommend not using this company.  They will waste a large chunk of your day and act like they have no idea why you are annoyed.  when we showed up,  they told us 30-40 minutes‚Ä¶there were 5 people (2 groups) waiting- and 3 machines going, so I thought that sounded reasonable-  but two hours later we were still waiting.  Random people kept showing up and cutting in front of us. When I spoke to one person about it, he first told me that he was sorry- but they had made a reservations the day before.  When I asked again- his boss cane over and claimed that they had gotten in line but had gone to the bathroom.  I am not sure which version was the truth- but they most definitely were not there before us. We literally watched them drive up in a van and cut in front of us.  It was beyond infuriating to be sitting outside in the blazing hot sun for hours waiting while people who spoke better spanish cut in front of us.In addition, the location is not nice and convenient at all to Miraflores. You have to go all the way down to the shore (meaning you have to hike back up when you are done). Also- that particular part of the shore is quite polluted and not safe for swimming or enjoying the ocean.Ironically- despite the fact that I had made it very clear that I was dissatisfied with the experience, as I left- the main guy asked me to make sure and give them a review on trip advisor.So. Yeah. My review:  Skip this place and all of its headaches and go somewhere more respectable.

title: Condor review
text: Amazing experience! With a Fun, easy, and competitive price. I would recommend! I am getting my video of the experience tomorrow.

title: I flew in at 7pm, I couldn't see anything. Bad experience
text: Unfortunately, I didn't have a good experience. For them, it is more important to sell and make money than people‚Äôs experience. They offered to fly at 5 p.m. (even when I asked if there would be good visibility at that time, they said yes). We were picked up by car, and when we arrived to fly at that time, a lot of people also arrived, about 15 people. They left me for last and I had to wait two hours, almost until 7 p.m. It was very cold (because I didn't know I would have to wait that long). After sunset, I told them I wanted to fly when there was still light so I could see the city, mountains and parks, but they assured me that I could still see everything (rather than offering to go another day). When I finally flew, it was too dark. In the video you can not see anything, and when I returned I told them this, but they did not offer me any solution. They just said that one of the four cars had been damaged and that's why there was so much row. But that's not my fault. When I wrote to them on WhatsApp afterwards, they ignored me. I wasn't offered to fly again or a discount. They offered nothing, they just replied: ‚ÄúI understand.‚Äù And now they spam me almost every day, telling me that if I leave a comment on Google, they can edit a photo with my ‚Äúbest moments.‚Äù What pictures, if the video is all dark and I can't even see myself in it? And it's not paragliding. Paragliding has no engine.

title: Fun and safe experience!!
text: It was fun experience! staff is friendly, the flight was safe. Overall great experience. The experience includes free videos

title: Condor Xtreme to have fun
text: From the attention of the boysThe views you achieve of the city is a recommended that you should not missEasy to reach in collective locomotion, private vehicles or applicationsNote: try wearing glasses and some wind parka

title: Excellent birthday
text: Excellent experience, it was just on my birthday and the truth thank you for taking me to fly was great, I want to repeat it üòÉ

title: Condor Xtreme
text: The experience was good, from picking up the agreed point, to after sending the video. I think it should improve the interaction of the paraglider pilot with the client, perhaps indicating what is visualized from above.

title: We loved the experience
text: It was all amazing, they always respected the agreed schedules and the guides were always very loving and explanatory.

title: Vipac, always close!
text: My wife and I took this tour in Peru and were pleasantly surprised by the agency‚Äôs attention. At all times we felt his accompaniment, which gave us absolute peace of mind. We never had to worry about logistical details, as they handled everything with great professionalism. Thanks to this, our only task was to fully enjoy the experience.

title: Extremely organized, punctual and trustworthy
text: Better team, attentive, punctual, extremely organized. On the visit to Machu Picchu they gathered a group of Brazilians and the guide made the whole tour in Portuguese, excellent and reliable staff.

title: EXCELLENT TRAVEL... HIGHLY RECOMMENDED
text: Beautiful.. I went with my daughter, it was the first trip we went out together alone. The places we knew divine.. We always felt very accompanied by the guides, who waited for us at the airport, as in all the walks we took. Vipac, excellent.

title: WONDERFUL AND RECOMMENDABLE Experience
text: Incredible, from the moment we arrived in Lima, vipac was always present, in all the details, the super friendly, punctual guides, explained us in detail and dedication to each place we went. Really an agency to recommend and re-choose. They are excellent!

title: A wonderful and unforgettable experience ü§©
text: Greetings, we loved it was a racking experience full of adventures, culture and history. We are delighted with Peru and recognize that it is a city of Respect for Height.

title: Surprisingly
text: Places with incredible energy! I never thought this trip would be so amazing! I recommend this trip to everyone! Regardless of age

title: VIPAC Recommendation
text: We're from PR, Brazil. We were well served by guides, transfers, drivers. Always punctual and kind. Vehicles in good condition. We recommend VIPAC.

title: Surprisingly satisfied
text: Well organized. Good hotels good guides. Flexible willing to customize and adapt to specific requests. Quite happy with service

title: Unforgettable Experience in Peru!
text: Unforgettable Experience in Peru!I highly recommend Vipac Travel.My trip to Peru was absolutely amazing from start to finish. The guides were knowledgeable, friendly, and always went the extra mile to make sure we were comfortable and informed. Transportation was perfectly organized and always on time, which made the whole experience smooth and stress-free.The hotels selected for us were top-notch‚Äîbeautiful, clean, and offered excellent service. Every detail was taken care of with care and professionalism.The Peruvian people were incredibly warm and welcoming. Everywhere we went, we were treated like family. And the food‚Äîwow! Every meal was a delight. The flavors, the presentation, and the love with which it was served made each dish unforgettable.I highly recommend visiting Peru. It‚Äôs a country full of beauty, culture, and nice people.

title: Thank you to Haku Tours - the Best Experience
text: We did two separate one day excursions with Haku Tours in Lima on 1 and 2 September 2025. We did them both with a guide and driver. We deliberately chose a personal tour when we visited as part of a cruise and, while the cost is higher, we had an excellent experience. We were picked up and driven everywhere in comfort. We had one to one interaction for the whole day and we learned so much. We could modify times and (for a very small extra cost) even our itinerary. Everything was just perfect. The guide and driver were both helpful and informative and very attentive to our needs. Definitely a 10!

title: Visit Lima
text: It was a wonderful excursion . Got to know a little more of the real Lima. I will recommend it for anyone with 2 days in Lima.

title: Excellent
text: What a great two day tour we had with Haku tours. Day one was led by Amadeo, our guide and Julio, our driver. during which and despite the heavy traffic, we managed to visit all the sites on the advertised itinerary. We enjoyed a lovely lunch and a light evening meal and at no point did we feel rushed. Amadeo was informative, helpful and very friendly throughout and is a credit to the company.For the second day of the tour, Cesar was our guide and Louis, our driver. Louis negotiated the traffic with ease and Cesar managed our visit to the shanty town with great sensitivity and insight. His compassion and respect for the local population was evident throughout and we couldn‚Äôt help but enjoy his enthusiasm for all things ‚ÄòPeru‚Äô. Time management by both guides was excellent and we‚Äôd recommend this tour and this company without hesitation.

title: Great tour and local foods
text: Our tour guide Leonardo is very knowledgeable and passionate young man. We really enjoyed our time we spend in Lima. Amazing local foods this tour company took us for lunch and dinner.

title: Unforgettable 2-Day Lima Tour with Haku Tours ‚Äì A Must-Do!
text: We had an incredible 2-day city tour with Haku Tours, and I cannot recommend them enough! From start to finish, their organization, passion, and commitment to the local community made this an unforgettable experience.Our guide, Leonardo, was hands down the best guide we‚Äôve ever had! He‚Äôs a historian, a storyteller, and an educator, and he made every site we visited come alive. Ask for Leonardo‚Äîyou won‚Äôt regret it! He even travels over 2.5 hours each way to meet the tour group, and his dedication to sharing Lima‚Äôs history and culture is unmatched.Day 1: Pachacamac Ruins, Old Lima & Magic Water ShowWe started early and made our way to the Pachacamac archaeological site, where we explored the fascinating ruins of this pre-Incan and Incan religious center. Leonardo‚Äôs deep knowledge of the Inca civilization and their customs gave us a whole new appreciation for Peru‚Äôs rich history.Lunch was a highlight‚Äîauthentic Peruvian cuisine at a local restaurant where I had my first Pisco Sour (and loved it!).In Lima‚Äôs historic center, we visited:‚úîÔ∏è Plaza Mayor and the Government Palace‚úîÔ∏è San Mart√≠n Square‚úîÔ∏è San Francisco Church and Catacombs‚Äîstill an active monastery!The catacombs tour was fascinating, and Leonardo made sure we understood their historical and cultural significance.To end the night, we visited Parque de la Reserva to see the Magic Water Circuit, a breathtaking light and water show that tells the history of Peru. This was an amazing way to wrap up the day before heading back to the ship.Day 2: Shanty Town Tour & Local Market ExperienceThis was one of the most eye-opening and moving experiences we‚Äôve ever had while traveling. Haku Tours has special permission to visit a shanty town, allowing us to see the real Lima beyond the tourist sites.We met the community leader, an extraordinary woman who has dedicated her life to improving the lives of others. Her accomplishments left us speechless:‚úîÔ∏è Drove drug dealers out of the area‚úîÔ∏è Runs a soup kitchen feeding 1,000 people daily‚úîÔ∏è Opened a daycare so parents can work‚úîÔ∏è Started a school for women and adults‚úîÔ∏è Fought for infrastructure improvements like roads and staircases‚úîÔ∏è Secured a donation from the Taiwanese ambassador to help feed the communityHer story of resilience and leadership was truly inspiring.Afterward, we visited a vertical market, where Leonardo introduced us to Peru‚Äôs incredible variety of fruits and vegetables. This was a great way to experience local life and cuisine.Why Choose Haku Tours?‚úÖ Non-Profit Company ‚Äì Proceeds support local communities‚úÖ Small Group Tours ‚Äì More personalized experience‚úÖ Expert Guides ‚Äì Leonardo was absolutely amazing!‚úÖ Unique & Authentic Experiences ‚Äì Go beyond the usual tourist spotsWe returned to the ship feeling like we had truly experienced Lima, not just as visitors, but as guests welcomed into the community.If you‚Äôre visiting Lima, Haku Tours is the BEST choice! Book with them‚Äîyou won‚Äôt regret it!‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è Highly Recommend!#HakuTours #BestTourInLima #TravelWithPurpose #LimaPeru #Pachacamac #ShantyTownTour #LocalExperience #LeonardoTheBest #SupportNonProfits

title: Two unforgettable days in Lima
text: Amadeo was an excellent guide. He made a point of getting to know us. He was very knowledgeable and had interesting anecdotes to add to the tour. Highly recommended- best tour by far.

title: Unforgettable Lima
text: Our eyes were opened in Lima - so much to see, do and enjoy here. We were fabulously looked after on our Haku Tour, & our guide was skilled & knowledgeable. He was able to be flexible and adjust the tour to fit with what we, as a group, enjoyed. Going with him to the shantytown was our highlight of the two days, and we were privileged to go. Buying food and other necessities in the market to pass on to people there was an extra that our group wanted to do, and chipped in for - it was such a pleasure. Meeting the fabulous women at their soup kitchen was also amazing, and giving them fresh chicken and eggs for their cooking. I have travelled much in my life, and this tour was right up there for me. Thank you Haku Tours!

title: Best of Lima Tour
text: What an amazing & thorough tour of Lima. Our guide Cesar was informative, entertaining, a ball of energy and extremely interesting. He really went over and above to ensure we had an enjoyable tour and shared his love of Lima with us. We booked a 2 day tour and our pick up was precise & meeting point very convenient. The tour bus was very comfortable & easy to access. On Day 1 we went to Pachacmac archaeological site. The length of time spent here was perfect and Cesar had a thorough knowledge of the area & sites. We then had a Peruvian lunch (included in the price) at a small, vibrant restaurant. After lunch, we returned to Lima for a walking tour of the main sites, the catacombs & were even invited to join the locals in a traditional dance. Dinner at a restaurant was also included (Cesar actually ran across the road & bought me a lemonade as the restaurant had run out) . We were then driven to the Magic Water Circuit & afterwards, Cesar took us around the many fountains within the park. Day 2 was a visit to a local market, fruit tasting & a visit to a shanty town. We were only in Lima for 2 days on a cruise ship, but came away seeing so many sights and such a wonderful knowledge of Lima - thanks to our extraordinary guide, Cesar. I would HIGHLY recommend this tour. It is such great value for money, we spent a good time at each site & provided so many memorable experiences. This tour was a real highlight of our whole world cruise.

title: Brilliant and Professional  Tour Company
text: I booked our tour from Australia as I felt there was more to offer in Lima than the cruise ship tours. This was the best decision. The tour guides were professional, knowledgeable, caring and friendly. Thank you lovely ladies,  Pamela and Lydia, also thank you to the young man who took us to lunch.We took the ships shuttle bus to Larcomar Shopping Centre in Miraflores and Haku Tours were waiting for us. The communication the day before  was excellent by Whatsapp. Email is also available. I was given  the tour guides phone numbers therefore no stress.The company  also contributes/ donations to the Shanty  Town people.  I am very grateful  we visited Shanty Town. Thank you to everyone who works for Haku Tours.

title: Best Lima Tour
text: One of the best tours we have been on. The tour guide was fun, informative and enthusiastic to show us his country. Highly recommended this tour

title: Wonderful and magnificent. Machu Pichu is impressive. Sacred Valley is beautiful. Cusco is very interesting!
text: Wonderful though demanding due to altitude. We had little time for as much as there is to see and appreciate! All Service provided was very good

title: Super recommended!!
text: Excellent Service from both guides and staff in general. They complied in everything agreed and stood out for their punctuality, excellent treatment and kindness. Super recommended!

title: Unforgettable holidays
text: We had a great time, very attentive and organized all the staff of the vipac Enterprise. Excellence in guides such as Washington Campana, Gabriel, Renzo, etc. Very punctual and attentive always

title: Confusion and stress
text: We had a communication problem due to the shutdown of the railways in Ollantaytambo.... the Enterprise Vipac took a while to solve our route that was all messed up, we lost the night in Aguas Calientes.....Fortunately the other tours we were able to do, but with a lot of stress.

title: Support that makes all the difference
text: Wonderful tour, very attentive and competent staff. Congratulations to all involved.I will recommend to all my friends.

title: Best way to see Peru in 7 days!
text: We were able to see so much of Peru - from Lima to Cusco, Sacred Valley and Machu Picchu! The tour company was great with communication and the itinerary before the trip started. We arrived in Lima a day early to explore it a bit more. They picked us up, helped us with the hotel check in and even stayed with us throughout the check in process at the airport when we left for Cusco.  We elected to go with the Deluxe package and I must say these hotels are top notch and worth the upgrade!All the tour guides were fantastic! Catherine was wonderful in Lima, Robinson was great in Cusco, Fidel was amazing throughout Sacred Valley and helped us with the craziness of the train strike to Machu Picchu. It was a wild week to visit there where many tourists had to alter their plans. We were incredibly grateful for the care and professionalism throughout the fiasco. We wouldn't have known how to navigate the bus/train situation otherwise. And the best news - we made it!!! Our last day was Machu Picchu and it was beautiful. Thank you Vipac for your expertise!!

title: Best trip of my lifeüôè‚ò∫Ô∏è
text: It was the best trip of my life. The people of Peru are extremely friendly and loving, the food is excellent.The Pacific Travel Enterprise is impeccable!! It exceeded my expectations, everything was very professional, very correct. The attention especially of the guide Fernando Navarrete Soto, accompanied us and was attentive to every detail of our trip making it wonderful. Thank you very much ‚ò∫Ô∏èüôè

title: Without a doubt the friendly and knowledgeable guides
text: Maravilhosa. The Enterprise is super organized, punctual, super competent guides. Bons hot√©is . It exceeded my expectations.

title: All very good hospitality, transfers. Organization schedules
text: Some very quick guides excursions little time to meet. It would have been important to spend more time on museums and excursions

title: Great experience
text: On the day of the tour to Machu Pichu there was a shutdown of the buses, which caused turmoil, delay in the tour, emotional wear, anxiety and waiting for 3 hours for the situation to be defined - a couple of our group followed one of the guides that went on foot to Machu Pichu, a real absurd!The guides were extremely attentive, full knowledge of the places visited, polite and friendly.The drivers were polite, helpful and drove cautiously.

title: Highly recommend this bike tour!
text: I was the only one who booked this tour for my time slot, so I got a personal bike tour of the city! My guide was extremely kind and professional. He took me to all the "must see" attractions in Lima. Through this tour, I feel like I got a perfect introduction to the city and I was better able to navigate through the rest of my time. Thanks so much!

title: Great city cycling tour!
text: Such a good way to see the city of Lima and the areas of Miraflores and Barranco. Our guide was great and explained everything really well. Was just two of us so we basically got a private tour! Definitely the best priced tour in the area and a super friendly service

title: Memorable and affordable adventure in Lima
text: Our recent bike tour along Lima's coast was a delightful experience! Despite its brevity, every moment was filled with the refreshing sea breeze and picturesque views. The tour was worth every penny spent, offering a perfect blend of relaxation and exploration. Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable and affordable adventure in Lima that does not take too much of your time!

title: Nice afternoon on the bike
text: Nice tour along the boardwalks of Miraflores, Barranco and Chorrillos, all on bicycle tracks. Guide with good knowledge of the places where we stop. Robust and comfortable bicycles.

title: See Lima by bicycle for a great experience
text: Anthony was a great tour guide. Riding a bike with his lead was a great way to see the ocean front and tour a few neighborhoods. He was extremely knowlegable and informative.

title: Nice tour with good information
text: Anthony has shown us a lot of Miraflores and Barranco. It was a nice tour. He is a nice guy. Thanks for this nice trip!

title: Great bicycle trip in Lima!!!
text: We had a great vBicycle city tour with Anthony Salazar. We had a great time with Antony Salazar. We went all the way to the statue of Jesus. A good climb but well worth it. All the different neighbourhoods haf their own identity. Anthony learned us a lot. THANK YOU! Afterwards we went for lunch with Anthony, thanks for that!We can recommend the tour!!!John and Peta Tims, Hollanda

title: Good, but not great
text: Biking in Lima is great.  Lima is flat and the weather is never too hot.  I do recommend that highly.  The paths by the ocean are well-maintained and safe.However, Mirabici's bikes are heavy and rusty. Their helmets do not seem fully sanitized and they do not require riders to wear a hairnet.   Mirabici is practically the only place you can rent a kids' bike from, and that's a plus.

title: Awesome way to see Lima and get a nice workout in the process
text: We had an incredible 3 (or so) hour tour with Gerard through Miraflores south down the coast and made it up the side of the mountainous Morro Solar lookout. We stopped along the way, got some good tidbits of information about Lima and had an excellent workout in the process. Would recommend for those that like seeing sights, are intermediate bikers and aren‚Äôt afraid of a little sweat. Gerard was super friendly and knowledgeable and got a ton of great photos for us. Thanks Mirabici!

title: We loved the trip with Junior!
text: Junior gave us an excellent tour of Miraflores, Barranco, and Chorrillos! He was very kind and knowledgeable and was very willing to practice Spanish with us. We even got to eat a delicious ceviche along the way! Highly recommend taking this tour with Junior, he is the best guide ever :)

title: Incredible Tour and Guides!
text: Throughout the booking process, KulTour was very responsive and informative. I knew based on our WhatsApp conversations, that the tour was going to be very well put together. Jordan did not disappoint and even exceeded our expectations. We had a great time seeing the Ballestas Island and all of the animals. The lunch at the Pisco distillery was quite good and we had a lot of fun playing drinking games and tasting the various piscos. Lastly, Jordan and the driver (Jos√©) stayed with us until sunrise at Huacachina. I know it was a long day for them, but they made sure we had a great experience.In fact, I had such a good experience that I ended up booking another tour with KulTour. They were very accommodating, making sure we were happy and understood the plans. They were also flexible and willing to work with our schedule and interests!Jordan is a great guide and genuinely cared that we had a good experience. Even after moving on from Lima, he kept in contact with us and made sure we were informed about potential protests or road blocks for our next destinations. It was reassuring to have this information and was comforting to know that Jordan was always willing to help!Highly recommend!

title: Amazing team and experience
text: Absolutely loved this excursion team! Not only did they accomodate when the date we originally chose didnt work for us due to a glitch on tripadvisor but, they willingly let us modify for another date. They even went out of their job description to help me find a COVID vaccination clinic that was verified to get tested before my flight so i could go home. Thank you guys so muchüíØ

title: Great Tour
text: We did a tour of Paracas-Haucachina-Ica tour with Kultour Peru and it was a great experience. Our guide Astrid was amazing. She was knowledgeable, kind and made the tour very informative. The driver Jonathan was also great. They picked us up at our hotel and returned us safely. I would use this company again.

title: Peru üáµüá™
text: I had the best experience in Peru and it was only made better by Jordan. He went far and beyond to look after me.It will be one of my most fondest memories flying over the Nazca lines and sand boarding in the desert. Jordan even pulled over in the desert so I could see the millions of stars.I've stayed in touch with Jordan and can hand on heart say he is one of the kindest people I've ever met.

title: Great company
text: Actually I did that tour and the city Center tour as well, both were great and Jordan had done a great job explaining all the places we visited, it was fun and informative, Jordan did his best to keep up with the schedule and to make sure that all requests are met, for sure I recommend this company!

title: One day tour
text: I can really recommend this activity. Borg Milagros  and Jos√© did a fant√°stic job, which made this trip fun and special. The activity itself of course is also a lot of fun. If you want to do this , you should book here

title: GREAT TOUR!
text: Jhonatan was amazing in this experience, visit the Natural reserve of paracas first and having a delicious breakfast in the port, after that we go to the Oasis of Huacachina, there we did the sundboarding and buguies, my husband and me, we really enjoyed was fun, after that we did a wine and Pisco tasting, we really loved, the landscapes changes in every stop and the private experience was mazing with a good driver ‚ÄúJordan‚Äù and excellent tour guide very recomedable.

title: EXCEPTIONAL EXPERIENCE
text: I did my tour with Jordan, unfortunately I was alone that day but he made me feel very included. It was a beautiful tour, he is very knowledgeable, and speaks great English! I would highly recommend and definitely will be doing another tour with him on my next trip to Peru.

title: Incredible customized Huacachina and Paracas tour
text: Even though the roads were closed the night before due to protests, Jordan made this trip happen in my last day in Peru and we had a blast in my customized private tour. It was a beautiful day, Paracas National Reserve is absolutely gorgeous and unique. Huacachina Oasis didn't disappoint either. Jordan is a great guide and very fluent in English. We had great conversations on our long journey and I ended my trip on an amazing note.

title: Nice enjoyable day
text: Beautiful colorful water fountain show. Dinner with show was awesome! Great birthday experience to do.

title: Beautiful Night !!!
text: We really enjoyed the Show and the park is fantastic, we didnt expect many fountains and meanings all around, the guide was awesome, we pass skiping the long line, Jordan did a great job, after the show we go the restaurant for the dinner show, we really like it , it finish a little late 10:00pm we back at the hotel around 10:25pm.our driver was nice too, thank you KulTour Per√∫.

title: MAGIC WATER SHOW PARK, AMAZING !!!
text: Its more that i expect, i really thought that its going to be one fountain tha we could see the show but its more than that, there are many fountains around with music and a good complement of the history, Jordan Mendieta was great with the explonation, of every fountain and the show was nice too... after that the show was great they will finish with a great exhibition of Peruvian de Paso horses and Marinera. Recommend it !!!

title: AMAZING Water show and Dinner Show with Jordan!
text: FANTASTIC!! Jordan was an amazing guide and host.  What a delightful personality and knowledge.We loved the water show!  What Ana amazing display of culture and history in such a unique way.  And the dinner show‚Äîmore than ever expected!! The dancing and horses were amazing.  As a horse owner myself, I can say the horses were beautiful and well cared for.  It was stunning to see the Peruvian Pasos.

title: Magic Water Show in Lima, Great !!!
text: Thank You Greta ! for a fantastic moment !the park is great ! and the show is so incredible, they will show to you all the peruvian history and many details that your tour guide will explain to you, also every fountain have a meaning and it was fantastic to understand it !Jordan our driver was very nice in everymoment!

title: Not worth the money
text: Definitely not worth the money. We did not "skip the line" at the water show instead we stood in line that went around the block. The food at dinner was mostly beans and very little meat. It was ok but by no means impressive. The dancing was entertaining! This is definitely a tourist trap!

title: Gotta see it!
text: Our guide was great, he was funny and full of great information. The dancers were excellent as was the food. The water show is awesome! Don't miss it.

title: SURPASSING OUR EXPECTATIONS
text: Every aspect of the tour which included the ' magical water fountain ' tour , the ' traditional dancers ' as well as the food served at the dinner buffet was excellent . What made this tour even more special was the enthusiasm and the enters shown JORDAN our tour guide. His contribution and the attitude towards the tour gave us so much we came back to the hotel feeling that we were treated like VIPs.... Thank you Jordan for giving us such a memorable evening. This was something very very special and a evening to always remember.

title: Great tour-our best night time activity in Lima
text: We totally enjoyed the tour with Jordan and our driver (Raenon- sorry for the spelling but this is how you say it.)  The waterpark is totally amazing and it was great to have Jordan explain the meaning of the fountains.  We could have figured this out on our own and spent a lot less money but Jordan was so personable and we felt very safe driving there which was important.  Also then we had the extra activity of going to Barranco and the dinner show.  The food at the show was just okay but the dancing was really great.  We thoroughly enjoyed our evening out.

title: amazing experience, highly recommend
text: There were some road repairs; therefore, the drive was longer than what the original tour description said. The tour guide did contact me beforehand to warn me and offered alternative tours. However, I want to see the stone forest and get in touch with the Andes Mountains since I am not going to the highland area this trip, so I told them I still would like to go. The drive was long and rough, considering Peru doesn't have the US or European standard of highway. However, the tour and hike itself are amazing. The long drive, in my opinion, is worth it.I was traveling solo and was the only client on that day. My guide was still giving 100% effort and made sure I got all the photos I wanted. I didn't catch his name, but I went on the tour on 8/2. The driver doesn't speak much English, but did a great job navigating through the roads. It was a difficult job to drive in the mountains like that. Overall, I enjoyed my tour and think this is the best 200 USD I have spent on tours ever.

title: Best way to spend a day outside taking in the high Andes
text: Great guide, well planned and arranged! Our guide Marco made sure that we got the best possible experience! Marcahausi is a phenomenal hike...

title: Perfecto
text: Incredible journey with Carlos and his dog Qusi ! Stunning views there and the hike was so amazing.

title: Thrilling drive into the mountains, amazing hike, beautiful scenery
text: Marco is an amazing driver: both in navigating the lunacy of Lima traffic and the single lane dirt road to Marcahuasi. We enjoyed spending the day with him. We visited on a Monday and hiked 6 km without spotting another person. The stone giants, ruins, ampitheater and views of the valley far below were spectacular. It was definitely a highlight of our trip to Lima.

title: Pure Peru Magic
text: If you want a spiritual experience, a cool hike with amazing views, and some history of ancient Peru, this experience has it all. Carlos was the best guide I could ever ask for and made it feel like I was just walking with a friend. He knows all about the area and helps you see, feel, and manifest the magic of the mountains. Don't let the uphill climb scare you, it's not bad at all and the views at the top are more than worth it. Do not miss this experience if you visit Lima.

title: Nice trip
text: Fantastic trip on June 3rd. Beautiful day and high mountain view, the route was carefully planned by Marco Antonio. It was a very desirable get away from a busy business trip. Thank you Marco!

title: Excellent Trip, Wonderful Guide
text: On top of the incredible location, Carlos is a great guide with deep knowledge of the area. He has a strong relationship with the people living near Marcahuasi, and was a pleasure to spend the day with. This trip felt less like a typical touristy excursion, and more like hiking with a friend. I‚Äôm always concerned that guided tours will feel inauthentic, but hiking Marcahuasi with Carlos was one of the most authentic experiences I had during my visit to Lima.

title: Great tranquil getaway from Lima
text: The tour exceeded our expectations in every way. Our remote team was having a meetup in Lima, and this day trip turned out to be the perfect bonding experience. Carlos made our excursion feel truly exclusive and personalized, showing attentiveness and care throughout the entire journey.What made the experience special was how Carlos shared the rich context of Marcahuasi, helping us get into the right mindset to fully appreciate this unique location. He happily took countless photos for us and thoughtfully created moments for our team to connect with each other.Carlos was incredibly accommodating, adjusting details to ensure our complete satisfaction. His relaxed demeanor, positive energy, and professionalism made the entire day flow smoothly.The breakfast and lunch spots he selected were authentic gems that added to the local experience - nothing touristy, just genuine Peruvian hospitality.Be prepared for the lengthy drives to and from Marcahuasi, but Carlos ensures the time in the car is enjoyable and comfortable. He goes above and beyond to make everyone feel at ease throughout the journey.I highly recommend this tour for anyone looking for a memorable Peruvian experience outside the city!

title: Adventure outside of Lima in a day trip
text: The tour was really amazing, from an adventurous road trip in steep roads with the guide who is an experienced driver and has the right car, over to the hiking trip and several local stops. Highly recommend this guide and tour

title: Great coaching and vibes
text: Amazing day out!!Both carlos and the instructor were great vibes and I went from being awful to getting down the dunes! Instructor great at capturing everything on your mobile too. Truly a great experience!

title: Amazing, highly recommend!
text: I would HIGHLY recommend they were so fantastic! They were patient with my 6 and 3 year old. They treated us so well and we had so much fun. I appreciated how mellow they were and understanding of our low skill level this was such a highlight! Thank you so much! You guys were amazing!

title: Thrilling and Life Changing Experience
text: Me and my best friends were looking for something exciting to do in Lima, so we decided to try out sand boarding and could not have been more impressed! We were initially hesitant to book with this company due to the lack of reviews, but definitely made the right decision. Abraham and Carlos were both amazing, and the experience itself was very thrilling! Could not recommend these guys more!

title: Definitely Recommend!
text: We had such a blast!! The whole experience from being picked up from our Airbnb to getting dropped back off again was great! It was fun (and maybe a little bit thrilling) riding in the car with Carlos, he was engaging and quick to answer questions we had. Then when we got to the sand dunes, Abraham‚Äôs experience and skills had time to shine! He was so patient with us as we learned to sand board - which was SO fun! I only wish we could have had a longer time there in the dunes - once we started we really didn‚Äôt want to stop!

title: Great day trip
text: Was a great trip out to the dunes + 3 runs of boarding down the hills. Thanks for the lessons and cool photos! Sandboarding is a lot harder than snowboarding

title: Awesome
text: I cannot recommend this highly enough it is AMAZING,! We got picked up from our hotel in Lima on time by Abraham (instructor) and Eddie our hilarious driver - buzzed out of Lima and hit the dunes! My 17 year old twins loved every minute, and I was so relieved we had such a fab team as I was a little apprehensive to start. The mountains are beautiful and it was well worth the trip. Cheaper than the other companies I took the gamble and was very pleased I did. Take this company and don‚Äôt worry as they are BRILLIANT,!

title: Exhilarating fun
text: This was a thrilling experience. I was worried that being overweight I wouldn‚Äôt be able to enjoy it but Abraham taught me how to use the Sandboard as a sled. It was a great experience. We were a group of 5 and the guides made sure everyone had a good time. Be warned the ride to get up the sand dunes is part of the experience. We‚Äôve never been skiing or snowboarding much less sandboarding and with no experience we still had some great runs.

title: Once in a lifetime, only in Lima!
text: Peru is about bucket lists. No better place to empty the bucket than in an equatorial desert. This adventure is way more than supreme sand boarding with the ocean on the horizon. Carlos as your dune driver and DJ is extraordinary. The pan sandwiches from the wood fired oven a sumptuous surprise. Frost is an incredible instructor who makes even beginners successful sandboarders.  My 20 yo said this was his far out favorite activity in Peru. More memorable than Machu Picchu. Once in a lifetime, only in Lima!

title: Awesome sandboarding trip!
text: We had such a blast doing this sandboarding, an experience we will always remember! Provided everything we needed to have a great time. Thank you!

title: Amazing!
text: Some friends and I were in Peru. We were supposed to do a hike but because of Covid we couldn‚Äôt do it. Carlos, our guide reached out and gave us other options, one being Sandboarding. We had the most amazing experience. Aldo, his parter was not only a great instructor, but also took awesome pictures and videos that my friends and I reposted. All in all, an amazing experience.

title: Great time and a lot of fun for free!
text: I booked this tour at the last minute and I had a lot of fun. I met a lot of travellers and we got free shots and free pass to a big club in Lima. This was more fun than I expected. I highly recommend to take this free pub crawl.

title: Fun Night Out with Friends
text: I joined the Free Pub Crawl with my friends, and it turned out to be a really fun night. The guides kept the group organized and made the atmosphere lively, while also taking us to some great local spots we wouldn‚Äôt have found on her own. It was a safe, well-run experience and a perfect way to enjoy Lima‚Äôs nightlife with friends.

title: Great vegan food tour
text: We had a fantastic time on the vegan food tour with Nathaly! It was great having the opportunity to taste vegan versions of authentic dishes as well as exploring the city. Nathaly was very friendly and knowledgeable and made our tour a lot of fun. Would highly recommend this even if you only have 1-2 days in Lima!

title: Trip of a lifetime! Five star Service and quality
text: As an Indian American Vegetarian family of 3 (2 adults and a 12 year old child), we feel fortunate to have picked this trip for our Lima trip. Dulce was our guide for the day and she was so diligent, intelligent, attentive, funny, entertaining that she made this a trip of a lifetime! We walked around the beautiful Barranco neighborhood with Dulce, started our journey with a tasting session with history and gastronomy lesson. With several stops through the 4 hours trip, there were thousands of picture moments through the trendy and stylish neighborhood. Dulce taught us so much about Peruvian culture, cuisine and her history. We enjoyed every stop and the delicious food and drinks. I would highly recommend this trip and a special mention of Dulce as your guide! She will make this a family trip worth cherishing for lifetime.

title: So much fun and great food!
text: We did the vegan food tour in the Barranco area while in Lima on vacation. Johana was such a great guide ‚Äî she provided so much insight into the local culture and neighborhoods, and made us feel welcome. Bring your appetite for this tour, which I highly recommend.

title: Awesome Adventure!!!!
text: This tour was incredible and Galia was the best tour guide I‚Äôve ever had hands down!! We visited 5 awesome restaurants/cafes and we loved each one of them and learned so much about Peruvian culture and food. We enjoyed coffee, delicious chocolate, ceviche, potatoes, fried zucchini with rice and gelato. We also learned how to make a Pisco Sour. This was the highlight of our trip and we will definitely do more tours with Galia when we return!! Thank you so much for this wonderful adventure!!

title: Amazing vegan food
text: Awesome vegan sampling tour. Natalie is very knowledgeable about food, but also history and politics. Visited chocolate shop; small local market where we tried juices and fruits, restaurant for vegan ceviche, another restaurant for spirits and Chinese food, and finished with sorbet.One of the best half day tours I have ever done. Natalie is a gem.

title: Yummy Peruvian Food!
text: Galia was our super-friendly and sweet tour guide. The tour was a nice way to see some lovely streets in an unhurried manner. The selection of places to sample food was outstanding and super local. We particularly loved the  ceviche place and the pisco place where we also got a sizable portion of the saltado. Galia also took us into the kitchen at one of the places to watch the chef!

title: Amazing Vegan Foods of Lima
text: Galia was an amazing tour guide, super friendly and sweet. She guided us on a walking tour of Barranco stopping at all these cute spots to teach us about the Peruvian culture and foods. It was a very informative tour and we got to taste so many delicious traditional Peruvian foods and drinks. Galia was amazing, she took many photos of us and really made the experience so social.

title: Wonderful Way to See La Barranca
text: This tour was a fantastic way to spend a half day in Lima. Vegan preferences are well accommodated and I was able to experience delicious flavors as well as take in the ambiance and history of La Barranca. All arrangements flowed smoothly and I really enjoyed spending time with my guide who was really wonderful!I recommend this tour!

title: Awesome tour for non-vegans and vegans
text: Nathaly is an amazing guide and one of our favorite guides we've had. =)She was friendly, easy to understand and shared a lot of interesting facts that kept my attention.My husband is not vegan and he said this was his favorite tour of our Peru trip.  That says a lot!  So if you're not vegan - it's okay....don't be afraid.I did not expect to enjoy it so much.  I thought it was just going to be tasting food from one vegan restaurant to the next.  It was educational and interesting.I loved learning about the different flavor profiles of the chocolate and how it's made.Fruit tasting was cool - I now love granadillas so much!The Chilcano drink gave me a nice buzz. =)I really like how we were able to view the preparation of the food and drinks sampled. It's a very nice touch - there's more learning that way.One suggestion would be to let the restaurant know ahead of time (or remind them) - of anyone's dietary restrictions.  It is labeled a vegan tour - I expected all of the dishes we sampled to be vegan.  They had to remake the causa and also they had fish stock ready to be put in the ceviche.  It's not a big deal because I always ask about all the ingredients before eating.Totally recommend this tour for everybody!

title: Great visit of the culinary wonders of Peru
text: Great tour of old area of Barrancos, lead by our tour guide Desiree. Very interesting, varied, going from chocolate to pisco sour and ceviche.We enjoyed ourselves and learnt quite a bit about every day life in Peru

title: Ahavea Tase, and so should you
text: This is one of two best inexpensive eats with common fare with friendly staff. Located on the back of the Fagatogo Fruit Market in downtown Pago Pago American Samoa, No indoor seating but on a tropical Island why stay indoors. Just really a few steps from the harbor view to enjoy with the meal.

title: What an amazing experience our son found for us at TripAdvisor! Highly recommend!
text: What an amazing experience our son found for us at TripAdvisor! This wasn't just a cooking class; it was a deep dive into local culture and history, including a fascinating "market tour",  "fruits test" and a four-course cooking session. The level of detail and engagement was truly impressive. Christian, our instructor, was exceptionally informative and clearly had a wealth of knowledge to share. We were also struck by how clean and well-organized the kitchen was. The lesson itself was perfectly structured, and the dishes we prepared were absolutely delicious ‚Äì even for us, who cook a lot at home, every single dish was new and exciting! We highly recommend it.

title: How to learn about Peruvian food
text: Sensational experience! Everything was organized in detail thanks to the care of Christian, Yurac and Maritza. You can see the passion with which they have been carrying on the business for over 10 years.Christian's knowledge of the market was really satisfying, he gave us a lot of information about all sorts of customs.The cooking class is fantastic, you prepare the dishes step by step and then consume them just ready. Really all delicious, get ready because you eat really much!

title: Excellent experience; worth the money!
text: I‚Äôm 90 miles from Chicago & sure wish SkyKitchen was in this area of the US. This cooking class was excellent!!! Christian & his staff are professional, patient, gave us interesting info (including some history) about Peruvian foods. There were many steps in our 4-course meal & Instructions were clear. Food was delicious, & we made it ourselves! I had pisco sours elsewhere in Peru & NONE were as good as the one he should us how to make. Definitely worth the money for this experience.

title: Market tour, 35 fruit tasting and 4-course Peruvian cooking class in Lima
text: The tour was super fun, from shopping in the market, with various curiosities and explanations, to the tasting of fruits that he had never experienced and, most importantly, the preparation of the dishes, made in a simple and fun way. The cordiality and charisma of Jurac and Christian are also the highlight of the experience.

title: From Non cooker to Peruvian Meal
text: As cooking is not high on my priority list Chef Yurac made it easy.  He took my friend and I to the market to pick up some ingredients, then back to his roof top kitchen where he gave us a taste test of a variety of fruits , which included 6 different types of bananas, then commenced to guide us thru preparing and cooking a 4 course Peruvian Meal to include cocktail and desert!  Wonderful experience was had and he even sent us the recipes by email, great cooking and eating experience

title: Fun and Authentic!
text: We really enjoyed our time with the SkyKitchen team. You can tell that they really enjoy what they do. We learned a lot and had a lot of fun. Everything was so well planned and organized by the team.

title: I had the best cooking experience.
text: I learned a lot about the geographical environment of Peru, how to select ingredients, fruit tasting, even recipes for authentic Peruvian cuisine.They entertained the participants while learning to cook.Thank you for the best memories I could not experience in Japan.

title: Christian helped me create the most amazing food ever
text: Christian is a lovely fellow, excellent cook, and a patient and inspiring teacher. We had a fun visit to the local market where he taught me all about Peruvian produce and chose fruit and fish for our meal. Then we spent the rest of the morning in his fresh, cosy rooftop kitchen along with his able assistant Marta and another couple of clients. We made the most amazing food, I've never produced anything as good. The only problem was there was so much I couldn't eat it all. He also provides you with a link to recipes so you can try your skills at home. I'm going to attempt it with my son in law who's very enthusiastic to try Peruvian cuisine.Sign up for cooking with Christian at SkyKitchen, you'll be glad you did!. Try to do it at the beginning of your Peru trip so you can better appreciate all the other meals you'll eat while you're there, Peruvian cuisine is great.

title: Cooking class Lima
text: We are a group of 10, with different cooking experiences and very different cooking knowledge. We did a market tour first and then fruits tasting and cooking class. Everyone enjoyed it very much.Christian, Yurac, Maritza, thank you so much.

title: Must-try dinner experience in Lima!
text: Maverick and Manuel were amazing guides throughout this experience! We had such a fun time and were paired with two Spanish-speakers. Maverick helped translate everything for us and we all felt like friends by the end of the class! The ceviche was amazing and I was stuffed by the end of it. It was such a wonderful and interactive dinner experience. Would absolutely do this again and recommend to anyone traveling to Lima.

title: Get out of your comfort zone!
text: Fantastic experience with Maverick and Manuel. Really fun group and delicious food. Ceviche was a bit of a mystery to me before - now I‚Äôm an expert!

title: MUST DO IN PERU!! üáµüá™
text: This class was absolutely AMAZING! From start to finish, the chefs made the whole experience so much fun. Not only did we learn how to make authentic ceviche and pisco sours, but they also taught us about the history and culture in the process. We had chefs Maverick and Josep and they were super nice, welcoming, and had us laughing the entire time!! We were even dancing while shaking the pisco sours! The ceviche and the pisco sours were so fresh and yummy! The energy of the class made it unforgettable. Honestly, it felt less like a class and more like hanging out with new friends who just happen to be expert chefs. If you're in Peru, this is a must do experience. Highly recommend!!! üòä

title: Unforgettable experience with Karina and Maverick. Cook your own ceviche and sour pisco
text: It's an unforgettable experience.Karina and Maverick made this one of the best experiences in Lima and in addition to sharing their recipes we shared history of this great country that is Peru. It's totally worth it and they shouldn't miss it. Besides the ceviche and pisco were delicious. We are very grateful for this experience and 100% recommend it. Thank you chefs!!! We take them to Mexico in the heart and belly!!

title: Amazing!! Thank you Maverick and joeseph
text: Maverick and Joseph gave us the best experience ever! Lovely people, very attentive, great food and great company. I cannot recommend this enough. Thank you

title: Fun cooking class
text: It was a fantastic experience. The class was good fun and really easy to follow along. And thanks to our host Meveric who made it a great evening.

title: Wonderful staff.
text: A great experience our host Maverick was was very knowledgeable and chef was very helpful teaching us cooking methods.

title: Excellent experience
text: Excellent class, Paola and Jose were very good hosts, we really had a good time and the result was very delightful as well, I definitely recommend this class to learn the basics of Peruvian cooking.

title: Fun and delicious!
text: Paolo and Chef Ruth were incredible guides and explained some secrets to ceviche that really helped to make it pop. This was an incredible experience and we had so much fun!

title: Fantastic food, staff and fun!
text: The experience was amazing.  The chef and chef's assistant were professional, well informed, friendly, and organized.  The food we created was delicious.  Our fellow classmates helped to create a festive, positive experience.  I highly recommend this acitivity.  Price was a bargain.

title: A Must Do Adventure Near Lima (safe for Beginners!!)
text: I had the absolute best time sandboarding in the sand dunes!! One of the biggest highlights of my trip to Peru!! My guide, Annie, as well as the instructors were very patient and encouraging as I had never done something like this before. We progressively got to more difficult dunes and while it was scary at first, I was surprised at how well I was able to pick it up.I was picked up from my hotel at 7am and requested an airport drop off on the way back, getting there promptly at 1pm. They provided lots of water and fruits as a snack. Annie spoke excellent English and Luis was helpful in demonstrating and carrying everything back up the dunes. They also got some extremely cool videos and pictures of me.I cannot recommend enough!!!

title: Great Time on the Dunes
text: Aldo was very professional AND skilled. Had a great time getting out on the dunes with my friend. The whole crew that helped us was amazing as well, thank you to Luis and everyone else!Felt lucky to be able to go around sunset when it was not too hot as well!

title: We had the Dunes to ourselves!
text: This was one of the highlights of our 2.5 week trip all over Peru! I almost booked in Huacachina however it didn‚Äôt work out with our schedule and I am SO GLAD it didn‚Äôt! Not only did we have a private lesson and the gorgeous dunes of Ancon all to ourselves  (which was incredible), but we ran into other travelers who said the Huacachina dunes were over crowded. This location was magical, close to Lima, and our instructor, Aldo, was fantastic. He was super patient with us, had a great sense of humor, and took so many amazing videos and photos (which was another amazing perk!). Our driver, Carlos, was also amazing and was super competent with how to navigate the dunes. Aldo has a lot of pride for his beautiful country and also does a lot for the youth in his community, which was great to hear about.An 11/10 experience all around.

title: Amazing, espectacular
text: Amazing experience!! All the team is super professional and we have the best time, if you are in Lima and have a half they free , do it!

title: The best way to engage with the desert landscape
text: We had half a day with Aldo and Eddie on the dunes north of Lima.  The experience was just extraordinary.   Aldo taught us (a family of four with two boys 13 and 10) how to sand board.  We‚Äôve never done any snowboarding or surfing or anything like this before, Aldo was very patient and you can tell he has a lot of experience working with kids.  His passion for the sport is also contagious.  The dunes were beautiful, especially during the hours near sunset.  And we had it all to ourselves.  When our SUV drove off the road into the dunes it really felt like an adventure.  In the end we could somewhat make our way down the halfpipe, a large sand structure deep in the wilderness.Our flight into Lima was delayed and so our experience was cut short. We didn‚Äôt have time lunch and had to go straight to this activity after getting off our flight. Aldo got us sandwiches so that we could have energy.  We really appreciated that.

title: Amazing.
text: Amazing guide and incredible experience. Picked me up at the airport and there was a couple along with myself that rode in the back row of the SUV. Gave great instructions. Be prepared to fall and get slightly injured. I was going too fast when I basically ate it and rolled over. Was sore for a few days but definitely worth it.

title: More than an experience, a life changinging adventure.
text: I came to Lima last on my trip, and initially, I felt like I should have put more days in Cusco. Alonso, Sebastian, and Rolando changed my mind. I had such a fantastic time. Alonso and Sebastian picked me up promptly at my hotel, where we then traveled to pick up my instructor Rolando. Everyone was super friendly and were joking and laughing the whole way to the sandboarding experience.Alonso is an excellent driver who knows the dunes well. If you have never been off roading before, do not worry. You are in good hands. Alonso is very experienced.Once out in the dunes, Rolando helped familiarize me with the equipment and assessed my experience level. He was very patient and explained everything I would need to know as a complete newbie. He very quickly had me up and practicing on some small dunes, encouraging me the whole way. By the end, he successfully had me board down a 100m dune! At all times, he made sure I was comfortable with whatever dune we were about to ride.The ride back was just as fun as the ride out, and we even went through the flavellas as a kind of bonus tour. 12/10, 100% recommend

It was a very great adventure. I saw a lot of things, I learned to sandboard and I had a lot of fun.Everything was very well organized and the team is very friendly, helpful and professional. Thank you very much for this wonderful experience.

title: Amazing!!
text: This experience was one of a kind. Our kids had the time of their lives. I would recommend this to anyone traveling to Lima. We are all skiers with NO snowboarding experience. We were given a crash course and in the end were able to go down the sand dunes on the "sandboard"!

title: Amazing
text: The most amazing experience!! The tour guides were so kind and took plenty of pictures and videos for us. I wouldn‚Äôt have wanted to go with anyone else

title: Great tour
text: The tour of the city of Lima was great, having as the main point the Larco museum, which is very worth knowing and with a guide and always more enriching because we not only see the works but also we can better understand each one of them!

title: MAYROL, HE JOINED US, FILLED US WITH INFORMATION, HAD A GREAT TIME!
text: THE EXPERIENCE WAS VERY NICE, MARIOL ACCOMPANIED US AND GUIDED US WITH GREAT PASSION ON THE CITY TOUR OF LIMA AND ALSO IN THE LARCO MUSEUM

title: Excellent trip in Lima
text: The experience was wonderful with the guide Gabriel Salazar, who conducted the visit with great attention and knowledge, reporting with rich detail on the history of Lima and Peru. All attendees were great.

title: Professionals 100%
text: Exceptional Maiyol and Marco !!! Mayrol was in every detail both of the different excursions, and to evacuate any doubts or suggestions. Highly recommended and professional. Afflicted

title: Excellent city tour of Lima
text: I hereby want to communicate to the Enterprise. My very broad gratification to the services provided by Gabriel Salazar guide and driving Benjamin. Thank you both and particularly in the guide part to Gabriel. He put his knowledge and all his kindness all the way. I totally recommend!!

title: Wonderful Experience
text: Maria was my guide and Jorge was my driver - both were wonderful! They made me feel very comfortable despite being the only person on the tour. Maria was very knowledgeable and answered every question I had. Jorge was punctual and courteous. Def do this tour if you like history!

title: Guia Mayrol
text: Beautiful experience, our guide Mayrol super predisposed and explained very well! A genius üëèüèªüëèüèª Thank you Peru for these days

title: Wonderful!!! Amazing guide!
text: Our walk was amazing! Our guide Gabriel Salazar was very good with us, always helping us with everything we needed. He has much knowledge about the history of Peru, about the natives and also about after the arrival of the Spaniards.We had a wonderful experience and he provided us with greater enjoyment of the tour, always ready to help us solve our doubts! I highly recommend Enterprise and especially the guide Gabriel Salazar, congratulations!!!

Excellent Service were very punctual in all departures for the tours and the guides demonstrated extensive knowledge of both history and culture, everything was very well organized and complete, fully recommended.

title: Frustrating
text: I thought the guided tour would bring more historical information. The guide is very friendly and cordial, but was unable to convey historical knowledge, in addition to some anecdotes. I abandoned the tour at Museo Larco (which is amazing!) and did the visit alone, found it more profitable.

title: Lima Market Tour & Cooking Class
text: We had a great time during the market tour and cooking class. Our guide Sheyla was so knowledgeable and shared so many fun and interesting Peruvian facts with us. She was also an expert translator, which we appreciated greatly, especially during the class itself. She was so kind and welcoming and truly made this experience such a special memory for us! We also learned a lot from the chef and bartender as well, thanks to their very talented culinary skills! 10/10 would recommend this authentic Peruvian activity.

title: Very good experience
text: Spectacular experience. With our guide Dul we enjoy seeing the market as well as the subsequent elaboration in class of cause cooking, ceviche and pisco sauer

title: Muy d√≠a divertido
text: What an amazing experience! Had the best time and my guide Valeria was a gem. She was super helpful and professional. She made the day truly special :-)

title: Great food cooking class!
text: We had an excellent tour!! The cooking class was great fun, the food marvellous. Our guide, Manuel, was both very knowledgeable and pleasant. He took pictures and videos so that we could go home with a hands-on recipe. We recommend this tour for everyone, especially foodies.

title: Fun way to learn about Peruvian cuisine
text: It was a fun experience. Guide explained a lot about Peruvian products and some history about them. Chef was very kind and food that we prepared was delicious.

title: Had an amazing time on the tour with Valeria!
text: This was an amazing tour! Valeria was an incredible host and shared so much about Peru‚Äôs regional foods, history, and she was so warm and friendly! We tried so many new fruits at the market and she did a great job explaining each one. Then we made ceviche at a local restaurant, and I thoroughly enjoyed finally learning how one of my favorite Peruvian foods is made! We also made a great pisco sour, and even tried some other new foods! We had a great time talking about history, different ingredients, and daily life in Peru. Would definitely recommend!

title: Peruvian cooking classes
text: A very nice day with Valeria. First visit to a park and a market where we could taste different local fruits. Then we went to a restaurant for a Peruvian cooking class. Everything was perfect.

title: Cooking class
text: The cooking class at La Patrona Restaurant was amazing. The ingredientes were on point. She is very knowledgeable and kind. Highly recommended üíØ

title: Good information, and good service
text: Dulce was very informative and friendly to our customers. The places to visit were fine, although they could be better.

title: Local Peruvian cuisine
text: It was very informative and showed us a more relaxed side of Lima and gastronomy and local products. The market and its colors, fruits, as well as novelty ingredients caught my interest as an empirical cook. It was fun to have the cooking class, because in addition to learning to make pisco, ceviche and causa, we could eat what we prepared.

title: Excellent evening in Lima with Amy
text: We went out with Amy on our first night in Lima for this truly excellent food tour. Every part of the experience was excellent - guide, cocktails, food, and environments. Highly recommended.

title: Amazing food and tour guide!
text: Amazing food, and very knowledgeable and fantastic tour guide! A good combination of culinary experience and local history.

title: AMAZING food and experience
text: We had an excellent tour with Sue! All of the food we tried was absolutely delicious and our guide was very knowledgable about all the food and all of our Peru questions. We highly recommend this tour during your time in Lima - you will learn a lot, have a lot of fun, and eat AMAZING food.

title: Great evening. Well arranged. Great guide - Patricia.
text: We enjoyed our experience. Patricia our guide was great. Her spoken English was very good and very informative. The tour arrangements were well arranged and Patricia handled the group well. Our favourite restaurant was Cala next to the coast - it was very atmospheric. The ceviche was delicious and we lived the Pisco cocktail.

title: Beyond 5 stars
text: This tour completely blew us away! My partner and I had an amazing time, and I wish I could give it more than 5 stars.Let‚Äôs start with the tour itself. 4 beautiful venues each one with tastings of so many different delicious Peruvian dishes (of ample portion sizes!). In every location we got a description of the food, the venue‚Äôs location and its significance in Peruvian history. We ate by the seaside, next to historical ruins, and in the city‚Äôs cultural and artistic center. Each meal was accompanied by a pairing of a beverage, and even the drinks were expertly tailored to suit the food.Now I have to talk about the tour guide, Sue. Sue is by far my favorite tour guide I‚Äôve had in Peru. Not only was she extremely knowledgeable, she is also incredibly passionate about her country, her culture and the food, and this made the experience so much richer for us.
