reviewed.title: Peru: City Highlights Tour with Local Guide

title: Fantastic Marco in Lima!
text: Marco was an amazing guide, very well-spoken and very knowledgeable. It was great to learn about some of the hidden gems of Lima‚Äôs city center and its architectural wonders like Casa Aliaga and the Hotel Bolivar, which we truly enjoyed. Highly recommend him as a guide and the activity as a whole.

title: History
text: Typically colonial style house, excellently preserved, exudes a nostalgic past, fabulous gardenIt was a much appreciated visit and therefore to be recommended.

title: Renzo was a great guide!
text: Renzo was an excellent guide for our Lima city tour! He was both knowledgeable and personable. Plus, he made the history interesting, with a variety of perspectives...he clearly loves the history of his country and city. His English is excellent. I highly recommend requesting him.

title: A family home that deserves to be listed by UNESCO. Anyone expecting a gem would be enchanted, an incredible experience
text: UNESCO historic family home of the 17th century. Descendants of a companion of Pizarro.Incredibly beautiful, lots of little beauties.Thank you for letting me experience this. A highlight of my visit here in Peru. Thank you, thank you. üòäüåû

title: Great tour of Lima!
text: Sophia was a fantastic guide this morning. She‚Äôs very knowledgeable about Lima history and local culture. The Casa de Aliaga is impressive and the pisco sour was a nice treat!Thanks Sophia!

title: A must tour of Lima
text: Excellent tour and tour guide Sophia was wonderful she took care of us answered any questions was very informative and knowledgeable and I highly recommend this tour to all

title: Fantastic tour of Casa de Aliaga and downtown Lima
text: We had a fantastic tour of Casa de Aliaga and the historic centre of Lima with our guide Manuel. We really wanted to visit Casa de Aliaga after seeing photos online and it didn't disappoint. Manuel helped us understand the historical context of the Aliaga family as well as the house and its artwork. When walking around downtown Lima, Manuel picked up on our interest in architecture and history. We wouldn't have seen anything like we did had we walked around on our own. We ended our tour with a pisco sour at the beautiful Gran Hotel Bol√≠var. Manuel is a great guide and very knowledgeable and passionate about his city. I highly recommend this tour for a unique insight into Lima.

title: Great tour.
text: We had a great tour. The guide was knowledgeable and friendly. Cost was fair and our guide spent a lot of time explaining the highlights.The cemetery was something we had never seen before.

title: Excellent tour - highly recommend!
text: We had an amazing tour! Enrique was very knowledgeable, told great stories and took us to all the best spots - highly recommend!!

title: Great tour
text: Our guide,  Juan,  had a wealth of knowledge that ranged from Peruvian history, the church in Peru, wars fought in Peru, and the dark magic arts.A very informative and entertaining afternoon.

title: Highlight of my trip to Lima
text: Incredible experience! Highlight of my time in Lima for sure, but would recommend to everyone. Will definitely be using Peruvian Worldview next time I visit.

title: The highlight of my short time in Lima!
text: The highlight of my short time in Lima! This was such an amazing tour. It was unique and fascinating to see and learn about both the catacombs and the cemetery. I‚Äôve always had a love for bones and cemeteries and having a private tour getting to learn about the Peruvian death traditions was an incredible experience. Our guide was awesome! Jean had a unique perspective on everything we saw and was very knowledgeable about more than just the catacombs and the cemetery. If you have any interest in activities slightly off the beaten path, or the darker side of Lima, I definitely recommend this tour! It was even better than I expected!

title: Insightful and sometimes spooky!
text: Marco was our tour guide and he was fantastic. Really knowledgeable about many things, even outside of the funeral industry in Lima. Looking into the death of a culture can tell you a lot about how life is lived there. We talked a lot about the practicalities of burial but we also talked spooky stuff too. Highly recommend this tour.

title: Great detail
text: Great history of Lima and interesting facts about both the catacombs and cemetery. Never felt rushed and really enjoyed my entire trip

title: Very interesting!!
text: The history of the Franciscans and their installations is very interesting (although I don't agree with so much wealth) but the show is the catacombs with the bones and anti-earthquake structure... and the belief of the grantees...

title: Must do if looking for a UNIQUE history filled experience!
text: This tour is a MUST do if you are interested in checking out the Catacombs AND the largest cemetery in the America's! I had previously did a catacombs tour that was included as part of a city tour and it just seemed rushed! I really appreciated the extra time taken by my tour guide Jean who made sure I had all the history and answered any additional questions I had! I learned soooo much in the short time we were in the catacombs! Since it was a private tour, I elected to spend more time at the cemetery and I was def worth it!! I was AMAZED and also learned a LOT from this portion of the tour! I really liked that the vehicle was air conditioned, door pickup, the history lesson while on the way to the locations AND the Peruvian Churro as a snack! I would recommend this tour to anyone visiting Lima that wants to do something a little less traditional! What a unique experience!

title: Great tour with a great guide
text: Marco was amazing, treated us with respect and made sure we had fun while we learned about the culture. The cemetery tour was very interesting. Loved it, highly recommend.

title: Practical and quick feature considering chaotic vehicle traffic
text: The registration could facilitate when we are in a hotel, being able to put the address of the Hotel, plus it is very easily quiet to use, a pity that the points are just around miraflores, should have points along the entire edge

title: Fantastic value all day hire for $AUD 21.
text: It was super easy to organize the voucher through TripAdvisor. They provide bicycles specifically dedicated to your size. I was staying in Miraflores and took a bus for 2 Sol to grab the bike. Diego spoke perfect English and, gave me a map and explained everything. In Mira Flores you are basically on dedicated bicycle lines so it is quite safe. Helmet and lock supplied Surprisingly the drivers respect the bicycle lanes and are careful. You could ride all the way into downtown but I'm not sure that's the greatest of ideas. I visited the ancient ruins site of Huaca Pucilano then headed for the coast and Ride Along the bicycle lane to the Morro Solar. I must admit you probably need Google Maps to work out exactly where you are at times. I had a great day hire from 9:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. what a bargain. I highly recommend it.

title: wonderful way to explore Lima
text: Kral was our guide - He was very helpful and kept us all very safe . His commentary on the sites of interest was clear , concise and informative. I highly recommend the tour.

title: Great way to spend a few hours
text: Everything from Beta‚Äôs warm welcome at the Gogo location, to Kral‚Äôs warmth / knowledge, to the safely chosen rout was fantastic.

title: Bike file is very good
text: Sundays are special days for cycling in Lima because the main avenues in Miraflores are closed to car traffic. I rented a city bike from GogoBiking for 3 hours. Valeria was super friendly and helpful, she recommended the itinerary to the historic center and the coast. Almost 40km of beautiful and fun tour with spectacular landscapes.

title: Good service and nice staff
text: Great service and attention to clients. Good bicycles. Good support by the nice staff. We would advise the rent for visiting the miraflores and barranco along the seaside.

title: Cheap way to explore the city
text: Bike was well maintained and it was a great and affordable way of exploring Lima at your own pace. The map was perhaps a little bit hard to follow, but otherwise a great experience

title: Nice ride
text: We did this tour when we visited Lima for a couple of days. Our guide was Jose, and he was very nice and patient. We enjoyed the ride but the portion going uphill to Cerro San Cristobal was very difficult for me. The bikes provided were adequate for most of the ride and helmets were also available. They do not have lockers at the bike rental office but there is a corner where you can store backpacks, etc. since someone is always there. I would recommend doing this if you are in the area.

title: Renting a bike in Lima is a MUST!
text: I had an amazing experience here. I rented for 2 days. Renting a bike in Lima is an absolute must... you see so much of the city, the city is made for biking, you get exercise, and it's one of the fastest ways to get around and live like a local. And if you rent, come here. Super helpful, good bikes, and they will get you on your way!

title: Unforgettable sandboarding experience in Huacachina
text: What an amazing day we have in Huacachina. We started the experience going to the dunes in buggy ride, then we tried going down on the board. What an incredible experience full of adrenaline. Thanks to Rafa, he is an awesome teacher, super friendly that  makes us being confident. Fully recommended experience for any person.

title: Sand skiing
text: Stunning and alfonso took care of every detail! Made me feel so welcomed. And knew his stuff! I highly recommend for an unforgettable experience

title: Sand ride experience w Alfonso!
text: I had an absolute amazing time with the Andrade experience! Alfonso was such an amazing guide! My friend and I had a blast! I can‚Äôt wait to come back again! 10/10 recommend

title: Sand boarding was sick
text: Experience with Alfonso was very professional yet personable and friendly. Was able to learn more Spanish and practice my Spanish with Alfonso as well. He was able to answer all of our questions and keep us informed about where we were traveling and the times we‚Äôd be leaving and arriving. The sandboarding experience itself was very cool and very scenic. As an experienced snowboarder it was a little easier for me but still a different feel that was challenging yet enjoyable. Would recommend Alfonso‚Äôs services and this experience to anyone!

title: A unique and unmatched experience.
text: The best experience of my trip to South America. I can't recommend it enough. Rafael and Eros behaved spectacularly and guaranteed us an experience we will never forget. Thank you so much guys for your sympathy, patience and just being so splendid.

title: It doesn't hurt to fall in the sand ü§™
text: An amazing experience, in a beautiful place, with one of the best sunsets I have ever seen! And we wouldn‚Äôt have enjoyed it so much without our guide Eros ü§üüèΩ

title: Sandboarding in Lima
text: The views were amazing! Eros was great with his English, driving, explaining the sandboarding. Our group had a wide range of experience levels with snowboarding and everyone had a blast. would definitely recommend this experience with anyone who wants to try sandboarding out.

title: Amazing
text: It was incredible, especially the kindness with which they teach you how to sandboard makes you have a great time, I would definitely return with them.

title: The best of huacachina
text: It is an experience that we should all live, the dunes are beautiful, and the activities are very challenging, highly recommended! Rafa is an incredible guide

title: I had to do it twice! Excellent experience
text: I did the Tour in Lima and I loved it so I decided to do this with my family, an incredible experience, excellent instructors and the best team.

title: Great introductory surfing lesson
text: My 16-year-old had a great introductory surfing lesson, thanks to Tubos Surf School. Everything was so easy. They arranged transport for us to/from the beach. They provided wetsuit and shoes for her. Her instructor, Nico, gave great instructions and helped her getting to the right place, giving the little pushes to the board at the right time. Even though the sea had some decent swells, everything felt very safe. She had a lot of fun. It was a great experience!

title: Recommended 100%
text: I travel to Peru every 2-3 months and I always looked for a serious company with which to get good bathrooms to keep moving.With Tubos it was a success. I did a class with Chicken and we have looked for the best spot suitable to my level on the green coast.Material in very good condition and variety of boards to choose from.Inside the water, Chicken always giving good advice and improving technique.I have now returned to Peru and booked a class with them again and will continue to do so if they continue to work this well.

title: Great instructors and experience
text: Great surf instructors for my 8 year old son. We took 8 sessions in the tandem category only because we were visiting from the USA but my son loved it and we enjoyed watching him.

title: Nice private lesson
text: It was a really nice lesson, a lot of personal attention from michael and great tips to improve my surfing adjusted to my skill level!

title: Best instructors and people, love their job and are amazing teachers. Loved this session
text: If I could give 6 stars I would. Showed up by myself with no previous surfing experience and no Spanish, got a good warmup and stretch in and got taught the basics outside and then straight into the water. Board and wetsuit were all provided and felt verywell looked after. Besides being the most amazing surf instructors they are also the greatest people, making sure I had a way home before leaving and when I as unable to get an uber from the beach, they drove me to their office and took a picture of the uber picking me up to make sure I was safe. Could not have asked for better people and better teachers! This was my favourite activity in Peru and something I‚Äôd definitely want to do again. Thank you ‚ù§Ô∏è

title: Super fun surf class
text: Tubos is the best surf school in Lima! they have wetsuits, surfboards.. the coaches are super and the vibes ü§ôüèºü§ôüèºü§ôüèº are amazing..

title: Awesome surf school
text: Tubos surf school is excellent, and I had a great experience in the water with them! The coach‚Äôs are very professional and the equipment they use is great. I would super recommend them to anyone wanting to learn how to surf or to have a great experience on vacation.

title: Ne pas manquer les √Æles ballestas
text: La visite des √Æles ballestas se fait uniquement en bateau , on ne peut pas en descendre mais c‚Äôest superbe , en plus, le bateau tourne pour que tout le monde puisse prendre des photos, on a vu beaucoup de loup de mer, pleins d‚Äôoiseaux, les pingouins, seulement dans l‚Äôeau ....Par contre, un peu d√©√ßu par la r√©serve Paracas, les paysages sont magnifiques mais c‚Äôest un peu au pas de course, le repas n‚Äôest pas compris mais on vous d√©pose dans un restaurant .. avec l‚Äôattente de la pr√©paration, nous avons mang√© notre plat √† toute vitesse . Un conseil , amener vous de quoi grignoter et profitez de cette pause pour vous promener et prendre des photos ( il y a pleins de p√©licans au port)

title: excellent service
text: Excellent service, very friendly and punctual, they handle Lima traffic very well and the communication via WhatsApp is fast and easy to understand.

title: Great Service
text: Amazing service, they pick you up right from the airport. Real professional service, I recommend to anyone coming to visit Lima.

title: Real Lima Experience
text: The trip was a lot of fun ! Juan showed us how to eat like a local and showed us different spots around the city. He gave us history about the food and the location we were in. Overall very fun and I recommend it if you are new to the city.

title: My great first time in Lima
text: Pamela is very knowledgeable and shares v readily. It was fun and eye opening  to walk through the local market with her. I love the whole experience.

title: Fun way to see a bit of Lima
text: Very fun afternoon visiting the markets and central historic Lima.  Enjoyed trying different foods.  Great tour for our teens.  Juan was friendly and informative.

title: Perfect üòÉ
text: Don't waste your hunger on breakfast! After visiting the fishmarket and an incredible viewpoint, we went to an amazonian retstaurant for a delicious snack. After this our guide manuel led us to a huge market, where he introduced us some tipical fruits and let us taste. Further we went to a whole in the wall to have a choice of 4 different dishes. All very delicious!Manuel is a great guide with lots of passion and knowledge about his country and it's food.

title: Superb activity of immersion in Peruvian culture, especially Lima.
text: Excellent immersion to know the Peruvian culture. Guide Manuel 10 points. I would definitely recommend it. I loved the experience.

title: Very enriching experience, full of culture.
text: First of all thank the excellent guide Manuel Gir√≥n for his human warmth, empathy, wisdom, patience and willingness. A very kind person. The walk to the markets I highly recommend, as contact with the locals seems paramount. The outstanding cuisine, rich and very abundant.Thank you, Rita from Uruguay.

title: Pick this tour!!
text: Thank you Klaudia for making my last day in Peru so perfect. I‚Äôve wanted to do a walking tour of the markets with food tastings and this was perfect. I learned so much and Klaudia helped me see many things I wouldn‚Äôt have in my own. I highly recommend this tour. ‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è‚≠êÔ∏è

title: Authentic Experience
text: Jean Paul our guide was very easy going, very knowledgeable in the areas we visited and really provided a typical day in a Peruvian person‚Äôs day and their customs. Excellent food and food overall experience.

title: Foodie Market Tour
text: Excellent tour of 3 markets with Lucas. We tried great local dishes and amazing Peruvian fruit. High recommend to anyone who loves food and wants to try exciting new things you can‚Äôt find anywhere else!

title: A great day in Lima!
text: My husband and I had a blast on the local markets tour with Marcos as our guide. He was so informative and willing to answer all of our questions. The experience was great and the food was amazing. „ÅÇ„Çä„Åå„Å®„ÅÜ Marcos!!

name: Barranco Walking Tour
review: After walking 2km to the meeting point the guide never showed up and we were left with walking around and exploring Barranco on our own. Oh well, at least this forced us out of Miraflores for the afternoon.

title: Must do if you love murals!
text: If you love murals this is a must do tour!Our tour guide Rubi speaks fluent English and has a great sense of humor! She provided insightful information and fun facts about the murals and sites we visited. She shared great food recommendations and encouraged us to discover the surrounding areas.

title: What your?
text: Tour cancelled 19 minutes prior to start time after we had Ubered from across Lima to meeting point. Don‚Äôt know how we can be expected to rate it beyond one star and ridiculous you are asking us to rate it at all. Very disappointing and a huge inconvenience and waste of our limited time during first time visit to Lima.

title: Not recommended
text: The guide Alfredo arrived 15 minutes late, listlessly reading down his program in hard-to-understand English. Too bad! The Free Tours in Colombia and Ecuador were all great.

title: 100% recommended
text: The Baroque tour was incredible, our guide Kevin was always very kind and explained everything to us perfectly, and he also answered all our questions. One of the things that made the tour more special was the icebreaker starting the tour. 100% recommended I hope you can share the group photo of today, May 25, 2024, greetings

title: Great tour
text: Outstanding walking tour. Great guide. He guided us around the neighborhood with lots of commentary on the area, culture, restaurant recommendations, etc. Great views of the Pacific from areas we'd never find on our own. Most highly recommended if you've already seen downtown Lima

title: The guide was a no show and the company did not respond.
text: The guide did not show up for the tour. Called & messaged the WhatsApp number and never got a reply.

title: Don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t bother booking with this company
text: I read some of the negative reviews and thought they may be the few not the many but the bad reviews are accurate.Don√¢‚Ç¨‚Ñ¢t bother with this company - a complete no show and no communication,

title: Excellent Tour - Beautiful Artwork
text: This was a wonderful tour and Alejandro was charismatic and knowledgeable. Would definitely recommend. We had a great time. A lot of opportunities to take photos of gorgeous street art and learn about Barranco.

title: The guide didn√©t show up. Take a different agency
text: Although we booked the walking tour a day ahead and our booking was confirmed by the agency Email, the guide did not show up and no one bothered to update if the tour was cancelled. We called the number provided in the booking confirmation but no answer. Two other people who we√†re waiting with us tried as well. No response‚Ä¶  This has cost us a full morning out of the two days we had in Lima. This is a shame and not acceptable. If you value your time go elsewhere!

title: Delicious ceviche and great cooking workshop!!
text: Wonderful cooking class at the Mirasol restaurant in Chorrillos, Lima. We had some problems with the reservation and they finally confirmed us directly by calling the restaurant. Andr√©s was a wonderful teacher and cook. To repeat!

title: Tasty and interesting!
text: We booked the cooking class with Andres since the place where it takes place was a few minutes drive from our hotel in Barranco. The cooking class was held at Andres's restaurant, which is very close to the beach and is also very beautiful inside and out. Andres is a self-taught cook who has invented many recipes and other recipes acquired from his parents. What we learned to cook was Lomo Saltado, Ceviche and we also made the most famous drink in Peru (Pisco sour).the class lasted about 3 hours and we had a great time.

gpt: You sent a message, but I'm designed to assist with different types of tasks. Let me know if there's something specific you'd like help with!

title: Best cooking class ever!
text: Andres was a great chef with a lot of energy and skills in the kitchen. We cooked Lomo saltado, ceviche and of course made 2 pisco sour, one classic and one with coca leaves. The cooking class took place in Andres‚Äô restaurant (Restaurante Mirasol) and as that restaurant only works until 17:00 hrs we has the whole beautiful restaurant for us. Would recommend!

title: Comfortable bus ride
text: This bus runs from 7 am to 10 pm daily making stops at the marriot  and the  miraflores tourist center fare is inexpensive and ride is very comfortable.

title: Excellent service
text: It's an A1 service, with comfortable seats, friendly staff, air conditioning, free Wi-Fi, and always on time. I will definitely continue traveling with Airport Express because I feel protected arriving at my destination with them. Special kudos to guide Cesar Hernandez for his attentiveness.

title: Good return to the airport
text: Good service from Z√© Carlo! Very quiet our trip. The bus was clean and we returned to the airport without problems

title: Great service!
text: This service was great! Very comfortable bus, more value for money compared to taxi and really helpful staff, especially Juan Barzola was a great help.

title: Exemplary care and service
text: I had an excellent experience with the Airport Express shuttle. The seats were comfortable and the ride fast and safe. I felt calm throughout the trip, especially because of the strict security measures they implemented.I highlight the attention of Juan Barzola, who was very professional and friendly, providing personalized attention and helping me with the wifi on board. His treatment made the trip much more pleasant.I definitely recommend Airport Express for its comfort, security and excellent customer service, especially thanks to Juan.

title: Lovely
text: Very nice place, well wooded, great restaurants to eat. Punctual service and service from Juan Barzolio was very attentive.

title: Educated
text: Excellent service from Juan Barzola.Very attentive. I recommend.I will use again when I am in Lima..

title: The best experience
text: Very comfortable the services of Airportexpress, at first I was a little confused how to take it, but the guide Juan Barzola arrived to help me, really was very friendly and attentive, the bus very clean and above all very safe, I will recommend this service to my friends, I really recommend it

title: Very good
text: Very good service, very clean buses:)). The workers were very friendly especially Juan Barzola :))). All superrr

title: Easy to find and great customer service
text: Brayan gave me the BEST welcome to Peru - thank you! Can't wait for Wicked Part 2 <3Was super easy to find and use the bus, quick and cheap way to get to Miraflores

title: Fast, efficient and economical transportation
text: At New Lima Airport, the sale kiosk is outside the airport, behind a column, close to the taxi stop and exit to the parking lot, so stay alert. The bus was already waiting, it didn't take long to leave. He reached his destination in 40 minutes, the fourth stop. The traffic in Lima is intense. From the airport, the stops are as follows: 1st Hotel Marriott (Larcomar), 2nd Tourist Information Center Larco, 3rd Park Kennedy, 4th Hotel Boulevard. From there he returns to the airport. Stayed at 20 Soles in September/2025. Payment by credit card, accept cash in kind as well. I did not take the bus back due to the schedules, but you can wait for the bus at the same points of the way, paying for the driver or auxiliary. At the stops there was always an Enterprise Cover to assist with the information.

title: Great.
text: Brayan served us very well and we quickly took a ticket with him. It was comfortable and effective. Upon return, we will return to Airport Express Lima.

title: Good service
text: Great ride to city center Miraflores. About same time as an Uber. Free WiFi on bus. Brayan was exceptional. He‚Äôs kind and gave excellent recommendations for food and things to do in Lima

title: A great Service
text: I was very well served by Brayan, spoke even in Portuguese, the Service takes you wherever you choose and the bus still has Wi-Fi, is worth a lot.

title: we were spending two weeks in peru and brayan assisted really well with all our questions and concerns
text: Brayan was very helpful and knowledgeable of everything we needed. excellent service. he gave us a great start our time in peru. üôÇ thank you. c/s - trinidad & tobago üáπüáπ

title: Helpful team, comfy seats
text: Our first impression was excellent, Brayan at the ticket booth spoke English clearly and was very polite. He helped us choose the best of four stops to get off, and the whole transaction was smooth, and with a smile. The driver had us load our own bags under the beis, and choose our seats. Once it was full, they turned on the Aircon and headed off. It was a pleasant drive, careful driver, and the bus speed is on display in the front of the bus.. Free WiFi on board is good! That‚Äôs how I can share this review!

title: Very friendly help desk staff.
text: Katherine at the help desk was very friendly and helped us book our tickets. Not really clear when you could go on the bus or what was happening but all worked out fine. Just jump on when your name is called.

title: Bon plan pour aller rapido √† Miraflo
text: Great service with Bravan from airport to Miraflores. Best way to go to mirafloooooooooooooooooooooo !Recommanded by RR

title: Excellent!
text: Very good Service, good price, good routes, and especially very good attention from all the staff! Excellent, recommend it!

title: Well organized Lima city tour
text: Our ship changed the shuttle drop off location in the city but Haku tour was able to meet us at the new location. Our tour was in a comfortable mini van with a great tour guide. JJ was knowledgeable about his city and our driver was able to get us quickly through the crazy traffic in the city.We had dinner at a very nice Peruvian restaurant (very generous portions) then went to the Magic Water show. Our driver dropped us off right at the entrance and JJ got us into the park quickly, bypassing the long queue.Having a great guide and tour is a must for first time visitor to Lima. Unless you really know the area well, don't wander around on your own.We are very happy with this tour.

title: Fantastic tour and tour guide and Driver. Our tour guide Edwin was among the best tour guides ever!
text: Tour, tour guide and Driver all excellent. Edwin is one of the best tour guides I‚Äôve ever had anywhere. Highly recommend

title: A great tour and amazing experience
text: Haku Tours were amazing from the get-go. They acknowledged all correspondences and replied promptly and concisely. Our tour guide Natalie and our driver Ricardo were professional, friendly, polite, in fact they were faultless! We would use Haku Tours again and would recommend them!!

title: Stop looking and start booking!!
text: Excellent tour with Haku - stop looking and book!! We had a rough start just getting off our cruise ship and thru the port - I let Haku know of the delay, and they responded and waited for all of us with no issue. We then had the amazing Cesar as our guide and we couldn‚Äôt have been happier! He was friendly, knowledgeable, funny and helpful - and really set a great tone for the tour. Loved the sights (and those churros were delish!!), the catacombs, and dinner was yummy as well (Pisco sour and lomo saltado - yum!). After the hassle at the port we decided very last minute to spend the night in Miraflores (lovely area), and Cesar afjusted and helped to make sure we got an Uben easily from our last stop. One of the highlights of our trip - thank you Cesar and Haku!

title: From Callao Port: Lima City Tour, Dinner and Magic Water Tour
text: The tour and dinner were wonderful! Cesar was a knowledgable and friendly guide! We really liked the catacombs!

title: All expectations were exceeded on both tours.
text: The visit was spectacular, more than anything because of the guides C√©sar, Stefano and Aurea, whose performance exceeded all expectations, both on this tour and on the Lima's Highlights tour led by C√©sar who not only made this tour an excellent experience but also made us He made us try different types of fruits unknown to us.

title: Could not be faulted - a great experience
text: An exceptional tour with this company. Their responses to emails and messages was prompt and helpful. As the tour got closer they even followed up with a phone call.Our tour guide  Mabel was delightful. She was passionate about her country and we learnt a lot. At all times she was attentive to the group and we loved being her ‚ÄòChico‚Äôs‚ÄôLima is a beautiful city and we certainly saw the best of it. The tour culminated with the fountains presentation which was superb.

title: Good choice that you can't miss it!
text: We bought Lima city tour and dinner, sounds like boring but it was not! Our tour guide Leonardo, young , friendly and professional, gave us lots of historical information. The highlights of the tour was walk through St. Francis church , beautiful inside and outside church . A little creepy underground.

title: Easy and safe bike hire
text: Great bike hire place - very reasonable prices, helpful staff who dealt with us promptly. No problems. Paid on return - helmets and bike locks provided (included in price). Bikes were in great condition and easy to ride. We saw a couple with a young child take a bike out suggesting they have a few baby seats for the bikes.I recommend riding on a Sunday morning when the road outside the bike hire place is closed to traffic which allows a safe and peaceful start to the journey.There is a designated cycle route from outside the cycle shop all the way to the coast at Miraflores, which was perfect for us as we were slightly concerned about cycling through the Lima traffic! It is painted red on the ground and you can follow this safely all the way, just abide by the traffic lights.At the coast the designated cycle path continues north and south - we cycled south to Barranco which was charming and we locked the bikes up whilst we explored a little and got a cold drink before returning back up the coast. We stopped occasionally to take in some of the sights along the way including an area filled with butterflies.Perfect cheap activity to do in Lima which helps you explore more of the area.

title: Bicycle rental in Lima
text: The bikes are very comfortable and in perfect condition. The guys who attended us are super attentive to every detail.

title: Lima the fun way
text: Very friendly and helpful staff with excellent English. Their route Map is fantastic. We did 2 different trips. All the way south to the far shore around the point and another to north to plaza de armas and Chinatown.The bike routes are well marked and fairly safe. Crossing round abouts and some intersections are a little sketchy. Most cars seem to respect bicycles. The bikes are well geared and have fat tires for smooth riding. Great way to experience a big city.

title: Fantastic cycles for hire!
text: Great bikes for cycling around very flat city, easy access to Isidro, Barranco and Miraflores. Lovely, helpful staff, we hired 4 bikes for 4 hours and went off independently, would definitely recommend!

title: Great Market Visit and Cooking Class!
text: My friend and I loved this cooking class.  C√©sar, our guide, took us to the Sequillo Market for an amazing, authentic market visit.  We then went back to the spotless cooking school and enjoyed cooking with C√©sar and chef, Marco.  It was an excellent blend of cooking, learning how to make ceviche, causa (potatoes) and Lomo Saltado, and sampling many fruits and potatoes of Peru.  We even got to watch our chefs make delicious pisco sours.  The food was plentiful and delicious.  What made it so special was the enthusiasm of C√©sar and his staff.  He even taught my friend to salsa!  Highly recommended!

title: Best cooking class
text: Awesome experience with Chef Paulo and Chef Karina! Made our favorite lomo saltado! We enjoyed the cooking class especially my 8 y/o daughter. Highly recommended!

title: 5/5 experience
text: Josep and Cesar were great hosts who made the cooking class very fun! The food was amazing and very well ran! Would definitely recommend

title: Fun cooking class
text: Great time learning to make my favorite Peruvian dish. Cesar and Josep made the class fun & interesting as well. Highly recommend.

title: A lot of fun!
text: Very fun way to have dinner, we learned how to cook and our chefs taught us a little Peruvian culture as well. Josep and Cesar were great!

title: Cooking class in Lima
text: Everyone was great, would definitely do it again! Thanks Cesar, Joseph, and Piola yall made for a great day. If you need something fun to do in Lima check them out.

title: If you want to cook your own amazing food, do this tour!
text: Amazing experience with amazing food, Cesar and Marcos were very helpful and extremely knowledgeable, I would 100% recommend this tour to everybody

title: Peruvian cooking class
text: I loved the class, Cesar and chef Marcos made the class so much fun and easy to understand. The food was delicious, learning how to make causa and lomo saltado was so much fun.

title: Amazing!
text: So much fun! The guide Cesar and the chef Marcos teach you so much about food and cooking. The food is delicious. Would definitely recommend!

title: Peruvian food experience
text: I had the most wonderful experience learning about Peruvian food. Marcos and Cesar were amazing!! They were very patient and super nice people. It was so much fun!!

title: Wonderful tour!
text: Wonderful and highly educational trip with Lucas. He picked us up right on time and we drove to the museum in a spotlessly clean large van. Gave us a more than 2 hour tour through the museum, explaining everything in detail and answering all of our questions about the museum and Peru in general. Highly recommend!

title: Visita Museo Larco, Lima.
text: The Larco Museum, spectacular, my guide Miguel Angel Medina was the best part of the tour, very skilled and knowledgeable of its culture, as well as pleasant, polite and friendly. Miguel is the best. Thank you a thousand.

title: Excellent trip
text: Excellent tour - Martin‚Äôs knowledge was amazing and it was good to hear about the long term history of Peru. The pick up/drop off service was very good too.

title: Amazing and rich experience
text: Martin (guide) and Jimmy (driver) really great people. Martin very much prepared and interesting to listen. Thank you!

title: Just hit the heart already.
text: I had William as my guide. He was really passionate about the history of Peru. Don't even think about going on your own. William pointed out all the little hidden details in the artifacts that I would have never seen on my own. He also tied everything together into how ancient Peruvians saw the world. The length of the tour was just right and William had my attention the entire time. One of the best tours I've ever done.

title: Amazing museum experience
text: This museum is incredible and a real eye opening experience on the long history of Peru. The guided visit was exceptional and Alexandra shared so many additional interesting stories and facts. Highly recommended!

title: Larco museum tour
text: Awesome place best to take a guide doesn't cost that much.My guide was Gregory and his knowledge of the history and culture was exceptional.Definitely a must visit place !

title: Wonderful tour
text: I loved the walk. The fountains are beautiful and they tell the history of Peru. Barranco is also very pretty.The Leydi guide was very attentive and explained everything to us.

title: Magic Fountains & Barranco
text: Our tour guide Jonathan was very informative regarding the history of the Water show and about the District of Barranco. The water show was beautiful and a definite site to visit. Hotel pick-up and drop off was provided. We enjoyed walking the district of the vibrant town of Barranco.

title: Magic waters! Maravilhosas
text: It is a spectacle the image show reflected in the waters! When we went he told the story of Li.a from the discovery to the present day. Quite colorful and playful! It had a considerable audience! There are a total of 4 large water springs, and one with a row of water jets where the presentation takes place. Worth a visit! I recommend.

title: Viag beberibe
text: Wonderful hotel, very attentive staff, lots of comfort. We recorded all these wonderful moments with the paparazzi who made beautiful drops, with the photographer Gustavo who was wonderful, without words to describe how much we love him and the seller Naely who tb is very attentive.

title: Water park evening tour.
text: Johnathan was very knowledgeable and a fun guide.Highly recommend. The fountains was an amazing show, the local snack was very tasty too. All in all a great way to spend a few hours,

title: Fun tour and enjoyable evening
text: The Magic Fountain Park in Lima came highly recommended, and we thought a tour with a stop to Barranco sounded interesting. Our tour guide Leydi was informative, fun, and provided lots of local insights. It was also nice (read: easier) to have a small group tour with transportation provided. Glad we found Lima Highlights Tours. They were organized and great in their detailed communications. We really enjoyed visiting different parts of the Barranco neighborhood, which turned out to be our favorite area of Lima. Afterwards we went to see the Magic Fountain show which was colorful and pretty amazing. Glad we were with Leydi, who knew how to navigate the crowds to get the best view. Highly recommend this tour for a fun, enjoyable evening.

title: Nice tour
text: Nice tour, but it would be advisable to extend the time, as one runs to reach to do everything in the times they have stipulated.

title: Lighthearted fun in Lima
text: Fun, not too pricey, place to visit in Lima. Fun for couples but would also be great with children. Pretty waterfalls, some fun local snacks, etc. Nice place for some pictures as well.

title: Fountain show
text: Alvaro was a great tour guide for the fountain show. We got to travel around Barranco first and see a local artist exhibit. Alvaro gave us history of the area and origins of the story of the local art on the building. The fountain exhibit was very good with music and fountains moving to the beat.Alvaro did a great job!!!

title: Fun night in Lima
text: We had so much fun on this tour!Our tour guide Alexandra (Alex) was friendly, knowledgeable, & patient with me, & my two adult daughters. It was just the three of us taking this tour, however Alex made sure to answer our many questions, while being our personal photographer along the way. We really enjoyed the vibe of Barranco, & the Magic Fountain Park was fun.. Overall an awesome night with a great tour guide (Thanks Alex!).. I highly recommend this tour if you're planning to visit Lima. Hopefully you'll get Alex as your guide.

title: Felt scammed
text: My class was at 9:30 and I showed up at 9:29. The door was locked and nobody was in the lobby. I tried calling them and sent them a couple messages on WhatsApp, via their websites instructions. I have not heard anything back as well as did not receive a refund or was able to go to another class. Very upsetting as I was excited for the yoga class but was not able to participate but still had to pay.

title: Nice treat in Lima
text: I had a great experience at MATMAX yoga in Lima, small and cosy place to enjoy a nice Practice :)I really appreciated Moises class, he is special!Also the other teachers were nice.I will be back when in Lima!

title: Great way to start the day
text: Great class with Moises today; he was on top of our alignment and did a great job of guiding us through a slow but strong progression. Highly recommend.

title: Good yoga class
text: Challenging but excellent yoga class. Free 1 hour session with Selina hostel and was a great studio with high quality equipment

title: Great experience
text: Really enjoyed my Ashtanga yoga class!! The whole vibe and experience was great!!! Upon walking in they were super welcoming. A bottle of water was included with the package too! They also had free lockers for us to put our things. What was even cooler was that the lockers had phone chargers built inside of them! By the time I was done with yoga my phone was completely charged! They also provided yoga mats and blocks. Would definitely recommend this class to anyone who has done yoga for years or is a beginner.

title: The perfect, mindful way to start each day when staying in Miraflores
text: In November, I was on a spiritual retreat to Peru with a few close friends. While we were staying in Miraflores, Lima, I was on the lookout for an early morning yoga class so that I could begin the day mindfully. The classes I took at Matmax Yoga were above and beyond what I was hoping for. The class was the perfect mix of strength building, while allowing for the breath work that comes with a Vinyasa flow. I felt rejuvenated after each class. The people who work here are genuine and I enjoyed authentic conversation with them, even though my Spanish is not as great as I would like it to be. I highly recommend everyone staying in the area takes a class at Matmax yoga!

title: Awesome
text: Excellent experience, great studio w terrific instructors. When staying at the Selina hotel, yogis get a discounted rate

title: Amazing yoga class!!
text: I took a class this morning as I stayed at Selina (very nice place to stay by the way), with Andreas, and it was perfect! Nice adjustments, nice dynamic, nice studio! I recommend!

title: Great start of the day
text: Since I have stayed in nearby Selina, i did a morning yoga class with Andy. I really enjoyed it and found the space & the yoga flow very energizing. If I am back at Lima, Miraflores- would definitely come back again.

title: Great yoga class!
text: We did the morning yoga class with andres. It was peaceful, relaxing combined with hard work. Great environment and music. Very recommended!!

title: An experience for life
text: An unforgettable and exciting adventure. Carlos was a very personable, funny, and knowledgeable guide. His connections with the locals made the whole experience very enjoyable. We highly recommend this tour/hike to everyone!

title: Knowledgeable guide anchored in local community
text: Marcahuasi is not far away from Lima town‚Ä¶ but still it is a completely different world. my very knowledgeable guide well known to the local community made it a special experience

title: Get away from the hustle and bustle of the city!
text: Marcahuasi was beautiful! It was nice to get away and hike in peace and quiet. Marco, our guide, was knowledgeable and always made sure we were doing ok in the altitude. Bring a sandwich or an empanada or something of the like, and you'll be fine without a dedicated lunch time. The ride to and from are long and bumpy, but totally worth it!

title: An Experience
text: Wow where to begin, a great day out in the Andes with Carlos and Cusi. A spectacular drive up through many switchbacks to reach San Pedro De Casta and then the breathtaking Marcahuasi stone forest is something everyone should do at least once in their lifetime. So peaceful it truly is a wonder. So sit back and enjoy the ride. And a tip of my hat to Carlos who is not only great company but an expert driver also. Thank you Carlos and Cusi.

title: Great adventure to a hidden treasure near Lima
text: First, let me start by saying that if you want an off-the-beaten-track experience near Lima,  this is it. While many tourists to Peru will clamor to be one of 100's going up the Inca Trail, to Machu Picchu, and Rainbow Mountain, on the day I went (a weekday) I was the only tourist at the site (as evidenced by our being the only vehicle parked in front).  Marcahuasi is a mountain park owned by the community living in San Pedro de Casta. The site has a ~3 km round-trip trail at ~4000 m. It is home to rock formations that have eroded into stone forests (pillars) that you can see from far away. Up close the rock formations have the shapes of faces or animals....if you have some imagination. The hike is not difficult but has to be done slowly because of the altitude. The trail highlights are amazing rock formations, a lagoon, a viewpoint overlooking the valley, and a plateau with pre-Inca ruins, all essentially untouched by commercialism. The trail is well-maintained, and there are native plants. On weekends about 50 people, mostly Peruvians may visit and even camp there.This excursion is much more than just getting  a ride to take a hike at high altitude in the Andes. The guide, Carlos, makes the trip into an adventure to learn more about Peru and its people, and to meet the villagers of San Pedro de Casta (who own and manage the mountain and work the land (cattle and agriculture) around it communally(!). The whole day is memorable including where we stopped for breakfast (mom and pop eatery) and lunch, what we saw in the high traffic zones of Lima, the smaller towns along the route, and the people and animals on the dirt road leading through the Rimac Valley on the way up to San Pedro de Casta and Marcahuasi. We spent about 2.5 hours on the hike around Marcahuasi with plenty of time to walk slowly to acclimate to the altitude and time to just ponder the majesty of the rock formations. Whether you believe in some great mystery of the forms or the power of erosion, the rock formations are massive and make you feel privileged to be in their presence. The viewpoint which Carlos called the "Lion King Rock" is a memorable place to sit and ponder how you are so lucky to be alive and present in that space in that moment. Most impressive was the personal relationships Carlos has built over the years with the local residents, shop-keepers, and eateries along the way. Carlos will pick you up in a 4X4 truck which is needed for the dirt roads. On the day I went, 9, yes 9 local people hitched a ride in the back seat and enclosed back of the truck from the town in San Pedro de Casta up the steep incline to Marcahuasi to plant pine trees and water the plants. Their smiles and thank you's show that he is part of their community as well as unexpected gifts from the villagers.  Carlos clearly loves his job and wants to make everyone's time with him special. I mentioned that I wanted to try a Chirimoya and Carlos bought one for us to share at the top of the mountain.  I mentioned I was interested in birds and Carlos was careful to point out a peregrine falcon, birds around the lagoon, and vultures and a condor sailing in the distance above the park.I highly recommend this private trip for anyone looking for a day-long adventure to see real (non-touristy) rural Peru and have a mountain hike at high altitude at your own pace.

title: Explore amazing archeological site with no crowds in your pictures!!!
text: The four hour drive was 1000% worth it to get to see and explore Marcahuasi with zero other tourists around. It is absolutely breathtaking and stunning. Our guide was wonderful. Our original guide was Carlos but he had recently had brain surgery for an aneurysm so our substitute guide Marci took us and he was awesome! He did an absolute amazing job of framing our photos that he took of us. Like I‚Äôm so shocked at how good they turned out! The drive up and down the mountain was a little rough, I‚Äôm not going to lie.  But setting the chupas and the ruins of this ancient town, how small the houses and doors were with no one but my family around was just amazing. I definitely recommend going on this excursion if you have the chance.

title: Amazing!
text: I had to catch a flight at 3:55pm the day i took this tour and in order to take the tour and make my flight we had to leave earlier than normal which was not a problem for our tour guide Carlos! He was amazing! He was personable, knowledgeable, patient, and funny! After we got back into Lima we actually got lunch together which was nice. If you take this your choose Carlos you won‚Äôt regret it! Also, he was very gentle taking the mountain which is important cause i was scared for my life.

title: One of most memorable tours
text: One of the best tour I have ever had ! Worth every penny. Valeria was amazing. The driver Calos is also excellent! Saw little cute Penguins, wild sea lines. Fast and furious buggies ride‚Ä¶ sand board.. it‚Äôs ain‚Äôt tour because Lima is 3-4 hour away from those activities.. I highly recommend!

title: EXPRESS TRAVEL.
text: Amazing service, Very Pro, from picking you up at your hotel, to the last detail you can imagine, they are always on the lookout for you and explain in detail any doubts you have about the destination, culture, gastronomy, history and everything relevant.

title: Paracas, Winery, and Huscachina
text: The day was what I dreamed of and more. So much fun and so beautiful. Honestly it was so comfortable having the stress of finding our way lifted off our shoulders and having everything planned in advance. And I made a great friend out of our tour guide.

title: Private Fullday Paracas-Ica
text: Our private tour with Diana and Carlos was absolutely fantastic! Diana's knowledge of the history and current events in Paracas, Ica, and Huacachina was impressive. She shared so much fascinating information throughout the tour, making our experience incredibly enriching. Diana was also incredibly patient and accommodating with our schedule at each stop, ensuring we had enough time to explore and enjoy each location to the fullest. Carlos, our driver, was outstanding! His skills behind the wheel were top-notch, and we always felt safe on the road. His efficiency meant we got back to our hotel before 7 pm, which was perfect for us. If you prefer having control over your itinerary, booking a private tour is a must. Request Diana and Carlos. Gracias, Carlos y Diana, for an unforgettable day!

title: Fantastic
text: It was a fantastic experience, thanks to Carlos and Valeria they made this trip unforgettable, in general the agency was always attentive to us at punctual times, completely safe, I recommend them 1000%.

title: Would not book tour through Master Tours again
text: Pickup Vehicle too small too accommodate confirmed prepaid party of 7 adults so no tour on scheduled day.  Manager wanted additional payment to supply adequate transportation on another day

title: Unforgetable experience
text: Very good service, excellent driver and guide. The activities are VERY GOOD and UNFORGETTABLE, but the private tour is a little expensive compared to other agencies. We did it with this agency since we had contracted the transfer from the airport to the hotel through Booking with them and it seemed like a very serious company. Ivan, our company contact, was always attentive at all times. Highly recommended company, just take into account the cost of the tours.

title: Worth every penny
text: Very comfortable car. The competent and professional driver Saul. The guide Susan informed us about everything and left us free to ask any interesting facts about the tour and about various topics about Peruvian places and culture. I chose the private tour due to the difficulty of getting around, it was perfect. I did what I could do and we saw everything. I recommend.

title: Excellent experience
text: The staff were super friendly, attentive and explanatory, with a lot of knowledge about Peru in general, as well as super attentive to ensuring clean hygienic services for their clients. We made several stops to buy food. View of sea lions and humble penguins and we were also able to be very close to a sea lion that approached the coast.

title: Excellent view to the center of Lima. It was worth it. Full tour with a lot of cultural learning of the local culture.
text: It was an excellent tourist tour. Our guide demonstrated a lot of knowledge and above all was very kind and polite.

title: Exceptional Guide & Informative Tour
text: Excellent +3 hr tour of downtown historic area and St Francis Monastery & Catacombs. Martin, our guide, was exceptionally informative, engaging, considerate and easy to understand. His deep and detailed knowledge of the history, construction, art, religious practices, and cultural aspects of the monastery and historic area made it a very rich and rewarding experience. Great driver and comfortable vehicle as well. Highly recommend.

title: Tour in a small circle
text: The tour to the historic center of Lima was very interesting. Our tour guide Martin had the difficulty of leading the tour for two in Spanish and for two in English with four people in the group. He has designed this very confidently. I liked it very much

title: Martin was an excellent guide full of knowledge and inside. He made this a wonderful experience.
text: Martin was a wonderful resource of knowledge. He shared insights and stories about the places. He made sure we were haven‚Äôt a good time and enjoyed the tour. When we had questions he was there to answer them. It gave me a new perspective of South American culture.

title: Awesome Historic Lima tour!!
text: We took a tour of historic Lima that included the Saint Francis Monastery and the catacombs. The tour also included transportation from and to the hotel in Miraflores.Our tour guide was Martin. He was awesome!! Very knowledgeable and friendly. We started the tour in Plaza San Martin, to then walk down Union alleyway that took us to Plaza de Armas, and finally the catacombs.It was by far the highlight of our time in Lima. Highly recommended to anyone visiting this beautiful city.

title: Excellent Alvaro Guide, Very Pro, Good Information and Always willing to clarify doubts. It also provides timelyTotalme
text: Excellent Guide, very good and varied information. Pro and pleasant. Always ready to clarify doubts or give timely suggestions. Fully recommended.

title: A worth while endeavor.
text: Our tour guide Alvaro was the best! The tour was very informative. So glad we took the time to do this. I would recommend this to anyone who would like to know a little more about the city.

title: A Wonderful Morning in Lima with Great Guide
text: Lots of information but not too much and Jonathan is able to share all his knowledge with what you know or are interested in. Very special and Jonathan himself is a beautiful storyteller and is visibly proud and that makes everything even more special! Loved every minute of it!

title: Discover the city center of lime and catacombs main monuments. Religious shrines and main squares..
text: Excellent Experience and Excellent Tour Guide. Super comfortable transport. On time and very friendly. 100% Recommended

title: Exceptional Tour of Lima with Martin!
text: I recently had the pleasure of exploring Lima with Martin as my guide, and I can't recommend him enough! Martin's extensive knowledge of the city's history and culture, combined with his passion for sharing it, made the tour truly exceptional. He was not only incredibly informative but also friendly and professional, making the experience enjoyable and memorable. If you're looking for an outstanding guide in Lima, Martin is definitely the one to choose!

title: Starting my vacation on the right foot!
text: I honestly could not ask for better service! Even with the chaotic arrival area finding my driver was a breeze.. Travel time was excellent, vehicle was clean and service was exceptional! I am a travel agent and I will be using this service for any clients coming to Lima!!!

title: Great service!
text: Great service. Everything went smoothly. The drivers were polite, the cars comfortable. The trip from Lima‚Äôs Airport can be long but it was an easy ride.

title: Great experience!
text: Great communication and professional, on time service. Highly recommended! It was easy to find the driver and communicate with him. Great experience!

title: Reliable service
text: It's really reliable service. Claudia told me all the process to meet with a driver via whatsapp. She is very responsible. I didn't have any problems during my trip, but if I had something, she would sort it out immediately.

title: Reliable transfer from airport hotel
text: We had booked the transfer from the airport to the hotel. Everything went smoothly and on time. The driver was very friendly.The communication beforehand with the agency (including Diego) was also very good (fast, competent, honest). It's a shame that we were only in Lima for a short time, otherwise we would definitely have done more with the agency :-)

title: Smooth pickup/dropoff
text: The pickup/dropoff was very smooth. The communication was very easy. They were very punctual and very professional. We highly recommend this service.

title: Superb, Safe and Timely!
text: 10 out of 10! The communication was amazing, from booking the reservation to the pickup. Claudia was a life saver by providing the drivers information and a picture/map of the pickup location. Will definitely use them again!

title: Great service
text: The communication was excellent and the service was provided exactly as it was explained. I will use again next time I‚Äôm in Peru.

title: Peace of mind
text: Great experience üòä definitely glad we booked with them. They were waiting for us at the airport with a sign and was early picking us up to return to the airport. Peace of mind was provided and we are thankful.

title: 100% Recommend
text: Professional, great communication. The airport was really busy when we arrived and I had a little trouble locating the driver in the dark. I made contact via WhatsApp and the response was immediate!

title: Understanding Peru‚Äôs wine history and surrounding South America wine‚Äôs production
text: Every where we go we try to do a food and wine tour. Peru does not have well known wineries but this tours gives you an understanding what stage they are in comparison to other countries in the region. Paola was very knowledgeable about the history. It was a nice way to end our stay in Peru. They were willing to adapt to our shortened schedule which we greatly appreciated.The only suggestion more Peru wine options.

title: Great wine tour that's not just a tasting
text: If you're a serious wine-buff, then this is perhaps not the tour for you. For those of us that want to find out a bit more about the local area, accompanied by a few local, Peruvian and South American wine samples, the tour was great. The tour starts in Haku's office, with an explanation of the heritage of Peruvian and wider South American winemaking, plus tasting of a couple of wines. As we were the only two people on the tour, it initially felt a bit intense, but Edwin our guide put us at ease and we relaxed as the tour proceeded. We were driven between locations by 'John Paul' - a great driver - in a nearly-new and spotless SUV. As well as enjoying an orange wine in Plaza Mayor in Santiago de Surco, we visited a local bodega (where they were also preparing various flavoured piscos for a festival the following week) and finished in a caf√©-bar in the Baranco area, all tasting wines as we went. My only recommendation would be to try to join this tour on a day that they have other customers and make it into more of a group experience.

title: Do not expect a serious wine tasting ‚Ä¶
text: The guide Junior was kind and we had a nice tour in Miraflores and surroundings. But do not expect any kind of normal wine tasting - especially of wines from Peru. We tasted a few wines from Chile, Argentina Uruguay and (one) wine from Peru. The places of the tastings were surreal. An office, an abandoned winery and a public Plaza. No wine was spectacular. From a person who is interested in wines this was 4 hours wasted ‚Ä¶

title: The Haku Wine Tour is little known but fantastic!
text: Haku made an absolutely incredible effort trying to make a wine tour happen for a solo traveler. I am so grateful for your commitment to service - it was a gift to have a wine tour with you!Amadeo was my tour guide. He is knowledgeable, articulate, and joyful in delivering the history of wine (and Pisco) production and consumption in Peru. I learned so much and I also enjoyed a few cups of tasty wine!After the Haku Wine Tour I would recommend visiting Casa Colina restaurant - they are the only restaurant in Lima with an exclusively Peruvian wine bar. The bartender and staff are very knowledgeable about Peruvian wine and fully capable of directing clients to a bottle with a profile suited to their preference. Table wine as well as high-end Peruvian wines are available.

title: Lovely wine tasting
text: My friend and I had a wonderful time on this wine tour. I wasn‚Äôt aware that Peru had a wine scene and while it‚Äôs small, it‚Äôs endearing. Especially seeing the oldest vineyard. Such a delight. Our guides were knowledgeable and engaging. It was also helpful that a van took us around. We also ended up buying some of the wines as they were good!

title: A wonderful experience!
text: We wanted to explore the artsy and bohemian Barranco district and also taste the delicious Peruvian food that we‚Äôve heard so much about.  This tour was a perfect match for our needs.  We were picked up at our hotel by Daniel and driven to our first stop, Cevicheria Terminal Pesquero where we enjoyed a squid ceviche with corn fritters (tortitas de choclo)..absolutely delicious!  Next, we walked to Sof√° Caf√© where we had creamy tacu tacu (peruvian rice and bean cake) topped with saut√©ed shrimp.  From there we walked through beautiful streets, to a local art museum featuring the works of graffiti artist Jade Rivera. The docent was a lovely young woman whose name I forget.   We loved her commentary, and her delightful manner.  After that, we went to D√©dalo Art Gallery and Caf√©, an art collective where you could browse works for sale and also enjoy the next item on our food journey ‚Äì pastel de choclo (sweet corn pie).  Our next stop was the Bridge of Sighs, where we held our breath as we crossed it and made a wish. Hope it comes true!  At the other end was Tio Mario where we had anticucuhos (grilled beef hearts!) with various sauces.  By this time, we were stuffed, but somehow found room in our tummies for dessert-freshly made picarones (Peruvian doughnuts) with syrup.  These were delicious! We were picked up by our driver and escorted back to the hotel by Daniel.  Along the way, we had wonderful conversation with Daniel, who was very knowledgeable and considerate.  This tour was a win!

title: Super relaxed and fun with great local food!
text: We booked this tour one day in advance and were happy Daniel had time to accommodate us. We were the only two on the tour, which was in the Barranco neighborhood. To be transparent about what the tour consisted of, it didn‚Äôt include street graffiti or 20 tastings. That being said, we thoroughly enjoyed our tour with Daniel. He took us to 5 restaurants where we could sit down at tables and enjoy great local food. After the second restaurant, we went through the Jade Rivera museum where we were given an overview of the artist‚Äôs work by a museum employee. The third restaurant was in an art collective where we had time to browse local artisans‚Äô work for sale. A small section of the collective sold alcohol and with Daniel‚Äôs assistance, we were able to taste and buy two bottles of Pisco to bring home! The last restaurant was at a lovely dessert restaurant owned by a local pastry chef. All the food we tasted was EXCELLENT and we thoroughly enjoyed it all because in all our time in Lima and Cusco, we had only had one of the foods on this tour, which was ceviche. So everything was new to us and very different than the other foods we‚Äôd had during our trip. We considered everything ‚Äúlocal comfort food‚Äù and we‚Äôd go back to any of these restaurants again by ourselves. To comment on Daniel- he makes the whole experience very fun. He is completely disarming and and extremely knowledgeable about Peru and many other countries as he has traveled internationally. He converses easily and shows wonderful interest in his clients. He paced the restaurants nicely and the walking was all on level ground in beautiful Barranco. There were restrooms at every restaurant and Daniel was very thoughtful about asking us if we needed to use them at each stop. We hadn‚Äôt seen this neighborhood so we were happy to take it in. It‚Äôs very clean and pretty with beautiful buildings, lots of greenery, and flowers. The restaurants were uniquely decorated and fun to see. Definitely a low key, fun way to see Barranco and eat some great food!

title: Tour on Christmas Day was Excellent
text: Barranco Art and Food Tour was perfect way to get a blend of different types of food through various small dishes. Spicy Ceviche, Anticuchos de Corazon and graffiti were all first-rate.

title: Barranco Art, Food and History! Amazing!
text: This tour was amazing! If you are looking for a tour that combines arts, history, culture, and amazing amazing food. This is the one. The value is wonderful. The tour guide and all staff are so kind, so accommodating, and so thoughtful about every single stop. You never feel rushed. It happened to be my birthday and they really went above and beyond and out of their way. My God Daniel was the absolute best. We had wonderful conversation, he explained everything, at each stop there was delicious food, or art or history to learn. From the Tacu Tacu to the Jade Rivera Gallery to the Beverages to the street art and historical sites I could not have asked for more. Please do not hesitate to book this tour. I really can‚Äôt say enough. He took tons of amazing photos so that I could concentrate on soaking up all the information and he obviously had good relationships with every location. We stopped at. I mean, he even went out of his way to help me find elevation sickness, pills for my next day trip to Machu Picchu. It was one of the best way I‚Äôve ever had and I‚Äôve been using Viator for years in countries, all around the world. The food portions were so plentiful. It was not just a tour. It was an experience, and I felt like I was being treated so wonderfully every step of the way.

title: Great food and art tour for family
text: We had a great time at the Barranco Art and Food Tour. Barranco is a beautiful neighborhood and the food was great. We booked a private tour because we have two children. Everyone enjoyed the tour. It was we‚Äôll-paced and there was a variety of stops. Highly recommended!

title: Unique food experience
text: Highly recommend this tour! We tried new, delicious foods we wouldn't have thought to order on our own. The intertwining of the Jade Rivera gallery with the food tour was really unique and added to the experience. The guide was very friendly and knowledgeable.

title: Exciting journey
text: The tour is particularly varied. Very worthwhile for anyone who wants to get to know Peru in terms of art and cuisine.

title: Magical Barranco
text: A great way to spend our last night in Peru. The food was delicious and the Jade Rivera gallery was a major highlight for me. Dan is incredibly friendly and accommodating‚Äîthanks a bunch! See you next time :)

title: Barranco‚Äôs Gem of a Tour
text: We loved our time exploring Barranco and area art! Each stop was unique from ceviche to Amazon food! We loved the Jade Rivera gallery stop as well as learning to make pisco sours. Now that‚Äôs a skill we can bring home with us!! Daniel was a fantastic guide throughout!! Don‚Äôt miss out.

title: We will do it again next time! Thanks Dan
text: My co workers and I took this tour a week ago and we loved everything we saw and tried. We had some trouble with our flies and we were late for the tour, and they foodies Peru team waited for us. So they made everything possible for us. Thank you so much. The tour was very informative and fun, food was amazing and it was really unique, dishes I never had during my 10 days stay in Peru. Would recommend this to anyone visiting Peru, even if you have 2 hours they will customize a tour for you.

title: Spectacular experience üëçüèºüëçüèº
text: Possibly the most important archaeological site DE America. Rewrite history regarding its population. Excellent attention DE Jos√© and Benja. For me a site DE greater historical value than the Urubamba Valley.

title: Amazing.
text: Excellent excursion. It is really shocking to see the remains of civilizations from 5000 years ago and the degree of knowledge they had and respect for the environment. Our guides (Noem√≠ and Bryan) and our driver (Benji) with their information, their kindness and good disposition made the experience unforgettable. Thank you so much!

title: Beautiful excursion to Caral and Bandurria
text: A great tour that allowed us to learn about the earliest known civilization in the Americas. Ricardo provided an excellent, professional, and attentive guide, with great assistance from Benami as our tour driver.

title: Avoid booking this tour from Lima when the Rio near Caral is flooding
text: The site should not be visited from Lima when the Rio near Caral is flooding. Our car trip from Lima, in a small vehicle with ordinary suspension, took 14 hours. Of these 14 hours, about 10 were spent on the road, and of these 10 hours 3 were spent on a tedious and unkempt dirt road that now serves chicken farms. We were the only tourist party on the road. These three hours were not only tedious but they were excruciating because my wife suffers from severe back pain and the bumpy drive triggered an inflammatory crisis. She will have to spend time in bed to recover. The company, Inca Trilogy Tour, told us that the new road currently used to access Caral could not be taken because of the Rio's flooding. We would have liked to have been told of the fact when we booked the tour. POTENTIAL CUSTOMERS, BE SURE TO CHECK THE ITINERARY OF THIS TOUR BEFORE BOOKING a Caral tour with it. We suggest that the tour not be offered when the Rio is flooding.

title: Fantastic day to Caral!
text: Fantastic day to Caral, tour guide was very friendly and knowledgeable. It was an enjoyable day, if you are wanting to see Caral you should only go with this tour operator!!

title: Must see if you have the time
text: Great tour,very informative and fun. Ricardo and Diego were very helpful and accommodating. We learned a lot about the local culture and history. Tour is well organized with food stops. We were lucky to be able to see this unique site. The tour was recommended by our guide at MALI museum.

title: The oldest cradle of humanity in two Americas
text: The amazing archaeological site! Little known, should be more. The oldest cradle of humanity in two Americas! Very well prepared for history lovers.

title: Fantastic tour to Carsal
text: One of the best tours I have taken, totally recommended, lucky to be able to get to know the cultures of Peru... I will definitely return and take the same tour, the guide was excellent, very professional and very knowledgeable about the local culture.

title: Caral Ruins

title: It was an incredible visit!
text: The visit was great, the driver was very cautious and the guide was phenomenal, Caral was an incredible civilization that created many technologies that were later used by other pre-Inca cultures.

text: Fun art tour with Aaron! Very knowledgeable and accommodating. Enjoyed the time very much! High rating for Haku tours.

title: Excellent one-to-one tour by Mauricio
text: I was the only person booked on this morning and the tour still went ahead; Mauricio gave me a superb one-to-one tour of the cool and quirky neighbourhood of Barranco. He was very knowledgeable and personable, we stopped for coffee and ice-cream and took lots of great pictures.He brought Barranco to life for me.I would highly recommend.

title: Great tour of arty Barranco in Lima
text: Pamela was excellent. Very informative, fun and easy going. I've never done such a tour before and I am so glad I did this.
