text: I had a 1:1 walking tour with the lovely Aura. I loved exploring Barranco and hearing the stories behind the beautiful murals and street art. Aura was very knowledgeable and I enjoyed our few hours together - thank you Aura!

title: Great tour!
text: Amadeo gave us an amazing tour. Nice walk and history of Barranco. We drove to the area , walked and toured, then we‚Äôre dropped back at our hotel.

title: Nice walking tour of Barranco
text: Nice walking tour of Barranco. The guide was very knowledgeable and gave a great overview of the history of the area. She took us to a couple of art galleries and explained the meaning behind the graffiti. We even got treated to ice cream after crossing the bridge of sighs. Overall a beautiful day.

title: Great art tour
text: Our guides were lovely, fun, knowledgeable; we loved being with them; lots of murals and history; great neighborhood your; best beer at end

title: Barranco - a real surprise
text: We had a wonderful walk around the area with our well-educated, informative and friendly guide, Amadeo. I expected a downtrodden area, but was shown a delightful, and colourful suburb, buzzing with activity because it was a holiday weekend. Amadeo told us the history, explained many of the famous murals, arts and crafts, showed us places to eat and highlighted cultural traditions, both old and new. Our stop at his favourite cafe was quiet and enjoyable. We highly recommend this tour and Amadeo.

title: Impressive!
text: They truly deliver! Great communication from the beginning. My guide was very friendly, knowledgeable and patient. I had booked an all-day tour of Barranco and Lima. My tour guide explained many details about the culture, history and life in Lima along the way. We also stopped for coffee at a trendy coffee shop that served Peruvian coffee and later had a delicious lunch at an authentic Peruvian restaurant. I am very grateful for the experience and the level of attention.

title: Excellent
text: Caral, the oldest known 'city' in the Americas, is well preserved and impressive. It's a long drive from Lima, so going on a tour takes a lot of the hard work out of organising a trip to the site. Our guide, Johanna, from peruna tours was knowledgeable, well organised, patient and considerate. Be prepared for a long day. Remember the sunscreen.

title: do not recommend to book
text: I've booked the tour in advance, impatiently waiting for 2 Jan to visit the place Caral. I arrived in Peru from faraway Dubai, and I couldn't think that anyone from that agency had appeared on time or before and announced that there was any issue to re-plan my day. My day was ruined, I lost an opportunity to visit Caral thanks to that unprofessional agency.

title: Secret City of Caral
text: Carlos was great. He picked us up on time and we made great time to Caral and back. The site is wonderful and there are constant excavations and exploring since it's a relatively new discovery (the site was discovered mid 1990s). The site was mostly free of tourists which makes it easier to appreciate. The one issue we had was this tour was supposed to go to Barranca but we ended up in Huacho instead for lunch.

title: Unmissable visit in Peru
text: The guided tour of Caral‚Äôs civilization with Lener was an exceptional experience. His deep knowledge and passion for the history of this ancient civilization made every moment fascinating. Lener not only took us through the impressive archaeological sites, but also offered us a unique perspective on the life and culture of the ancient inhabitants of Caral. His ability to answer our questions and share really enriched the visit. I recommend this experience to anyone interested in history and archaeology; it is truly unforgettable.

title: Better to travel by yourself if you want to go further north anyway
text: The team (guide and driver) were great. The excavations were interesting, but are a work in progress. Very long journey and high price for a 1.5 hour tour. We had to skip the Christo because of traffic. Snacks were not offered.

title: Authentic History
text: Visiting this recently uncovered archeological spot was a unique look into the oldest civilisation in the Americas. The site is still being explored, and the ruins had an authentic 'in progress ' feel. Don't expect finished structures; the site is simple, and few people have discovered this unique and mysterious ruin. Our guide Jose was excellent, providing lots of info on the site and many other insights into Peruvian culture.

title: Corral day trip
text: Great tour guide and driver. Long day trip from Lima. Corral is legitimate as a cultural milestone. Read before you go to understand what happened there.

title: A lot of history
text: My wife and I went to visit this archeological city, it is not very crowded so it is a good plan to escape for a day, the site was the home of an ancient culture in Peru, we learnned a lot about history. I would recommend to bring sunscreen.

title: Fascinating site with a deep history
text: This was a fascinating trip. Caral is a very large site, and Jaynor and Carlos treated us with professionalism and friendliness. I recommend this to anyone with an archaeological interest. Also, remember to bring sunscreen!

title: Excellent tour, excellent guide!
text: Alejandro was a wonderful guide & Carlos was a great driver. We were picked up on time. They took us to a very good local restaurant on the way there and back. Alejandro was extremely knowledgeable about the site of Caral and about Peru in general. The site was fantastic and it is still being developed! Alejandro was extremely personable. I highly recommend this tour!

title: City tour of Lima peru
text: They took us to visit the historic and very beautiful places while informing us of the history of the place and local legends visit the cathedral and its catacombs and other activities more

title: The culture is rich in its diversity.
text: The history and culture are incredible. The church and catacombs were impressive. The history of changes over time, but monuments and buildings remain in excellent condition. 100% recommended.

title: Very entertaining and enjoyable. Recommended!
text: Very good explanation and time for amazing photos! Lots of history and time to buy souvenirs. Recommended for other tours.

title: Very good experience
text: Although we were a big group (46pax) Paul and Mari Luz have managed to make everything go Perfect and on time. A very good experience!!!!

title: Well-used afternoon in Lima
text: Florentino, great driver, together with Jose, excellent guide, have allowed us to enjoy a wonderful afternoon in Lima...The explanations of Jos√©, young man with knowledge, who leads the group falling in love with Lima.

title: Tour Centro Lima with the company of Jos√©
text: We had an amazing time and both Jos√© and Florentino, gave us a fairly complete tour and properly. The best was Joseph's kindness

title: Recommendation
text: Excellent experience with Jos√©, very good guide and very attentive, I recommend the experience to all visitors. Thank you very much

title: First time in Lima
text: Amazing places the guide Diana ua genia!! Very nice and took us to tour and taste the typical artisan piscos.. thank you!

title: Lima visit.
text: Excellent guide Jose and driver Fernando. Very knowledgeable and patient in explaining things. Guide understands and speaks English very well. Highly recommend.

title: Great half day tour in Lima
text: Love the tour since they provided half day tours and the car they gave was also very comfortable almost giving the private tour vibe. Small group tour and the tour guide spoke bilingual languages so no one is left without understanding the what he was saying. Kudos to Jose and Fernando who was so pleasant driving us around town.

title: Amazing time!
text: This day trip was amazing! Jose was an incredible guide - we really loved having him. He was super nice and accommodating. Everything was taken care of, so there was no stress on our part. We got to do a lot of fun activities and learned a lot about the culture and history - our favorite part was definitely the sand buggying and boarding. Definitely worth it, and I would highly recommend!

title: Amazing!!!
text: Amazing experience!!! Would recommend to everyone, it was a long day but our guide made the experience so easy and enjoyable. 10/10!

title: Great Value! Recommended Day Tour from Lima
text: This tour is an absolute must! You start early in the morning from Lima and head to Ballestas Islands, followed by pisco and wine tasting, and end at the Huacachina Oasis for dune buggy rides and sandboarding.At Ballestas Islands, you take a couple-hour boat tour where you can spot whales, the Nazca Lines, sea lions, and penguins. The nearby town is charming, and you can walk around to buy souvenirs.Next, you head to Ica to enjoy a beautiful sunset while trying a variety of pisco and wines. Lunch is also included here.Finally, you visit the incredible Huacachina Oasis, surrounded by endless desert dunes. You get to ride dune buggies for an exhilarating experience and try sandboarding‚Äîit‚Äôs unforgettable!This tour is absolutely worth it! We chose to stay overnight and arranged a private car to return to Lima the next day, but most people head back the same day. Highly recommend it!

title: Excellent company
text: Peru Hop company met expectations, being organized, meeting schedules, with comfortable buses. Highlight for our guide Arturo, who was always available, attentive and polite. Excellent professional. Highlight for our driver, who drove us responsibly and safely.

title: Outdoor adrenaline  and cultural adventure awaits you
text: It was an exhilarating , adrenaline fun filled day with a great group of people and our guide Nilo Lex! Totally enjoyed the Ballestas Islands cruise to see penguins, seals, sea lions and dolphins and many birds. The Pisco Winery was informative on how they made wine centuries ago vs now and we tasted many types of Pisco...delicious and a little tipsy after. Finally we arrived at the dunebuggying/ sandboarding Oasis in the desert Huacachina as Nilo called it. It was like a roller coaster in the sand st 80 to 200km with 3 stops to sand board and watch the sunset üåá. Very soft sand and beautiful valley! I highly recommend this and our crazy( but safe ) driver Pepe!

title: Value and Quality for the Price, for sure
text: This was an unforgettable experience. The tour guide was so amazing and communicative - the ride was long (3 hours), but once you‚Äôre there, they ensure you have a worthwhile day. We tasted chocolate from the locals, saw hundreds of wild birds, dolphins, and sea lions. We even got lucky and they found 2 penguins! The atacoma desert was the highlight where our driver drove through a track on the sand dunes. It didn‚Äôt feel over crowded and made for the best photos you could ask for. Our guide let us watch the sun set on the dunes!! Not to mention the AMAZING high quality dining experience at the winery - such delicious wines and the best food we had ALL WEEK.

title: No call, no show
text: The bus never picked me up or called. I was very disappointed as I waited 45 minutes outside. I waited outside the hotel pickup area. I was the only one out there for 45 mins. No one has contacted me still

title: Amazing experience!
text: Regarding Huacachina: this is, by far, the most amazing experience I've ever had! What an amazing place, I really fall in love with it. Regarding the rest of the tour: Islas Ballestas was so nice as well. We had a really good guide, and I took some amazing pictures. We wen't to a restaurant for lunch and was really nice. They even gave us a wine/pizco degustation at the end. The tour's guide was really good as well.

It says starting from $100/person, but when I selected 3 people, the price changed to $150/person. I assumed if I put a larger number or making the reservation way in advanced instead of less than 24 hours, the price might be $100/person. If you have motion sickness, I suggest you to take a motion sickness medicine before you take the boat ride. It will be good for the sand buggy ride afterwards too. I‚Äôm very scared of heights and roller coaster, but I made the sand buggy ride. I just couldn‚Äôt do the sand boarding but my kids did it. I wish the sand boarding starts with a smaller sand slope first then move up to the taller one. I would be able to do it and so other people who were scared of heights. But, overall, the whole experience was amazing. I highly recommend this smaller group tour.", "rating": 5, "date_original": "Dec 2021 ‚Ä¢ Family", "year": 2021, "month": "December", "visit_category": "Family", "language": "en", "sentiment": {"overall": "positive", "score": 0.88}, "tokens_count": 214, "keywords": ["amazing", "experience", "tour", "sand", "buggy", "board", "recommend", "group", "ride", "son", "daughter"]}

data: [{'title': 'For the adrenaline seekers', 'text': 'Ok. First of all, a DISCLAIMER: if you have fear of roller-coasters, speed or heights: avoid. 54am wake up call for a 17 hr day. Good punctual staffSaul was our guide and he made a chat room to keep us to date on the trip. They puck you up at the hotel and drive you to breakfast. Great bread!!! Wao. Then... drive to Panacas for a ferry ride with a spanish speaking guide. You see many species of birds, sea lions, pups and even starfish. Sunny weather with a cool breeze. Bring sun block and a scarf. The ride is quite chilly. Then drive to lunch. EXCELENT food at "El Catador". 4 choices of entries and 8 of main cource. NO WIFi... then hace 5 shots of wine, pisco, and borgo√±a. Washrooms facilities are available for 1 sol. Then 20 minutes to Huicachina. Small yown with plenty of shops and sellers. Up a hill in a dun on foot to the ATVs. Get reasy for adrenalin, sand, up and downs in the biggest dunes I have ever seen. Some of the passangers got sick... threw up... and got super dizzy. 15minutes out: do sand surfing and take pictures. Temperature was 30 celcious and with a fresh breeze. Got sand IN my socks and tennis shoes. Still I had a great time. 4 hrs drive back to Lima.', 'reviewer': None, 'rating': 5, 'date': 'Written November 28, 2021'}]

title: Third time at Candelaria
text: Excellent show, music and dancing ‚Ä¶the audience participation was exciting and well choreographed. This has been our third time attending and each time it has been a very pleasant experience.

title: A Celebration of Peruvian Culture
text: Our group of 28 had an amazing time at La Candelaria! The show was a vibrant celebration of Peruvian culture, featuring traditional dances from all over the country. The energy was incredible, and the costumes were absolutely stunning.The MC kept the night lively and fun, and we loved how interactive the experience was‚Äîthere were even moments when the audience got to participate! With our VIP tickets, we enjoyed a welcome Pisco Sour and a special drink for the kids.The attention from the staff was great, the atmosphere was festive, and the location is very accessible. This was a true highlight of our trip. Highly recommended for anyone visiting Lima!

title: Maravilloso
text: Very good venue and better presentation of the balletQuality musical groupExcellent animator. It is a place that you cannot miss in limeThanks for such a great show and presentationThank you for your welcome

title: Great Show
text: The dancing from the different Peruvian regions was spectacular. Loved the acknowledgment of the African influence and the aerobatic number. They need to offer a vegetarian option with ticket.

title: Scam
text: Lousy, a scam for tourists, they wanted us to pay twice, it was paid online and when we arrived they didn't know the Reservation and first they said it was full and then they said to get in we had to pay again

title: Candelaria Show
text: The show was excellent, the bad thing was that our reservation was not confirmed, they placed us at a table and then asked us to change positions.

title: Drink and food to improve
text: We visited as a family, the show was good but the food and drink were terrible, much to improve in that aspect. If I had to return, I wouldn't.

title: Unmissable show
text: Very good event and showRecommended. The food could improve. Super attentive and friendly attention

title: Great Performance But Tourists Beware...
text: The Peruvian Dancers were top-notch, the MC made the show and the band was great, also. The mic and speaker system was not the best, the MC was hard to understand, at best. And the music was way too loud to be enjoyable for 4 hours.We purchased a few beers after lunch, paid for them in cash, and didn't realize that we were shorted $10 cash back. We didn't notice the shortage until we were on our way back to our hotel. We don't know if it was the waiter or the person at the register that ripped us off. Beware if you attend and double check that you receive the correct change. I would have rated the event much higher but could not do so knowing they have employees who took advantage. By the way, we tipped our water very well, not knowing we were ripped off!

title: La Candelaria de Lima
text: Very much enjoyed the show, but we rushed through very heavy, crazy Lima traffic to arrive before the published start time of 9:00PM, only to discover that the show actually started at 10:00. It was very late for a 3- hour show, but the wait and late start time were well worth it. The show was beautiful, the costumes gorgeous, and the MC was energetic and entertaining. The meal was nothing special, but at 11:00PM. I wasn‚Äôt that hungry anyway.

title: Empathetic Professional Understanding and Support by Mily Benavides
text: Feedback for GET2PERU.COM As an overseas tour operator based in Bengaluru, India, was booking a tour for the first time through Viator for a GET2PERU tour, I experienced a scheduling mix-up due to an overlap between an overnight bus journey and the flight departure date, resulting in reserving the tour a day later than intended. I reached out to Ms. Mily Benavides of GET2PERU.COM via WhatsApp (+51 920 098 698), and she not only understood the situation with great empathy but also resolved the issue promptly and professionally. Her swift action and genuine support truly reflect the ethos and reliability of the GET2PERU team. As a fellow travel industry professional, I deeply value such care‚Äîit not only strengthens our immediate business relationship but also lays the foundation for long-term collaboration. I am confident in recommending GET2PERU.COM to other travel agents and clients. Following this experience, I will begin actively promoting GET2PERU tours across India and through my network of contacts. Your team has shown what it means to be responsible, responsive, and truly committed to serving partners and travelers alike. Warm regards, Mahaboobulla Khan +91 9900786677 bookvacations@hotmail.com

title: The Day is Long, But Totally Worth It
text: The day before, we took a bus from Lima, and the ride was really comfortable. We arrived in Nasca super early, ready to start with the land tour, which was awesome. The land tour gives you so much extra info that really adds to the flight experience. After that, we did the flight over the Nazca Lines‚Äîabsolutely unreal and full of mystery. Then, we headed back to Lima by bus after the flight, which takes about 7 hours, but it‚Äôs totally worth it. Everything went smoothly and was well organized. Big thanks to Carlos and Mily for everything! They‚Äôve got a fantastic restaurant right across from the bus station. I recommend the pisco sour and the coffee!

title: Wonderful trip
text: Ana is a wonderful person, her enthusiasm, patience and thoughtfulness have made me a pleasant trip. I will recommend to friends.

data: [{'title': 'From Lima to the Nasca Lines', 'text': 'Our journey to the Nazca Lines began in Lima, and it was an experience that exceeded all expectations. From the moment we were picked up the night before by our driver, Juan, at our hotel, everything was perfectly organized. After a comfortable drive from Lima to Nasca (6 hours) we were taken on a scenic journey through the desert landscape, with Carlos providing insights along the way. We arrived at the first stop‚Äîthe Nazca miradores (viewpoints). Here, we were able to take in our first glimpses of the massive geoglyphs. It‚Äôs truly amazing to stand on the ground and see the figures stretch across the desert. Carlos explained the history and the mystery behind the lines, which made it all the more captivating. Next, we headed to the local airport for our overflight. The airport process was smooth, and we were assisted at every step by the team, which made us feel completely at ease. Our guide remained with us, ensuring we had everything we needed for the flight. Once aboard the 6-passenger plane, we took to the skies, and the views of the Nazca Lines were absolutely breathtaking. The flight offered a bird‚Äôs-eye view of the iconic figures such as the Monkey, the Spider, and the Hummingbird. As we soared over the desert, our pilot expertly maneuvered the plane, ensuring we had the best angles and clear views of each geoglyph. The experience was surreal, and it felt almost impossible to believe we were flying above something so ancient and mysterious. The pilot also provided useful commentary, pointing out the figures and sharing additional historical context, making the flight even more informative. The whole experience, from the informative mirador visits to the thrilling overflight, was well-paced and perfectly managed by Get2Peru.com. They made sure we were comfortable, informed, and able to make the most of this unique experience. This was, without a doubt, one of the most memorable parts of our trip to Peru. From pick-up in Lima to the final moments of our flight, the team‚Äôs professionalism and passion for the Nazca Lines made it a truly unforgettable adventure. If you‚Äôre in Lima and have the chance to explore the Nazca Lines, I highly recommend booking this tour. It‚Äôs a once-in-a-lifetime experience that should not be missed!', 'rating': 5, 'date_original': 'Jan 2025 ‚Ä¢ Friends', 'year': 2025, 'month': 'January', 'visit_category': 'Friends', 'language': 'en', 'sentiment': {'overall': 'positive', 'score': 0.92}, 'tokens_count': 437, 'keywords': ['nasca lines', 'lima', 'peru', 'flight', 'geoglyphs', 'guide', 'pilot', 'desert', 'tour', 'unforgettable']}]

title: DEFINITELY COMING BACK
text: Make sure Carlos is your tour guide. An amazing person, very knowledgeable about the history, and makes sure you are taken care of from start to finish.

title: Excellent program from Lima
text: get2peru organized the program for us to visit the Nazca Lines, from the beginning everything was well organized, easy to communicate with them, we left at night in a super comfortable bus to Nazca, we arrived around 5 am and ours was waiting for us. Guide, we crossed the street and there was the get2peru office. We really enjoyed the flight and the land tour. I highly recommend it. At 2 pm we left back to Lima.THANKS FOR EVERYTHING GET2PERU TEAM

title: A Must-Have Experience
text: Highly recommend Carlos to anyone looking for a tour guide! Carlos is outstanding ‚Äì his compassion and attention to every detail made our trip special. He goes above and beyond to accommodate our requests. His friendly demeanor and extensive knowledge about the Nazca lines were both enlightening and enjoyable. Choosing Carlos as a guide made my trip an unforgettable experience. Don't miss out on the chance to have him as your guide!

title: Excellent program to visit the Lines from Lima
text: If you have a day to get to know the lines, this experience is highly recommended! They pick you up from your hotel in Miraflores the night before, we travel in a super comfortable bus, reclining seats at 160¬∞, bathrooms and air conditioning, you have a screen to watch movies, listen to music or read a book, the night trip doesn't even feel like it, you arrive very early and our guide Juan was waiting for us, they bought us a coffee and prepared us for the overflight with interesting information about the Lines and tips to make the most of it and not miss any figure, they gave us a map where the figures that we are going to see are marked and they offered us options Of the tour we could do, we chose to visit the viewpoints since they show figures that are not in the 35-minute flight. These are called Palpa figures and they are older than those of Nazca. We visited 5 viewpoints. Our guide was great, a lot of valuable information and an excellent prepare for the flight. We arrived at the airport around 9 am and they were already waiting for us with everything organized. They weighed us on a scale and we proceeded to board the flight. It is incredible what you see from above. It leaves you amazed. The lines have no definition, but they are unique and mysterious thanks to the advice from Juan Carlos we had a great time! At the end of the flight we decided on another tour to visit the mothers of Chauchilla and at the end we returned to the get2peru offices, which also have their family restaurant next door. We ate, we relaxed using the free Wi-Fi and with a few minutes remaining we crossed the runway to the station to board. Our bus at 2 in the afternoon returned to Lima. We would have liked to know that from Nasca we could take a bus to Arequipa, but still everything was excellent and thank you, Get2peru team! 100% highly recommended

title: Great way to see Nazca lines in a day, from Lima
text: This is a great way to see the fantastic sights. Admittedly a long, full day when travel is included. However the coaches are really comfortable, with seats which recline and, leg rests. We were looked after really well, with great communication before hand and, attentive care during the trip. We were picked up at our hotel ( by Juan) and transported to the bus station. Our driver stayed to ensure we boarded the right bus. We were greeted at the end of the journey by Juan Carlos who made us welcome. We had a detailed briefing of what we would see and told to ensure we got the most out of our flight. We took an additional, optional tour, to see sights from the ground, before embarking on flight, Juan was again very attentive, making sure the processes ran smoothly.Our journey / for information. 21:30 pick up. 22:15 bus. Arrival in Nazca - 05:25. We are catching 14:00 back to Lima and expect to be there about 21:30, Long , but gear day. Thanks all to all those involved in helping it be so good!

title: One of Outlook Peru Highlights
text: We had a great time doing the Nazca Lines Flight. Amazing experience!We booked our tour with Carlos due to recommendations and this was just what you need to do!Super friendly and a guy with passion for what he is doing! Would recommend him and his company 100%

title: Excellent Transport Service
text: We used ‚ÄòCrown Taxi and Remisse‚Äô for three transports during our family vacation in Peru. Communication with the manager was excellent (via WhatsApp). The transport service was punctual and efficient. Vans were clean and comfortable. Drivers were polite, friendly, and safe. The experience was excellent. I fully recommend and would use again.

title: Will use again
text: Hired from airport to hotel, downtown trip and go back to airport. It was smooth ride. Driver dropped us at downtown and pick up the meeting point.

title: Taxi from Airport to Hotel
text: Great service - driver was waiting for us at the airport when we arrived in Lima after a very long journey from London. Driver was very helpful and spoke perfectly good English

title: Excellent!
text: From our arrival in Lima until our departure from Cusco everything went as planned. We had done the classics of southern Peru: Lima, Nasca, Arequipa, Puno, Cusco and of course the fabulous Machu Pichu, and also some sites off the beaten track.Excellent driver (we always felt safe by his driving) but also excellent qualified guide.The big plus is that we had the same guide throughout the trip. This created a very friendly atmosphere.

title: A Stellar Experience with Crown Transportation: A Lifesaver for Our Trip
text: Excellent Experience with Crown Transportation!I cannot praise Crown Transportation enough for the outstanding service they provided during our trip. From the very beginning, they showed exceptional flexibility and accommodation when our schedules and flights faced cancellations and delays. Thanks to their prompt and efficient communication, particularly Martin's rapid responses, our entire journey was saved.The drivers, Miguel, Oscar, and David, deserve special recognition for their remarkable skills behind the wheel. Navigating the chaotic traffic of Lima with such smoothness and composure was truly impressive. They made our daily commutes comfortable and stress-free, allowing us to relax and enjoy the sights without worrying about the road ahead.Crown Transportation's commitment to customer satisfaction was evident in every aspect of our experience. Their ability to provide us with alternative options whenever needed demonstrated their dedication to ensuring our journey went smoothly.I highly recommend Crown Transportation to anyone visiting Lima or in need of reliable transportation services. Their team's professionalism, punctuality, and willingness to go the extra mile made our trip truly memorable. Five stars without a doubt!

title: Amazing guide and even better memories!
text: Martin was an amazing Driver! He was punctual, funny, kind and overall a fun guy to be around. He was very knowledgeable on so much about Perus history. Highlight of the trip was definitely the karaoke jams session we had on our long drives!

title: Great experience
text: Crown are very nice! hey response very timely and very helpful. Highly recommended! The driver is also very nice and arrived on time

title: Best driver/ translator/ guide
text: We had a wonderful time in Lima/ Paracas/ Nasca with Martin as our driver/ translator/ guide. Martin was EXCELLENT - he was on time, the car was clean, he had great suggestions for meals and snacks, he was patient and thoughtful, we felt very safe, he was very knowledgeable about everything we asked about. I will highly recommend Crown Taxi & Remisse to any of my friends and family who are thinking of visiting Peru!

text: I paid by bank deposit to pick up my friends, but forgot to tell them, and then the driver went ahead and accepted a cash payment. Pagu√© por dep√≥sito bancario para recoger a mis amigos, pero olvid√© dec√≠rselo, y luego el conductor sigui√≥ adelante y acept√≥ un pago en efectivo de mis amigos. title: Lima by night
text: Great tour,  very knowledgeable and personable guide. I particularly enjoyed the Catacombs and would do that tour again.Athena was pure gold

title: Go with your eyes closed!
text: I loved the ride with Athenas, she is very dynamic and funny, she speaks very good English and knows Lima like her pocket. I recommend 100% the tour!

title: Great Lima city tour
text: We had a city great tour with Alex. He was informative, professional, and made sure we had everything we needed. He even helped secure the transfer back to our hotel. Highly recommend!

title: Great
text: Athena is an enthusiastic, thoughtful, and helpful guide through the huge, beautiful Bas√≠lica de San Francisco's interesting architecture and underground catacombs (unfortunately no type of photography is allowed, and the postcard selection is meager), then a walk through old town/Plaza de Armas, followed by a drive to the waterpark, with an evening video presentation honoring Peru projected on to the fountains. There are several food stalls in the park, but the empanadas we had were very dry/stale. Best to bring your water bottle, maybe a snack. About 4 hours, pick up from Miraflores/Barranco hotels is a big plus!

title: Tour Catacombs and downtown Lima
text: We want to thank Alex our guide who gave us a beautiful family tour we enjoyed it very much and learned from Peruvian culture!!!

title: A wonderful experience
text: It was a wonderful experience, our guide Juan was very professional, knowledgeable about the history and culture of the city. We feel very good about your company on this adventure. Thank you, Juan.

title: Engaging and insightful history of Lima
text: Juan was very knowledgeable and engaging during the tour. His little quizzes and his explanation on the history and context were very insightful and made the tour even more interesting for us. We would recommend this tour and Juan for sure.

title: Great Excursion
text: Alexander was truly amazing. His knowledge and enthusiasm was appreciated. We toured the Plaza de Mayor and the Catacombs which were incredibly interesting. We then went row watch the fountain light and water show. Beautiful! All the fountains were so pretty.

title: Excellent Service and Attention Jean Paul super friendly and explains everything very well, pick it up from hotel is a super plus
text: Excellent Service and AttentionJean Paul super friendly and explains everything very well, travel comfortable and pick it up in hotel is super plus, I give a more than 10000, super recommended

title: Great night tour of Lima
text: Athena and Stirling made the trip fun and entertaining. Athena was very freindly and knowledgeable.  The Monastery and Catacombs were unbelievable and the fountain light show was incredible.

title: Catacombs + Churros
text: This was an excellent tour!  Our guide Juan was very knowledgeable and funny.  We even got a chance to stop for Churros! Eduardo our driver maneuvered the crazy streets with perfection.  If your looking for a quick highlights tour of Lima including the catacombs and the fun Light show, this is a great option!  Gracias!!

title: Lima catacombs and Magic Water Show
text: Juan was a great guide, very informative and so personable! The trip was timed so that we had plenty of time to see everything we wanted too. The catacombs and water fountain show were both so unique to our experiences!

title: Catacombs
text: I loved visiting the historic center of Lima. We visited the catacombs and went to see the water show as well. The driver is Alex, our guide, were super attentive and polite

title: A pleasant experience!
text: We closed our tour through Tripadvisor. The driver passed by our hotel on time and we were accompanied by guide Alex, who gave us information about the city throughout the journey. I recommend!

title: Must do!
text: Our tour guide Manuek was top notch. Went there just expecting to be shown around, but received a full on college level class of Per√∫ history haha! Price might be higher than some others but our group only contained 3 of us making it seem very personal. Well worth the 65$ per person!

title: Interesting
text: Our guide Pamela was knowledgeable and friendly. She gave us plenty of time to explore each area . We were never rushed and any questions we had ,were answered clearly.

title: Interesting place but terrible guide
text: Unfortunately we had a guide whose English was impossible to understand and made the whole experience lose it's value . It could have been interesting with another guide .

title: Wonderful Overview of Lima
text: Absolutely wonderful time with our guide Aura. She was knowledgeable, engaging and a lot of fun. Excellent communication from the moment we booked it and timely pick up. I highly recommend this tour company if you want to see several Lima highlights in a short time without feeling rushed. Thank you for a wonderful time and also for introducing us to the original churro- YUM!

title: First Timers in Lima
text: First time in Lima, and Jean Paul didn't disappoint. We had a small tour group, so everything was more personal. Jean Paul is very knowledgeable and even gave us tips for our upcoming Machu Picchu tour. He also referred us to some great restaurants to try. The Peruivan Chicken is amazing!

title: Great day
text: The tour is very interesting and our guide was super nice. You ca Learn q lot from the experience. It Definitely recommend it!

title: Great solo trip Nazca and Huacachina
text: Great Solo Trip . Very long but worth it if you want to get the most out of your time. 4am to 11pm . Did the huacachina and nazca lines . Both a truly beautiful and amazing experience. Frendy , our guide , was amazing. Her extensive knowledge of the history and passion for her culture was contagious. Very organized. Highly recommended

title: Great way to see Nazca Lines and top up with exceptional fun in Oasis.
text: We had a fantastic time in this long day tour. It started early but it‚Äôs all worthwhile.The Nazca Lines are amazing and it‚Äôs a must see, the pilots are really good in navigating the plane to give us great vantage points for sightings.The afternoon was filled with fun with the sand buggy ride and sand-boarding.Our tour guide Sonia are excellent in showing us the sites and making sure our jam packed day went smoothly. Our driver Javier was just equally good!Full marks for this tour and highly recommended.

title: Extremely recommended tour
text: I had one of my best experiences on the trip so far. Frendi the guide was so helpful in anything I needed. She had a great knowledge about everything we saw and did. The flight was a wonderful activity and all the explanations before we're extremely helpful. The sand riding was , amazing and beautiful. Overall very recommended!

title: If you can take the time to stay back and on the road, we highly recommend the two guides responsible for the tour arrangement.
text: Due to the length of the route to NASCA, each by two guides, Louis is responsible for the arrangement and transfer of the journey, Revilla is responsible for the local explanation and guidance of the journey, the overall is very complete, the prior reminders and notifications are also done in detail, so that we have a very complete experience, NASCA flight although only half an hour but very amazing, buggy ride like a rainbow is very exciting, if you can withstand the time to stay back and on the road, I highly recommend these two guides responsible for the schedule.

title: Supportive tour guide
text: We were Japanese and the tour was in English, so we couldn't understand the explanation 100 percent. However, she shared her translation into Japanese, which was very helpful. It was a very good tour to understand.

title: Riddle and fun in one day!
text: Sonia made our tour loaded with valuable information preparing us for our overflight!It's tired but worth a lot! The tour in Huacachina full of adventure and fun!

title: Highly recommended!
text: Everything was perfect. Our guide, Frendy, was very insightful, full of information and helpful tips when needed. Both activities were great, Nasca lines is a step on history and Huacachina extremely fun!Having a driver like Luis Alcarraz gave us peace of mind, the trip is long and he was alert and careful all the way.

title: Sand and historic lines,  epic
text: Amazing experience,  Davi and Frendy were excellent guides, friendly and knowledgeable and answered all my questions expertly. Amazing day, would recommend!

title: Best day in Nazca Huacachina
text: The sightseeing flight to see over 10 Geogryphs in Nazca and the buggy sandboarding experience in the dunes of Huacachina were great fun! My guide, Freddy, was also very courteous and gave me a detailed explanation of the history of the ruins!The bus on the move had softer chairs than I'd imagined, and I could recline and sleep comfortably.

title: Good experience
text: He explained in great detail, care and detail about the Nazca ground drawings and so on. I also think he was very kind.

title: Excellent experience with Maverick
text: Fantastic tour with our guide Maverick by ravine and Miraflores. It is very worth the experience, we enjoyed very nice views and places guided by an excellent explanation from our guide Maverick. At all times he was a caring and friendly guide. We laughed a lot and enjoyed the group a lot. I recommend this tour.

title: Fun way to get to know parts of Lima
text: This was a super fun way to cover more ground in the city, especially if it‚Äôs your first day in Lima. We really enjoyed our tour guide - he was a real character and gave us some great local recommendations. The best part was getting to bike around the City, which has some robust bike infrastructure and lovely green spaces. You can cover a lot of ground on the bikes. Biking on the roads without bike lanes could be hairy because of the traffic rules, so I recommend this only if you are a comfortable urban biker. Overall a fun non traditional tour of Lima!

title: Not great
text: The tour guide was nice but the tour was pretty bad. We all had different types of bikes that lacked quality. The route seemed random, sending us on and off the sidewalk with our bikes and cycling in parks where we were not supposed to. The locals were telling us and the police even asked is to step off our bikes. Tour guide crossed red lights and just left us to follow him. Didn‚Äôt get much information. Basically just stretching time riding circles in the city.

title: Amazing bike ride through a beautiful city with a great guide.
text: Franco was amazing, his knowledge of the different districts is vast, and his English is very good. He took my wife and I to many different parks and neighborhoods, teaching us the history along the way. Before the bike ride he got us both a water and along the bike ride we stopped for the restroom when needed. All together it was a relatively easy bike ride on flat land but Barranco has many hills. None that are too steep but you will definitely get tired in barranco.

title: Amazing bike tour
text: I was visiting Lima solo and joined Franco‚Äôs bike tour 2 days in a row! It‚Äôs an adventure cycling in Lima and he knows all if the best ways to get around and through the traffic. He also knows so much about Peruvian history and Lima so it feels like a little classroom on wheels. I did both the city center tour and the more ocean side tour and they were both great. I love to see a new place by bicycle and I cannot give Franco a higher recommendation. Sign up if you are planning a trip to Lima.

title: Great tour!!
text: This was an insightful and fun tour of Lima. Gonzalo was an awesome guide who was patient and friendly - not to mention knowledgeable!! I highly recommend this tour.

title: Easy tour, fun!
text: Bike tour in Lima with guide Gonzalo. Guide really took the time to answer questions and knew a lot. We did a standard tour, about 18 kilometers in 3 hours. Not difficult at all, we took the time for a coffee along the way. Very good experience! Would totally recommend it :-)

title: Perfect Tour! Great experience.
text: Interesting tour of Lima's most characteristic neighbourhoods. Our guide Joao was perfect and provided us with lots of interesting information and valuable local tips. The best way to see these beautiful neighbourhoods if you are short on time.I must also say that BToL was very patient with our delay due to traffic and still managed to give us the full experience.

title: Great way to see more of Lima than walking. Wish there was a better helmet though
text: Gonzalo was a friendly guide and showed us a number of great viewpoints throughout the San Isidro, Miraflores, and Barranco districts. He helped us navigate safely in the chaotic traffic when there are no bike lanes.I‚Äôd say this bike tour is only suitable for those comfortable riding on tight roads with cars and pedestrians as well as potholes and bumps. I would have wanted a better helmet ‚Äî the one I got didn‚Äôt have much front protection so I felt if an accident should happen, I‚Äôd likely still hit my forehead. The helmet‚Äôs padding was missing too so the velcro kept tearing at my hair during the ride so that was uncomfortable too.

title: Great tour, great guide
text: Franco was a great guide. He arranged to have us picked up at our hotel in Barranco and provided water and helmets and dropped us off at the end back at our hotel. We even arranged a ceviche stop in Miraflores. He stopped whenever we requested for pictures as well as provided a lot of historical insights. Can‚Äôt recommend him highly enough

title: Unforgettable walking tour of Miraflores, Baccanco and San Isidro.
text: If you are looking for a tour that perfectly blends history, culture, and the vibrant pulse of modern Peruvian life, look no further. Our walking tour through Miraflores, Barranco, and San Isidro with Sandy was an absolute highlight of our trip to Lima.From the very beginning, Sandy was punctual, meeting us right on time with a bright smile, and her attentiveness was evident throughout the entire day. She constantly checked in to ensure we were comfortable, answered all our questions and adjusted the pace to suit our needs. She didn't just give us dates and facts; she wove together fascinating stories and interesting insights that gave us a genuine understanding of each district's unique character. From the cliffside parks and Huaca Pucllana in Miraflores, to the bohemian soul and colorful streets of Barranco, to the sleek financial heart of San Isidro, Sandy provided context that brought everything to life. She shared cultural nuances, and local recommendations that you simply cannot get from a guidebook. Her kindness and passion for her country were infectious, making the tour feel like we were being shown around by a knowledgeable friend.We ended the tour not only with beautiful photos but with a much deeper appreciation for Lima and its people. This is a must-do for any visitor to Lima!

title: Susan Review
text: I had the absolute pleasure of joining Susan‚Äôs Miraflores, Barranco & San Isidro tour, and it was one of the highlights of my trip to Lima. From the moment we met, Susan‚Äôs warmth and professionalism stood out. She has an incredible way of blending history, culture, and local stories that brought each district to life in a way no guidebook ever could.In Miraflores, she gave us fascinating insights into the coastal views and modern vibe of the district, making sure we didn‚Äôt just see the landmarks but truly understood their place in Lima‚Äôs identity. Barranco was a treat ‚Äî Susan‚Äôs storytelling turned its colorful streets, street art, and bohemian charm into a living canvas. By the time we explored San Isidro, she had seamlessly shifted gears to highlight its elegance, green spaces, and historical importance.What impressed me most was how Susan tailored the experience to our interests, making the tour feel personal and engaging. She was attentive, answered every question with patience and depth, and made sure we experienced both the must-see highlights and hidden gems.Her passion for Lima is contagious, and her knowledge is remarkable. I walked away not only with great photos but also with a real connection to the city and its culture.I can‚Äôt recommend Susan‚Äôs tour highly enough ‚Äî whether it‚Äôs your first time in Lima or you‚Äôve visited before, she will show you the city in a way you‚Äôll never forget.

title: visit with partner
text: I went, to spend the afternoon copn my partner, and we had a good time, good snack, pejerrey sandwich and chicharron with grape juice and melon, what surprised me is that they have dambo chips, super good

title: Nice and easy!
text: I would give it 5 stars except I felt it was slower than expected. We could have moved along a little faster and added a couple more sites or spend more time in Barranco than at the beginning. So if you are looking for a slower paced tour, this is the one. They take you to San Isidro which is a beautiful city in Lima and not many tour. The tour guide was great. He spoke perfect English.

title: Beautiful walk worth taking
text: Beautiful tour of Miraflores, San Isidro and Barranco districts. Our very loving and attentive Sandy guide explained in many details each of the places we visited.It was a beautiful and unforgettable walk. Both she and the driver were wonderful.

title: Awesome semi-private tour
text: So quaint felt more like a walk around town with a close personal friend.I would highly recommend. They picked up us promptly at the hotel with plenty of communication beforehand.They then drove us by private van to various locations where we walked and explored. Martin was very informative, friendly and awesome photographer. You can tell he loves what he does. He was also very helpful when the ATM ate my card and refused to give it back.Gracias a Martin (guide) and Mr. Jimmy (driver) for introducing us into to these beautiful neighborhoods in Lima.

title: Go for It!
text: A nice tour covering the most interesting distticts of Lima with a very polite and knowlegeabke guide. Definitely worth it!

title: Enjoyable way to explore Lima!
text: This is a lovely way to explore different neighborhoods of Lima.  Enjoyed seeing Love Park, walking through olive groves in San Isidro, and exploring the artist area of Barranco. Our tour guide, Martin, was extremely knowledgeable about the sites we visited as well as other areas of Peru. It was a great tour and a wonderful experience with a small group of travelers.

title: A quick way to see a little of each neighborhood. Susan's explanations are very satisfactory. Very knowledgeable about
text: A quick way to see a little of each neighborhood. Susan's explanations are very satisfactory. Very knowledgeable about the history of the city.

title: Educational and entertaining
text: This was our first visit to Lima so we knew nothing about the neighborhoods. Our guide, Mitch, was very knowledgeable and his English was excellent and easy to understand. We completely enjoyed the day.

title: Thoroughly enjoyable
text: Roxana was a great tour guide lots of knowledge, interesting and educational with a great sense of humour,and very good English

title: UNFORGETTABLE TOUR!!
text: The tour was very interesting and fulfilled the scheduled itinerary, the places we met were very beautiful and full of history, the guide service was very good as we were given the necessary information, it was very good experience!!

title: Great tour and guide
text: Ricardo‚Äôs knowledge of the history of Peruvian culture was very interesting and informative. He was very patient with our senior group.

title: It was a fun day.
text: The guide spoke slowly and explained it to us as foreigners. The driver was also very good at driving and was able to go wherever he wanted to go. Thank you very much.

title: Excursion to Callao
text: It was a lovely experience.From the agency (which solved the Reservation of the excursion in a very short time, the payment method, etc.), the driver Diego (very punctual and super friendly) and the Narda Guide, who really brought us a lot of information with incredible enthusiasm. You can really tell the affection with which you perform your task.Really super recommended.

title: Excellent service
text: The Lima excursion from the port of Callao by Inca Trilogy Tours was excellent. The guide named Manuel was very well prepared and attentive at all times.

title: Wonderful Lima Excursion
text: Wonderful Lima excursion. Our guide Oswaldo Bedoya was very informative and documented regarding the history, traditions, and culture of Lima/Peru. He went out of his way to make us feel welcome.

title: Miraflores-Barranco Tour
text: Interesting tour to get know Lima and these important districts. I wish there were some additional immersive activities. The guide, Italo, was very friendly and knowledgeable about the subject.

title: A must do tour
text: Highly recommend this tour with trip advisor over a cruise ship excursion. Saul was our tour guide and was very professional and knowledgeable. His English was superb. There is much to see and learn in Lima and this personal tour was worth every penny.

title: Great Tour
text: Oswaldo was a superb tour guide. In-depth history of Lima. And tour meets the buses which shuttle you from the dock inland - so you do not need to start from a hotel.

title: Lima with Cindy
text: Our tour guide, Cindy, was excellent. She spoke in both English and Spanish as we had 1 non-English speaker and 1 non-Spanish speaker. We felt very safe with our driver. We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Cindy. She always found an easier way for our handicapped people to get to where we were going. Thanks Cindy!

title: Great touring experience!
text: My wife and I recently visited Peru for the holidays with my wife's sister and her husband.  We spent time in both Lima and Cusco and we used Peruvian Local Friend to coordinate our entire visit.  We had visited Peru back in 2017 and had the good fortune to meet Peruvian Local Friend and we were happy to be able to use their services again.  They provided three different tour guides for three different tours that we did with them and all of them - Cindy, Evelyn and Cory - were excellent!  So much knowledge and so much information shared!  We did a city tour of Lima, Cusco and then Machu Pichu.  Everything was great!  And not only did they provide the tours for us, they also arranged all of our transportation and transfers.  We did not have to worry about a thing!  Peruvian Local Friend made our trip easy and informative!  It was truly a pleasure to work with them again!!

title: 5 STAR TOUR OF LIMA
text: I told Sandra at PLF, we wanted to see select sites we hadn‚Äôt seen plus Lima from a local‚Äôs perspective. Sandra and our guide Rodrigo delivered a 5 star tour for us. We visited places most tourists don‚Äôt see. Rodrigo was an oracle of information about Lima and Peru and their relationship in history and the present. If you want a 5 star tour of Lima, call Sandra at PLF and request Rodrigo to be your guide. After contacting Sandra her responses to my many questions were immediate. She also helped with transportation logistics‚Ä¶a lifesaver for a non Spanish speaking client.

dtitle: Great insight to all of Lima, amazing guide Cindy
dtext: We had been on a small group tour of Peru and had a day before our return flight home. I'd booked to be picked up and returned to the airport, and to see Barranco and other areas. The tour was planned to be flexible around us and what we wanted to see.Our driver was Cesar, who was an excellent, careful driver. I've no idea how he keeps so calm driving around Lima every day!We met Cindy in Barranco and started our walking tour. She listened to what we wanted to do and advised us to have lunch there - an amazing spot, Restaurant Javier, overlooking the sea and great seafood.  Being our last meal in Peru we were greedy and had lots left but it wasn't too expensive. We explored some more of the area, including a lovely gallery/ craft shop.We then drove above Chirolles to look at the bay of Lima overall and then a wander round the fisherman's area. This was Cindy's home area growing up, and she was evidently proud of it and the friendly people, with no other European tourists in sight.A quick drive past one of the 100 pyramids in Lima with a photo stop (we had no idea they existed from our very limited group tour of the city) then through San Isidro, with a wander through the park.This tour gave us a completely different view from the  tour at the start of our Peru trip - it felt like the previous tour had just been to buildings and hadn't given us any feeling for the entire city.Highly recommend the flexible approach of the company in planning our tour and specifically Cindy in delivering such a great experience.

title: Lima After Noon + Larco Museum tour
text: We did the Lima After Noon city tour and added a visit to the Larco Museum. It was very easy to communicate and adjust the tour to our liking ahead of time. Our guide, Cindy (with driver Cesar), arrived on time to our hotel to begin the tour. We didn't follow the exact order of sites listed on the website, but Cindy adjusted the order to give us a better experience by avoiding traffic and busy times at certain locations. She was very knowledgeable and easy to spend a day with around Lima. We learned so much about the history of the city. Cindy also provided us with many good suggesting about other things to do and eat after our time together was over. I would highly recommend visiting the Larco Museum with a guide like Cindy; she was able to tell us the stories of many of the pieces, where on our own we would have tired out halfway through reading placards. Whenever we return to Lima, Peruvian Local Friend will certainly be used to tour more in and around town.

title: made the most of one day in Lima
text: Absolutely cannot praise this company and guide enough. Extremely convenient, worked with my interests, and allowed me to really see some of the city on an unexpected layover. Highlights were street art in Barranco, ceviche lunch in a local restaurant (really - try chicha), the Larco Museum, and the Ariaga House. And a churro! One of the most fun travel experiences of my life.

Rodri was an exceptional informed guide. We did two days of exploring Lima. Rodri was able to fulfill all our expectations as a guide. We highly recommend him. His knowledge of local food was fantastic.

title: Truly a local friend
text: Our guide Cindy spoke perfect English, was very knowledgeable and accommodating. We enjoyed the tour of Miraflores and Barranco; the local insight  and the historical background  provided by Cindy made this day a memorable experience.

title: Highly recommend using Peruvian Local Friend to plan a trip to Peru!
text: Peruvian local friend was a GREAT company to use for our first trip to Peru! They were awesome in helping us create a perfect itinerary spanning both Lima and Cusco. Email responses were always quick and comprehensive. Customer service was top tier. They did a great job of giving us options to explore what would be the best for us. I would highly recommend using them to plan a trip! It made the trip so much smoother having all of our guides and transportation pre arranged. Evelyn in Cusco was a particularity good guide! Thank you!

title: Make the most out of 5 hours in Lima
text: With a 12-hour layover in Lima, we decided to take a tour with Peruvian Local Friend. We were met at the airport by our driver and joined our guide in downtown Lima. Our guide was very knowledgeable about the history and architecture of the area and we appreciated his flexibility and ability to alter plans to meet our interests. We spent some time in the beautiful Barranco and Miraflores areas before heading back to the airport. Lima is a very large city and takes a lot of time to drive through. I would not recommend trying to navigate this city on your own. This was a very good value to complete our time in Peru.

title: A very good tour whose name guide Juana was very friendly and well documented. He cleared up all our doubts. Da
text: The tour guide of name Juana was always very friendly and was very well documented. The driver was very friendly too.

title: Excellent experience
text: A very educational and enjoyable tour. The guide explained everything in great detail and knowledge. We ate churros and even tasted pisco. 100% recommended.

title: Joan and Max, a great excursion
text: Juana, the guide, has explained everything super well, you can see that she is well trained in subject and has been very nice. And driver Max, very kind

title: Charmed with Lima and its historic center
text: We visit the main places in a comfortable way and with great historical information.Lima surprised us and loved it.The service apart from friendly Juana and Ricardo are remarkable, they care that the experience is always good.

title: The best trip
text: I loved the experience with this tour company! The guides were very knowledgeable and passionate, and the itinerary was perfectly organized. Security and attention to detail were impressive. Highly recommended!ü§©ü•≥

title: Excellent
text: It was a great experience and phenomenal, beautiful and I would repeat it again for the service of JCP tours, thanks for the experience

title: Hermoso Tours
text: Super recommended, excellent service , all very cute waiting to make your Tours the best company ..............‚ò∫Ô∏è

title: Excellent tour
text: Very good tour, very complete, the guide Juana very friendly with us, explained everything very well and was a very complete and pleasant experience

title: Excellent
text: Loved the service, spectacular places, very comfortable mobility and very friendly guide, if you would repeat it again!

title: Amazing.
text: Very good service, I found excellent, the places are very nice, I recommend the agency if you want to know Peru üëå

title: Buen City tour
text: Good option if you don't know and you don't have how to move in lime to have an overview of the area.... they were very friendly and picked us up on the way as we didn't reach the schedule of the game.... it leaves from miraflores , saint isidro passes by the square of arms and saint martin square to know the historical center of lime, where the guide goes down with the group to tell the story, then continues to the church where the catacombs are. Photos are not allowed but it is an interesting place to visit. A good walk!! All very friendly

title: Oh, bad.  Use Metro
text: Oh, bad. Use the subway. Chaotic traffic. Very hot. Smell of diesel from the bus all the time. I'll never go again.  A bad idea

title: Terrible customer service
text: They mistreated us, the lady who attended the point treated us with anger, she put on headphones to not give us information. He spoke badly to us, we told him that he shouldn't treat us like that, and he got up and came too close to me. HORROR. He gave us bad information and we lost 2 hours of our day. :(Very sad to be treated like this on vacation.

title: Zero-eight-fifteen-tourist tour
text: The departure was on time, and the journey to the center was also quite quick, with explanations in Spanish and English. From the center, we continued on foot. At the Plaza Mayor, we had to listen to very long and detailed explanations in both languages, standing and in the blazing sun. Hardly anyone was listening, but they droned on. Then we went on to the catacombs and then to a souvenir shop, where we could try and buy Pisco. On to the bus stop, then we stood in the blazing sun for almost half an hour and the bus didn't leave. All buses had a shade roof - except this one. It wasn't that spectacular, you could have taken public transport there too.

title: A good first tour to explore Lima
text: We took this tour on our first day in Lima. The stop was located 500 meters from our hotel, which certainly determined our decision. They have 2 tour start times at 11 and 14:30, we originally booked for 11 but then moved to 14:30. The guide was very informative and conducted the tour perfectly in 2 languages, which was very convenient. He paid time and attention to everyone, but there were only 12 of us for the whole bus. I especially liked the main square and the Catacombs and the pisco tasting at the very end of the tour.

title: Not a good experience
text: Although our tour guide spoke English and Spanish, her Spanish explanations were much longer and for the English part she just read aloud the tourist signs around the Basilica. She also only aimed the tour at a few specific people and ignored everybody else. It just didn't feel worth it to have the tour, even though I spoke both Spanish and English, because she didn't put much effort in.She also was unable to answer most follow-up questions we had about the things she was showing us- her main reply was that we should research it ourselves.

title: Good tour for the price
text: We took a late afternoon tour, which we started and ended at their office across from the Mercado Indio in Miraflores. We were tired from a busy day of touring and enjoyed a very pleasant tour from the upper deck of the bus. There were no stops on this afternoon tour and the narration was in Spanish and English . It can be a little chilly in Lima so bring an extra layer to wrap up in. It didn't costs all that much and we felt that it was a good value. We definitely got to see some areas that we could never have covered on foot.

title: Nice city overview on a go
text: An excellent service and timing and guide was very helpful and very organized. This is a convenient way to see the sites without having to worry about a potentially expensive tour. The guide explained the sites in both English and Spanish. Entrance fees were included in the tickets which was nice. We did not have in the tour San Francisco and the catacombs as of pandemic situation and even Plaza de Armas of Lima was closed but our Guide did a great job to let us in and show around. There are 4 tours a day 2h (30 Soles) and 3 h (60 Soles) tours. I took 3h Tour at 10:30am for 60 Soles on the bus and I was lucky to see San Isidro, City Downtown, Miraflores, Lince, Barranco, Chorrillos and a part of Costa Verde (from Miraflores to Chorrillos).  It was a great experience comparison to 85 dollar tour I had before and I got only walking tour in the city downtown and Magic Water Circuit (15 minutes show and walk inside the fountain park and entrance costs 5 Soles).

title: Not good experience
text: Everything needs to be improved starting from issue of tickets, I was boarded with no ticket just a sticker, the description during the trip was poor without any useful information and/or reference to the history of place visited, but the most was at second stop the guide gave 6 mins !! for pictures and suddenly he left leaving on the square of church 3 passengers, he collect some other PAx and left.We were able to catch one rep of the company and he admit is quite common situation, the phone call to head office resulted that we were the guilty and the tour is not private so go back by yourself to hotel. If you are very patient and open to be left in the street .....you can enjoy

title: Very nice tour around Lima
text: Includes tour of the Cathedral of Lima. Pick up and drop off by Kennedy Park. Our tour guide, Janet, was very nice. Tour in Spanish then in English.

title: AN UNFORGETTABLE EXPERIENCE!
text: You have to believe me! YOU HAVE TO TAKE THIS EXPERIENCE... I am passionate about soccer, but our guide Carlo... LOVES SOCCER MORE THAN I DO. He told us the entire history of Peruvian soccer, who the best teams are... very attentive! We entered a beautiful stadium, full of local people. I learned a lot about their traditions and culture. If you want to do something unusual, safely, and with the best company! TAKE THIS EXPERIENCE! Thanks Carlo!

title: Football lovers don't think about it anymore!
text: The experience is very complete and above all safe. Carlo is an excellent companion who not only knows very well about the subject but his kindness and willingness to make you spend a great experience are notorious from a distance! Living the experience with Peruvian fans is crazy! I don't know they'll want to lose it.

title: Very well organized, fun and unique experience!
text: Each time I travel, I always like to assist to football games and during my visit in Lima was not the exception. I found this company (the only one actually working) and since I contact them on the first message, they were very friendly and explain very carefully the whole activity, so i didn't have any doubt on booking the experience.It was an amazing choice, my guide was Carlo, he is very friendly and deeply involver with peruvian football and in culture in general. He shared lot of histories about the local league, national team and how its life in Peru.That day we saw Universitario's game and was incredible, more than 50k people and energy was insane! Now I considere myself a fan from Universitario.Totally reccommended, don't doubt on booking the experience and if you have Carlo as your guide, you will enjoy it a lot and he will share also his passion for Universitario (his team).

t: Great experience! It's the first time I've done such a tour, and it exceeded my expectations. Carlo is a great Guide, very attentive, friendly and gives the precise recommendations, not only about football, but also to know the city. I really recommend it!

title: A fun and worthwhile experience!!!
text: Loved the experience! Carlo explained us about Peruvian football, gave us tips to buy the team shirt and had good ideas and routes to avoid traffic. The energy you live in the stadium is crazy, it was fun to share it also with people from other countries, I recommend this tour!!

title: Amazing
text: Carlo was amazing and very profesional. Great experience. Everyone should try it and enjoy the tour even the football is not your cup of tea

title: Safe and exciting!
text: It is an incredible experience, the managers always cared about safety, we could talk about the history of the football team and we spent ch√©vere drinking a beer before the game, then seeing how the passion of fans is lived is something else, super recommended.

title: First experience in a stadium
text: It was my first experience going on a football tour and I really don‚Äôt regret anything, I felt super safe and Carlo as Guide is A1, not only talks about football issues but also about places to go and what you can enjoy being in Lima. I recommend it 1000%

title: An unforgettable experience
text: A good experience, we definitely recommend it 100%, the guides are very friendly and have good care.

title: Well worth it. A must do in Lima!
text: We thoroughly enjoyed our time with Lima VIP tours. We did the $35 city tour and we were impressed with the tour and the time we were given at each stop. We were especially impressed with the knowledge and hospitality of our guide, Jasmine! Highly recommend this tour!!

title: Great Experience - Ask for Brian as a guide!
text: The day was amazing - could not recommend more and capped off by a thrilling experience on dune buggy‚Äôs in the sand dunes! Brian, our guide, was excellent! He is extremely kind, attentive, and showed us to all our stops efficiently and on time. When booking this trip, make sure you ask for Brian!

title: no ticket
text: Did not receive ticket or confirmation from tour group. Need money refunded to credit card Please reply Thank you thank you thank you

title: Best guide ever!
text: Excellent tour with Edgar and Pepe! We learned so much about Lima and it‚Äôs history! They were super friendly, helpful and nice! We got lucky and got an excellent private tour of downtown with an additional water fountains circuit tour. Amazing!! 5 star service, friendliness and city!! Gracias Edgar and Pepe You were the best ever!! Guillermo and Adriana Santana

title: Custom lime
text: During my recent visit to Lima, I was fortunate to have the services of Danilo (and Pedro his driver) and I cannot recommend it enough!! From the moment we started the tour, it became clear that we were in the hands of a passionate and deeply knowledgeable Pro from Lima and his country. Danilo allowed us to get to know the key sites of the historic center, sharing anecdotes and data and even recipes! The itinerary was perfectly organized to eat churros, take our photos, visit the catacombs and adapt the tour to our interest.

title: VIP tours Rock Lima
text: Edgar was fabulous on our tour around Lima today. he is so full of knowledge of the history of the area. My Neice who was with us teaches Spanish in Los Angeles so he gave a dual lingo tour !! The wine tasting and many stops were just a highlight is this grand experience

title: Excellent Private tour with Excellent Guide
text: We booked this tour as a private tour which allowed us to customize the itinerary, such as stopping for coffee in the Barranco district. Our guide David was incredibly knowledgeable and told us about the city, but most importantly about his life in Lima, about the politics and about why it never rains. We were very happy that we booked this!

title: Wonderful Mini visual history tour of Limas best.
text: Excellent tour, Valeri our tour guide was excellent explaining the history and culture behind all of what we saw.

title: Lovely tour
text: A nice afternoon walking and chatting around Lima. We visited the Church of St Francis Catacombs, the main square, a pisco bar and Parque del Amor.Would definitely recommend this tour to a friend

title: Great tour!
text: Valeria was such a knowledgeable and fun tour guide. She took us around the attractions of the Lima area. Going over to the beautiful love park, the church and catacombs and then city square. Not only did she talk in depth about the history she made sure to make it relevant to us as well.

title: Caral pyramid ruins.
text: We had a great time seeing the ruins at Caral. Amazing history because they date back to 5000 years. It was over 2 and a half hours there, but for me, it was all worth it. Our guide did all he could to show us a good time. He even stopped and we had dinner at a very good restaurant by our request.

data: [{'review_id': '7a3f8b1', 'title': 'Private tour to Caral: the only way to go', 'text': "Caral is a recent (1994) archeological find that rewrote Peruvian history. It is the 2nd oldest city in the world! So while most tourists know about the Incas who were in their heyday at the time of the Spanish conquest (1500's), Caral was occupied in 3000 B.C. (5000 years ago!) If you are interested in archeology, then this is a fantastic site to see. The construction is stone, however no metal was used or found on the site. The pyramids are step-like and each terrace is built on top of a previous terrace, the same pattern that continues throughout Peru and Mexican ancient civilizations. The site (in a valley 20 miles from the ocean), the ruins, and the tour by local guides is very interesting. Once we arrived at Caral, we engaged and paid a local (national archheological service) guide to give us a 1.5 hour tour. The tour is very informative and I believe you are not allowed to go into the site without a guide. Be warned however that the guide may not speak Engish, which was the case for us. Luckily the excursion host, Carlos, speaks excellent English and could translate and also asked my questions to the local guide, etc.I heartily recommend Caral as an archeological must see site. There are several companies that can provide transportation to Caral. I recommend going with this company (Los Cazadunas) on a private tour with the company's owner, Carlos. This has several advantages. First, Carlos is the driver and host for the day. He is an amazing host. It's more than transportation out to an important archeological site. It's a very long drive and sharing that time with someone personable who is willing to share their experience about life in Peru and in general makes the time fly by. Carlos uses local eateries on the highways that as a tourist you would never go to. But once inside you realize this is where the Peruvians are going. At the breakfast stop there were 5 our busses stopped at the same place. At the lunch stop, the food was excellent and the parking lot full compared to nearby places that were empty. As a tourist, I have a limited time  but want to learn about the people, history, food, and life in Peru in a short time. This is a great way. Because the trip is private the itinerary is very flexible. Earlier I had mentioned that I was interested in birds, so we had planned to go to Caral and then to Lomas de Lachay, which he recommended because it was an unusual inland geographical place that had green vegetation in the middle of the desert due to altitude and fog. Already this was a tailored second destination on a trip to Caral (184 km north of Lima) compared to other companies with set itineraries. But while we were at Caral, I learned about a second site called Vichama that was occupied at 1500 BC but at which remarkable 3D sculptural art had been found. Carlos said, let's go there instead and we did.  We also hired a local guide at Vichama (mandatory at all national archeological sites).  Finally, I will point out an extremely important advantage of this company. It is not much more expensive than the competition but Los Cazadunas will give you a very reasonable price for a solo traveler and guarantee that the tour will run with just one person. The other companies reserve the right to cancel if the minimum number of passengers does not book or you perhaps can fool the system by ordering two seats. For a solo traveler this is a huge advantage since you don't want to be disappointed at the last minute having your tour cancelled.I had a really great time on my day out with Carlos to see Caral and Vichama archeological sites with private transportation and personalized itinerary. We also had two very nice meals (breakfast and lunch).. The breakfast is included. Lunch is not included but very reasonable.Due to the pricing, there is NO additional cost to taking a private tour with Los Cazadunas compared to taking a group tour with other companies that might cancel at the last minute.  I enjoyed my day out to Caral and recommend it to others.", 'rating': 5, 'date_original': 'Sep 2024 ‚Ä¢ Solo', 'year': 2024, 'month': 'September', 'visit_category': 'Solo', 'language': 'en', 'sentiment': {'overall': 'positive', 'score': 0.92}, 'tokens_count': 367, 'keywords': ['caral', 'carlos', 'archeological', 'site', 'tour', 'private', 'guide', 'peru', 'los cazadunas', 'vichama']}]

The arrangement was great thanks to the organizer Lucia. The only hard part was that the driver didn't understand English.About the activities, the animals on Ballestas were not as many as I expected. The buggy ride in Huacachina was a great fun.

title: It's worth it, there's no breakfast coffee
text: It's a hard day. We only had 10min in Huacachina, the time is all spent on the buggies. Make sure there is no coffee for breakfast. They make a stop and make you buy the hot coffee and only then explain that only snacks are included (and it wasn't Lays or brands mentioned in the ad, it was a very simple lunch box). The guide had a "low energy," unhappy, but knew how to give useful information. But the oasis experience is cool and worth it, as well as seeing the animals on the island.

title: Services not included, nor detailed, misleading advertising.
text: $18 extra compared to other tours for a bottle of water and a juice from children. FALSE PROMOTION OF ALL INCLUSIVE , obviously in the trip advisor description does not appear that lunch is not included, nor that sand boarding is for lying down. They are literally the same services from other agencies, I talked to people on the tour, this reseller charges extra for services he does not offer.To top it off, snacks deliver everything to you in the second part, after you have already paid for our breakfast. All this you find out in an email, after you have already made the payment leaving you little time to cancel and try to schedule another service because of the urgency of the holiday times.You can see that the positive feedback is from the experience, which is very worthwhile, but not from the reseller agency (not to be confused with transportation agency).Avoid spending part of your day fighting with this agency in the middle of your family day.

Got to see some penguins yay, but note sealions tend to be there in summer though we did see one or two! Lunch and pisco/wine tasting was nice, and dune-buggying and sandboarding was very fun!All in all, a great day out, and a good way to fit these places outside the city of Liman in one day.
