title: Beautiful walk through the historic center of Lima
text: Excellent tour! Our guide Mart√≠n was extremely kind and showed a lot of knowledge about the places visited. The driver Jos√© was also very attentive and the advice provided by Nico via what‚Äôs app was perfect! I highly recommend it!

title: Great tour of Lima!
text: This tour was absolutely amazing! This is in large part due to Nico the tour guide. I had a million questions and Nico was very knowledgable and friendly throughout the tour. We started the tour in a nice, clean and air conditioned vehicle that was driven by an excellent driver; Oscar. We started the tour to the temple of Pachamac were we saw Alpacas (not always guaranteed!) and were able to learn a lot about Peru's pre-colonial history and culture. Nico cares a lot about his profession and is extremely knowledgeable of all the sites we visited. Then, we stopped at a nice spot in Barranco for a meal. Nico gave us excellent reccomendations and we loved our meals. We also saw a lot of Barranco's culture through historic landmarks and art; something we passed by all the time and had no idea of the importance until our knowledgeable guide explained this to us. Afterwards, we went to the old city center to visit the catacombs and were able to get a very nice tour of the catacombs which were rich with history. Finally, finishing off the tour we got to see the water-circuit tour in Miraflores. This was well worth the money and with Nico as your guide youre in the best hands. This tour and in particular in Nico made our trip to Peru that much better. Would highly recommend 11/10!

title: Guide was really good
text: It ended up only be two of us - benefits of a private tour having the guide all to ourselves. Would definitely book and recommend this tour. Thanks Geiner.

title: Fun and Informative Tour of Lima
text: Great company and tour of the city. The guide was very knowledgeable and would highly recommend. In fact I did recommend to some other tourists while visiting Cusco.

title: Great guided walk learning about past & present Lima
text: This tour was a wonderful experience with Nicolas. I learned so much on my first day in Lima because of all of his knowledge on history & architecture. It was a great walk through some beautiful character filled streets in downtown as well as some stops to along the way to downtown.

title: Highly recommended city tour
text: Nicol√°s was an amazing tour guide and exceeded all our expectations. He offers tours in Spanish and English. He was very friendly, accommodating, and knowledgeable in not only the specific areas we visited but also the broader history of Peru. We felt extremely safe throughout the tour and logistically everything went smoothly. He shared lots of tips and plenty of recommendations (local cuisine, restaurants, and bars) for us to enjoy the rest of our trip in Lima. Thank you, Nicol√°s for sharing a piece of your culture with us!

title: Avoid This Tour ‚Äì Disappointing and Misleading Experience
text: I‚Äôm not sure how this tour has such high ratings because our experience was really disappointing. This was the worst tour that we had in Peru, and possibly the worst tour we‚Äôve ever been on. As a travel advisor with clients heading to Peru, I had high hopes for this tour to be an exciting part of their itinerary, but I cannot, in good conscience, recommend it to anyone.We booked this expecting a private experience, so imagine our surprise when we were picked up in a bus that went on to pick up ten other passengers. This set the tone for a day that didn‚Äôt live up to our expectations.Our tour guide primarily spoke in Spanish, to the point where we thought that we accidentally booked the wrong tour. Another American couple pointed out the language barrier to our guide, so she started to provide a short sentence or two in English. It seemed to be an inconvenience for her, and we felt like there was little effort made to make us feel comfortable and included. We're not the type of travelers who expect everyone to speak our language, but we do expect it when that‚Äôs what the tour advertises. It would‚Äôve been more accurate if the listing stated that the tour is primarily in Spanish, but the guide might speak a little English for you.Then, every single stop on the tour fell short of our expectations.Paracas was a decrepit, run-down coastal town, and the Ballestas Islands boat tour was underwhelming. The guide on the boat did at least attempt to provide some translations, but it was entirely unintelligible, so don‚Äôt expect the "bilingual" support that is promised here either. On a positive note, we did spot some penguins, birds, and sea lions, and the islands themselves were picturesque. After the tour, our guide took us to a merchant where we attempted to buy a container of plantain chips. Instead, the vendor shoved multiple containers of chips, cookies, and sweets into a bag and demanded payment from us. Sure, we could have refused, but we didn‚Äôt want to cause a scene over $25 that we didn‚Äôt want to spend, but it definitely felt like a scam.Next, we visited a pisco vineyard for lunch and tastings. At lunch, we received a limited menu and were confused when we looked up and saw that all the other guests had a full menu with more options. We wondered if maybe we had booked a different option that included lunch and could choose from a smaller menu? No one explained it to us, but it was another example of how we felt like we were receiving a lesser experience. The vineyard tour guide was the only one to provide information in both Spanish and English, so this was one of the better parts of the day since we at least felt acknowledged.Finally, we arrived at Huacachina. We did enjoy the beautiful oasis and dune buggy ride in the desert, however, the sandboarding was another major disappointment. We were hoping that we could stand while boarding, but we could only lie on the boards and slide down on our stomachs. This activity was supposed to be the highlight of our day because it was the main reason we booked the tour, so we ended the day feeling let down by the tour overall. Lastly, the day was supposed to conclude by watching the sunset at the lagoon, but we left in the afternoon and missed that experience entirely.So overall, our experience with this tour was deeply disappointing. It did not live up to the promises of a private and bilingual experience, and every stop left much to be desired. The tour guide's poor attitude and lack of engagement was frustrating. While we really wanted to support a small business, we probably would‚Äôve enjoyed a better experience with a larger group and more reputable tour operator. This was a really long day that felt like a waste of valuable time during our vacation.

title: The best guide in Lima
text: Excellent guide, his energy is contagious, always willing to clarify all doubts. He has a lot of knowledge of the history of Peru, so the experience is much more enriching.100% recommended.

title: An expensive Scam. Avoid this company.
text: Collectively my friends and I spent $520 USD on this tour. The guide removes a large chunk of the itenaryWe were supposed to have 2 hours on a boat on ballestas islands to see the animals. The Harbour had been closed since the day prior. The company and the guide knew this and intentionally did not tell us until we arrived in Paracas. Did not give us an opportunity to change the date.Instead we were taken to a tiny beach for 30 minutes but no one had swimwear because it was never advised to us to pack it, even though they knew we would not get to the islands and may go here instead.The viator booking advertises that we will finish in huacacina with sand buggy & sunset.This did not happen. Instead we went to huacacina for 1 hour at lunch time. 1 hour of san buddy & boarding.Then we went to lunch at 3pm because the tour guide wanted to get food and alcohol tasting and go home quickly. When I asked him about sunset and the itenary on viator, he said they never do the sunset and it was better to spend time eating and drinking amd get home fastThe guide Tony had no interest in following the promised itinerary or providing value, he wanted to rush home and quickly get through everything.In paracas I asked him to stop at some flamingos that we saw and he did not. We paid to see animals on the islands and the 1 animal we do see he would not stop at.When I asked him why we were not sticking to the itenary he was rude and  passive aggressive about it and told me it  was better to spend longer eating and drinking, saying they did not promise sunset and never do it.They itenary that was promised was not delivered.Book with a reliable company Like Peru Hop. This was the most expensive way to see huacacina and the ballestas and all we got was 1 hour in Huacacaina.

title: BEST OF BESTS!!! Awesome guide FUN adventure NEW FRIENDS!!
text: Honestly this has been one of the best experiences I‚Äôve had in my life! Apart from the amazing views that this tour offered it was the amazing people I met. Made friends from Colombia, Costa Rica, Canad√° and even from my own country, Mexico! Jes√∫s Gabriel was such a cool guy, friendly and very outgoing, his professionalism and his knowledge made this trip interesting! I could say that I also made really good friends with him. If you have the chance to book this trip do it!!!!

title: The best tour
text: Jesus is the best and the places we went are speechless. Worth every minute! This tour is a must!!!!

title: An intense day visiting beauties of Peru
text: We left early (5 am) to get to Paracas first, with a pit stop to get a delicious breakfast (pan con chicharrones highly recommended). After a few hours, we got to Paracas, where a boat tour took us to visit el Candelabro de Paracas as well the local fauna on the nearby islands. We were lucky enough to see plenty of pelicans, cormorants and see lions, as well and some penguins. Really gorgeous. We then moved to Ica, where we had lunch in a restaurant and had a Pisco tasting, that does cheer you up. We lastly got to Huacachina, where some dune buggies drove us up and down the sand dunes and dropped us to do some sand boarding. We then got back to huacachina, where we rested a few minutes for pictures of the oasis as the sun was setting, fantastic view.Highly recommended day, also thanks to Jesus, who was able to entertain us during the day as well as guide us and inform us about everything surrounding us.

title: Excellent experience
text: Jesus was an excellent guide! It was super neat, fun and professional. He was always attentive to everyone/everything and was an excellent photographer too. Excellent guide, recommended. He showed a lot of knowledge during the tour and we learned a lot.

title: Unique and fun experience!
text: Lots of fun from start to finish! Jesus and his team were very knowledgeable and helpful! Highly recommended

title: Best Day in Peru!
text: This tour with Miguel was SO FUN and was truly my most fun day in Peru (and I did a lot in a week!) The day continues to get better with increasing pleasant surprises. It's really cool to continue to learn more about the culture of different areas in Peru. Miguel made sure everyone had a fun time and that we were able to capture special pictures and videos. Out of all the tour options for Paracas and Huacachina Oasis, pick this tour!

title: Greatest time ever!!!!
text: I have to say it was an amazing experience. I was extremely and nicely surprised from start to end‚Ä¶ It exceeded my expectations of the adventure.Nilo made the journey unforgettable by his knowledge, his up bit of personality, his passion for what he does and great patience!Oh and the lunch + Pico sour demo at this gorgeous hidden gem was a plus, again I didn‚Äôt expect such a treatüëçüëçüëç‚ù§Ô∏èI will highly recommend Lima Experience to anyone who wants to have one of the best experience in Peru.At the dunes sand of Huacachina we had so much fun from laughter after laughter it felt like going back to childhood üòùThank you again for an an amazing day yesterday ü§©

title: Amazing
text: I was terrified to do this as im scared of heights.. HOWEVER, it was absolutely AMAZING! I was made to feel so comfortable, and reassured about how the flight would be. Once up in the air, I felt sturdy and secure. The view was fantastic, the flight was so smooth, and the landing was great too, not bumpy at all. I would 100% recommend these guys, they were the best for sure. The video we received afterwards was also amazing, a moment in life that will always be with us, and one we can share with family and friends when we get home. Muchas Gracias amigos!

title: Highly recommended
text: Highly recommended. Ask for Christine. Very helpful, patient, and informative, with care for safety. Excellent customer service. Thank you all.

title: Fun
text: Parapente is the word used for both, but there's a big difference between paraTRIKES (which have an engine/propeller), and paraGLIDERS, which rely on adequate wind conditions (that type is available along the coast in Miraflores, near Love Park). At this venue (about a 20 minute drive north of Miraflores, down by the sea edge, near a huge skate park - which the driver had a hard time finding), only paratrikes are offered. It's a fun ride (about 15 minutes) with great views, and the staff are very nice (if they offer to lend you a jacket, take it, because it can be very cold up in the air)!

title: A bucket list check off complete
text: This by far was one of the best experiences. It has been on my bucket list for years and now it's checked off. It was calm and beautiful even for someone like me who's scared of hieghts. My son and I had the best time. I would most definitely do this again. They put you at ease. Make sure to dress for it because it's a big chilly in the air.

This experience was great and super safe. Admittedly, I was pretty nervous about doing paratriking but the professionalism of the staff immediately put me at ease. This company has existed for over 30 years and they are the experts -- Cristina (co-owner) was super responsive and organized. They were able to give us an earlier appointment time since we arrived a little early. The pilot was very well-trained, calm. All I had to do was sit back and enjoy the experience! We flew for about 11 minutes and it was a serene experience to enjoy the views of Lima and the ocean. Highly recommend this experience, excellent price for the quality of the experience. Also, the GoPro video was a really nice touch.

title: What a view!
text: Very fun activity, what a beautiful view of the Costa Verde you get while paratriking! The Aeroxtreme team was very nice and professional, safety was also great!

title: Awesome experience in Lkma
text: Christina js super knowledgeable and helpful. They have 33 years of paragliding and the whole experience is very smooth:) recommend everyone to come for a glance of lima

title: Flying over Lima
text: So fun! Highly recommended! They took good care is us and provided a video of the experience. Truly a memorable experience. Based on the time of year, we used motorized carts not the traditional paragliding.

title: Must do
text: They made me feel so comfortable especially being that I was kind of scared at first. Sent video in a timely manner and were very professional. This is definitely a must do activity to do when coming to Lima !

title: Highly recommended!
text: An amazing experience I loved because it gave me confidence that the instructor was a pilot and a family of pilots, a very nice flight with its views and a very personalized attention Cristina thank you very much hope to come back soon.

title: Bikes and birds!
text: I love to bike,  and when i found out about this tour, I was super excited, cuz I also love birds!. And it lived up to the expectations, we rode down to pantanos de villa , we saw so many birds even on the way there that I hadn't noticed  Just walking through the city. We went on a cute little boat ride in the marshy area, and then we rode out to the ocean and saw this amazing lagoon filled with amazing birds! Highly recommend! Lima and the area are super flat also so it was really easy biking.

title: Fun and Informative Outing
text: Fully enjoyed biking through Miraflores, Barranco and Chorriillos although traffic can be a little crazy in the city.  My friend and I would not have wanted to rent bikes on our own. Fortunatley, our guides made it possible to navigate the city streets without issue. Happy to have selected this particular bike tour because the best part of the day was going to the Wildlife Refuge. We took a boat ride that introduced us to a variety of species of birds that we had never seen before. Our guide was very knowledgable and had an eagle eye for spotting wildlife.

title: Great option for sustainable tourism in Peru!
text: ANP is a great option to get to know the protected natural areas in and around Lima. I have been living in Lima for several years, and I have taken several trips with them!ANP always takes care of everything. For the bike trips, they provided safety protocol, safety equipment, snacks, water, helmets, binoculars. The owner, Milagros, and all of the tour guides are very knowledgeable about wildlife and natural spaces. I really enjoy seeing Lima through their eyes.I also took their weekend trip to Huancaya with my family a few years ago, and it was magical. The landscapes were breathtaking. It was an unforgettable off-the-beaten path experience. ANP will always provide you with a unique, thoughtful, and meaningful experience. Highly recommended!

title: You can see much more of Lima from a bike than you can from a car
text: My daughter and I did a bike tour with ANP Travel during my recent visit to Peru. The guides paid a lot of attention to safety protocol. Before we began, they taught us the hand signals they would be using during the ride. The route was well-paced, with time for rest and sight-seeing. I was impressed with the guide's knowledge about the city as well. He shared the history of the origin of Love Park in Miraflores and used bird calls and shared interesting facts about the different species that we saw in the Olive Grove. The guide was bilingual and his English was very clear.

title: An unforgettable day!
text: It was an amazing day, we woke up early and went to see the Ballestas Islands, where we saw penguins and whales... The wind is strong, so go shaken. Then we went to the national park of Buggy and Quadriciclo, we knew the Red Beach and picturesque landscapes! Finishing the day in Huacachina in a 4x4 surfing in the desert dunes... And with a beautiful sunset. I recommend this tour to everyone, it was a very pleasant surprise!

title: Full day Paracas Huacachina

title: Amazing experienceüíïüáµüá™
text: Spectacular tour!! Mega amazing!!! We have a lot of fun!! From Paracas , Islas Ballestas until Huacachina desert!! We totally recommended!! Our tour guide Gabby and our driver did an spectacular job!! Very organized  always keeping the group together! We love it!!!

title: The Ultimate Peru Adventure!
text: Absolutely loved this tour! The boat ride to the Ballestas Islands was incredible, with so many birds and sea lions. Then Huacachina was a dream‚Äîdune buggy rides and sandboarding were thrilling! The guides were professional and fun. If you're in Lima, don't miss this trip!

title: An Epic Full-Day Tour!
text: This was one of the best experiences ever! From the moment we left Lima, everything was perfect. The Ballestas Islands had so much wildlife, and the scenery was breathtaking. The Huacachina oasis was surreal, and the dune buggy ride was insane! Sandboarding was super fun. Perfectly organized tour!

title: Best Tour for Nature & Adventure Lovers
text: I was blown away by this tour! The Ballestas Islands were filled with marine life, and the boat ride was peaceful. Huacachina was even more incredible‚Äîracing up and down the dunes in a buggy was an adventure I‚Äôll never forget. Sandboarding was a blast! 10/10 experience!

title: A Day Full of Thrills & Beauty
text: An unforgettable day trip! The coastal views on the way to Paracas were gorgeous, and the Ballestas Islands were a wildlife lover‚Äôs dream. Huacachina was like stepping into another world‚Äîthe sand dunes were enormous! The buggy ride and sandboarding were pure fun. Highly recommended!

title: Incredible Wildlife & Desert Adventure
text: This tour gives you the best of both worlds! The boat ride to the Ballestas Islands was so peaceful, with stunning wildlife all around. The Huacachina desert was unreal‚Äîthe sand dunes were massive, and the buggy ride was crazy fun! Sandboarding was the perfect way to end the day. Loved every second!

title: Worth Every Penny!
text: Such an amazing experience from start to finish! The drive along the coast was scenic, and the Ballestas Islands were mesmerizing. Watching sea lions lazing on the rocks was a highlight! Sandboarding in Huacachina was thrilling, and the buggy ride gave us an adrenaline rush. Can‚Äôt recommend this tour enough!

title: A Perfect Mix of Nature & Adventure
text: This tour had everything‚Äîocean, wildlife, and thrilling desert adventure! The boat ride was peaceful, and seeing the sea lions and penguins was unforgettable. Then came the Huacachina oasis, where the buggy ride took our breath away. Sandboarding was challenging but fun! Definitely a top experience in Peru.

title: Breathtaking Views and Ultimate Fun!
text: If you're visiting Lima, this is a must-do! The Paracas National Reserve is stunning, and the marine wildlife was incredible. Our guide was knowledgeable and friendly, making the experience even better. Sandboarding in Huacachina was an absolute thrill, and the dune buggy ride was pure excitement. A fantastic adventure!

title: Unique experience of Amazonian art and culture
text: This was really a fantastic and unique experience.  It was lovely to meet the artists and be welcomed into their home. We learnt so much about the Shipibo and their culture, Mila gave a very thorough background and was very friendly and easy to talk to, not just on this but on many aspects of Peruvian life and culture.  Highly recommended.  5 stars.

title: Do this tour! Something different in Lima..
text: Visiting the shipibo community with Mila was the highlight of my time in Lima! Mila is clearly very passionate about what she does and truly cares about the communities and people that she works with. I spent a lovely morning with her learning about the history of the shipibo community, how they have adapted to living in the city now, and the deep meaning behind their traditional art, kene. Being invited into the home of one of the artisans, and learning directly from her was amazing, as well as hearing about her life and experiences! I also got to come home with a lovely piece of art to treasure, definitely recommend!

title: Moving and thoughtful
text: This was an absolutely wonderful experience from beginning to end. Mila is a great tour guide, she was generous with the information, friendly, punctual - great choice for us. She brought us to the community, which clearly knew her and had great dynamics, showed us around and then we went to one of the families for the workshop. What an absolute pleasure, to be welcome into their homes and witness their art, with explanations and with Shipibo stories and songs. It was a very, very moving experience. At the end, we could browse their art and purchase some, good way to also help the family directly and take souvenirs from a beautiful day. I can only recommend this, it will be both time and money well spent, and you won‚Äôt be unchanged at the end.

title: An amazing experience!
text: This visit to the community was an amazing experience! Mila taught all about the culture and history of the community, as well as the different plants used to make their art. Silvia welcomed is into her ho.e where she taught me how to paint their traditional designs. She is also a highly skilled embroiderer and bead worker. I loved her singing. The community was welcoming too!

title: Unmissable - the community is waiting for your visit ‚ù§Ô∏è
text: Such a wonderful experience! Everyone was so welcoming and excited to have me there as a guest- it was a really unique experience! I really enjoyed learning about the culture in such a hands on way. Silvia invited me into her home where I was able to see her works, meet her family (and cat!) and enjoy a morning of doing art together while Silvia sang her traditional songs. I'm really happy with my artwork, and the pieces I bought from Silvia and her sister to take home. (Make sure to bring your cash so you don't have any regrets about something you'd like to take home!)I had concerns about visiting such a poor part of Lima, as we are always reminded to be careful of our safety. However, I never once felt unsafe in Rimac, as the community was so excited to see that we were here to experience their culture and contribute to maintaining the artists careers. Many people greeted me, even in English, and it was such a nice feeling! I also had many curious children come to watch the art session, which I thought was too cute!! You won't find any other tourists here, so it's really a unique experience.Mila was also great! So helpful and communicative. She worked really hard to accommodate me and make sure I could get the best experience (such as helping me to sort out cash!). You can tell that the artists she works with have a significant amount of trust and respect for her, and she is really connected with the community at large. I was able to follow some mural artists on Instagram as she instantly knew who did each one, and they would all warmly greet her.A really ethical, unique, and enjoyable experience in Lima!

title: Another side of Lima/Peru
text: Really liked the experience. It gave insight into the Shipibo culture and art which I otherwise would not get. Mila took us to Wilma, Wilma is very hospitable and a great shipibo artist. A must do if in Lima if you ask me (and my wife)!

title: A wonderful and unique experience
text: This was the best tour that I've ever received, and that's coming from someone who's travelled to a lot of places. Mila and Wilma are very kind, warm-hearted, and will take care of you while you're with them. They are very knowledgeable, and will answer any questions that you may have about their culture as they graciously welcome you into their community, their home, their space. The atmosphere is beautiful, and you will get the opportunity to immerse yourself in the artistic traditions of a beautiful culture.Really, truly, a once-in-a-lifteime opportunity. If you're reading this comment and are considering this tour, take it as a sign that you should book it.

title: Make a new friend in Mila
text: My friend and I went to the Shipibo community and had a once in a lifetime experience. Mila made us feel safe and welcomed the entire time, and was extremely knowledgeable about the artwork and people of the community. She was a fantastic host, whose passion made the experience even better.

title: Unique and Unmissable experience
text: Amazing and unique experience in Lima. Mila was wonderful in all aspects of coordinating and guiding the tour to the Shipibo community. Our time with Wilma and her family was extremely interesting and gave a unique insight into life in this community. Highly recommended for all visitors to Lima looking for more off the beaten track & interactive tours in Lima

title: Best authentic tour in Lima
text: I was looking for an authentic experience in Lima that was unique and exploring new cultures. Meeting Wilma and David, learning about traditional kene art from the Shipbo community and creating our own designs in the workshop was incredible! I can‚Äôt rate this your highly enough. A must-do tour in Lima!!

title: 8 Day Peru Tour by Waman/Tourrador Adventues
text: We, a group of 11 from Colorado, had an awesome time in Peru with Waman Adventures / Tourradar. Our 8 day trip was planned around the Inca Sun Festival, including sight seeing, paragliding, cooking classes, buggy rides, sand boarding, swimming with Sea Lions, hiking Rainbow mountains and plenty of time in between to shop and relax. We covered all major attractions in Lima and Cusco. Our tour operators are local and the price is reasonable. Hotels were decent and transports were comfortable. Overall, the service was great. We highly recommend this tour.Luz Lucero. Our concierge Luz and I planned this trip 3 months ago. Our group of 11 with various ages, abilities, interests, food choices is a tough group. Luz was very patient, caring and accommodated changes in itinerary several times. When a hotel messed up our reservations she jumped in and fixed it.We love you, Luz.Wilbert. Our guide in Cusco, Machu Picchu, Rainbow mountain and nearby attractions is awesome. He is local, knowledgeable, speaks good English and has the skills to herd our group. When some of us needed help to reach Rainbow summit Wilbert climbed down and helped us. Thank you, Billy.Jimmy. Our driver for most of the time is courteous with a smile.

title: A honeymoon full of adventure
text: Before returning to our reality we are left with a grateful heart for all the adventure that the agency gave us in Peru. They made our honeymoon a special and unforgettable one. Guides 10/10 Transfers 10/10 punctuality and friendliness Activities 10/10 Excursions 10/10

title: Very kind people to travel through/with
text: The tour company was so nice and accommodating and I highly recommend booking with them. We added things to the 8-day tour and they organized all the additions and customizations without issue.

title: A 10/10 holiday!!!
text: 10/10! If you want to spend a well-deserved vacation, you ask that they take care of EVERYTHING! I literally left my brain at home and Miracles gave us a schedule with hours, days and tickets. Grateful for One of Top-rated Trips in My Life!

title: Tremendous Experience üåüüåüüåüüåüüåü
text: I definitely give 5 stars to Peru Friendly because the vacation plan ran as it is. Miracles and their very Pro, responsible and educated team. I recommend them 100% ‚úÖ

title: Review
text: Very diligent, responsible and always attentive to their groups. They created a unique experience. I would re-engage your services in the future.

title: The best agency in Peru
text: Excellent service from the first moment to the end. An agency that covers the smallest detail to make your vacation perfect!!! 200% recommended

title: You must visit Cusco, it is an unforgettable experience.
text: The hospitality, kindness and respect for the traveler is incredible. Don Pedro, a person with a lot of contagious joy. The incredible views, the super hotels. Marcos, the Cusco guide, a person with a lot of knowledge in every sense of the word.

title: Dream fulfillers
text: We are extremely pleased with the service provided by Per√∫ Friendly, they gave us everything promised and more. They work with excellent precision, everything in its time and place. As the name indicates, you feel like you are with friends. Kindness, honesty and responsibility are some of its great values. 100% recommended. FB: Lucia Coto CR

title: ÈùûÂ∏∏Ê£íÁöÑÊóÖÈÅäÁ∂ìÈ©ó
text: If you want to travel to Peru, look for PERU FRIENDLY. The itinerary is well arranged, the service is enthusiastic and considerate, and it is worth recommending to everyone.  This is my first time traveling to Peru on my own, so I entrusted PERU FRIENDLY with my Peruvian itinerary. The entire 19-day trip was smooth and rich. There was no need to worry at all. If you have any questions, you can get help right away. Answer, it is really a safe and pleasant experience.  I love you PERU FRIENDLYüíñ

title: Busy streets, the ‚Äúreal Lima‚Äù?
text: Safe, interesting: a good view, a bit of clothes shopping, a good walk around. Interesting, busy, noisy and easy. If you‚Äôve travelled in Asia you‚Äôll feel right at home!

title: Yoced was wonderful. He was engaging and informative. I highly recommend both the guide and the tour!
text: Yoced was wonderful. He was engaging, informative and made history fun! I highly recommend both the guide and the tour!

title: Excellent fun educational art, culture, history walking tour of Barranco
text: Our walking tour of Barranco with guide Yoced was superb; it became a private tour as we were the only ones signed up. He told interesting stories about the history of Barranco, its longtime generous community spirit, e.g., programs held at the library and its plaza, as well as its devastation by Chilean forces. Yoced also helped us appreciate the beautiful and creative street murals by directing our attention to specific features in the paintings and explaining the artists' intentions. He educated and inspired us so much that we bought a print and t-shirt at the Jade Rivera gallery. Finally, he took a fun video of our crossing the Bridge of Sighs, which turned out to be easy for us even though we're seniors, because of our yoga breathing. Top marks for Yoced and Lima Experience!

title: Gustavo will give you the lowdown!
text: We loved learning all about the history of Barranco (as well as wider history of Lima and Peru) during the tour. Our guide Gustavo was very friendly, and able to answer all our questions. There was so much context to some of the street art that we never would have known from walking through by ourselves, so it was great to have a guide as knowledgeable as Gustavo! He also took some lovely photos of us at key spots.I'd highly recommend this tour!

title: We even went to the Larco Museum, very excellent, he explained how the different societies evolved and finally to Inca.
text: Joseph (Yoced) did a wonderful job, very knowledgeable about the area, he had a ‚Äúlock‚Äù for us at the Bridge of sighs, nice gesture.

title: Excellent tour with Yoced
text: I had the pleasure of taking a one-person tour of Barranco with Yoced. I had signed up for a group tour but I was the only one who showed. I speak both English and Spanish so he offered to do the tour in either and I wanted some Spanish practice anyway so we had a lovely conversation walking through the murals of the Barranco district. He also gave me a great restaurant suggestion for lunch. Highly recommend

title: Colorful Barranco Walking Tour is a hit with us.
text: Joseph was our guide to a small group walking tour of Street Art in the Barranco district. It was great to have Joseph explain the history and significance of many of the colorful street murals. We especially loved the work of artist, Jade Rivera. It‚Äôs amazing that simply naming a bridge, the Bridge of Sighs, you can give it a romantic and creative character. We are professional musicians and my sister is a visual artist. We were happy to visit a district that honors and respects artists for the contributions that they make to society.

title: See art but also learn the context, back story, and history.
text: Really enjoyed today's tour with Arturo. He provided so much insight and history into what we saw. For example he explained the Jade Rivera mural (which is in 2 sections) that I would never had figured out on my own. Also helped to connect the dots of Peru history with Chile and Barranco's place in that history. Just gave the history and back story of everything that we saw. Talked a bit about his travels to other parts of Peru and life in general. Highly recommend!

Super interesting tour!  I felt like I learned so much in a short period of time. Not only did we discuss the history of Barranco and its murals, but I learned some new things about Lima‚Äòs history and history of Peru as well.  My tour guide was Giovana and it was just me and her on the tour!  She answered all my questions and she even gave me a recommendation for a Peruvian Chinese restaurant in the area that is supposed to be one of the best in town.  The restaurant turned out to be amazing!

title: Beautiful artwork and talented artist
text: Peru has some talented artists, there are painted street murals everywhere. Pictures don't do it justice. It's a great place to take a stroll with family. Kids. Or a partner. There's street vendors everywhere that sell ice cream, pastries, jewelry, clothes, souvenirs, and etc.

title: The Enterprise made the trip not pleasant
text: The experience with this tour left much to be desired. My boyfriend and my friend Julia made the reservation months in advance, even in April, choosing a tour with a guide in Portuguese, just to facilitate our understanding during the trip. However, the organization has failed from the beginning. On the scheduled day (07/07/25), we followed at dawn to the meeting point indicated on the voucher, but there was no one from the Enterprise there. We tried to contact the Enterprise after we spent a while waiting and nothing from the bus, and they said they were going to send a taxi. We ended up being rushed into a taxi to reach the bus that was already going for the tour, that is, they had forgotten us. The problem is that when we got on the bus, we found that there was no guide in Portuguese, as contracted, and that the vehicle was in precarious conditions: dirty seats, toilet without hygiene and no cleaning throughout the journey, even after unpleasant incidents such as vomiting in the hallway. The smell worsened over time, making the journey uncomfortable. Another negative point was the end of the tour: there was no guidance on where we should go, and the guide simply left the group and said goodbye to us on the bus. They said they could not leave in a street that we didn't even know and not at the point that was marked to leave us. We had to locate ourselves on our own and order a shuttle to our accommodation, which was quite exhausting after such a long day, taking the fact that it was already 22hrs of the night on an untouched street in a city we did not know. In addition, we went through an extremely embarrassing situation: at one of the stops, the guide authorized us to use the bathroom and, therefore, we were the last to return to the bus. When we came back, he joked about the situation and encouraged the others to applaud us, joking unnecessarily. As we did not master Spanish, we did not immediately understand the reason for the reaction, which further increased the discomfort. The places we visit are beautiful that no doubt, but it is essential to hire a serious and responsible Enterprise, because the wrong choice can completely compromise the experience. Unfortunately, this Enterprise is not prepared to offer a quality Service. I do not recommend and would not hire again.

title: WE DON'T RECOMMEND THIS ENTERPRISE - Disorders with place of departure, guide and place of return. Unhealthy bus.
text: Unfortunately this tour was not a good experience for me and my friends. We made the reservation well in advance (we booked in April to travel in July). We hire a guide in Portuguese because we are Brazilians, and after the booking confirmation, we receive a voucher with instructions and the place of departure. At no time has the agency contacted us, neither through tripadvisor nor by phone.On the day of the tour 07/07/25 at 4am, we went to the meeting point informed in the voucher. When I got there, the Enterprise wasn't there. We wait until the agreed time at 4:30 and none of them show up. With that, I contacted them through tripadvisor and to our surprise, they had forgotten us. They sent an urgent taxi to pick us up to take us to the bus that was already following the journey. Arriving on the onibus, we had the surprise that our guide did not speak Portuguese, only Spanish, and the onibus would never pass at the meeting point informed on the voucher, nor on the return. The bus was in bad condition, with dirty seats and unhealthy bathroom. To help, a child vomited in the hallway during the journey and the place was not cleaned at all. With every hour passing, the bathroom became dirty and unhealthy as people continued to use it. At the end of the trip, I was only eager to open the bathroom door, because there was that strong smell of physiological needs. At the end of the trip, the guide did not give us isntrutions from where to stop, and went down at a metro stop. I had to open my google maps to know where we were and talk to the driver to decide the best place to go down. We were left at 22:00 on an avenue in Lima away from our airbnb, and we had to ask for Uber to go home.Besides all this, our communication with the guide was quite challenging, given that we are not fluent in Spanish and we had hired a guide in Portuguese. At one point we were late to arrive on the bus due to communication problems, and instead of the guide showing himself available and concerned to help us, he made a joke and made the whole onibus applaud us, causing social discomfort in me and my friends, because we did not understand the reason for the joke.The only things that were worth it, were the places we visited, really the beauty and nature of Peru are stunning.Anyway, we DO NOT RECOMMEND THIS Enterprise! They did not give us what we paid and caused us various discomforts during the day.

title: Unforgettable memories
text: The experience was amazing, appreciating the sea, the oasis and the desert are wonderful memories that are in my memory.

title: Unforgettable Journey
text: The contrast between the desert and the oasis is striking. Fully recommended for those looking for something different.

title: Very helpful guide
text: Very good service we liked the walk, we went with the family and everything was tidy the guide was very attentive with us, the departure was from Lima and that helped us quite well with the fair time we had in Peru

title: Excellent experience
text: We loved it, very nice everything. Very attentive guide. Ballesta Islands spectacular, pisco mmmmm I brought 4 bottles. Huacachina excellent, the sandpits, that much fun. Recommended 100%. At breakfast there is a richer bread.

title: Spectacular
text: The tour was incredible, it was a wonderful day, absolutely everything was perfect, the guide was always attentive to every detail

title: An unforgettable day
text: A wonderful day. Everything perfect. Incredible tours. The guide who accompanied us was very fun, attentive and kind. The tour company is great, they kept us informed the whole time. I will definitely do other tours with them.

title: We went to Ballestas Islands, we tasted local sweets and wines and finally we went to the Huacachin tubulars.
text: A very good tour, it's worth paying for it, I really enjoyed it with my friends, it's definitely worth recommending, I'm sure I'll do it again!!

title: Very friendly guides
text: It was an unforgettable adventure, the tour was very nice, the lady who helped me was very kind, and gave us the information we required throughout the tour.

title: Lima city tour
text: This tour was great. It started with collection from my hotel, a nice tour of the old & new city then a 90 minute guided walking tour , & finally delivered back to the start.It lasted nearly four hours which was tremendous value for money.My guide on the walking tour was Jhoselen. She was very well informed.

title: Unmissable circuit in the historic center
text: Excellent experience with Jose. Very well designed circuit. We breathe the best of Lima in one afternoon. Highly recommended üí™

title: Great tour to see the day to day Peruvian life
text: Great tour! Went with my family and got to see a lot of sights. Got to see the day to day of the Peruvian people. Would recommend!

title: Tour in Lima!!!
text: The walk was great. We walked through the historic center and every square a beautiful landscape. The architecture of Lima is spectacular.

title: Perfect welcome to Lima tour
text: Awesome tour, perfect blend of bus and walking.  Learned so much on our first Day in Lima highly recommend as great way to get acclimated to the city

title: Absolutely recommend the tour
text: Our guide made this a very pleasant and interesting tour with her knowledge of the Lima history, and clear and fluent english.

title: Unforgetable experience.
text: We enjoyed the views of Beautiful Miraflores and Lima sentrum. We liked that both start and end of the tour was in Larcomar, it gaves us the chance to go back to our hotel which it was close by. We are grateful to Melissa is a wonderful guide.

title: Lima historical centre tour
text: The guide was very knowlegable and we enjoyed visiting the San Domingo monastery and the historical centre. The felt modern and safe

title: Nice experience
text: I really enjoyed this tour . Amazing guide with lots of knowledge. Visited many places and interesting ones as well. Guide was helpful and bus ride was good

title: Good way to see the city.
text: The walking part of the tour was great and Melissa was a great tour guide, she had excellent English. The bus tour was nice just hard to hear sometimes, the tour even included a tasting of the regional liquors.

title: Interesting tour of Colonial Aristocracy with wonderful guide
text: Carlos, our guide and the owner of the tour co, was wonderful. He spoke perfect English and was knowledgeable, kind and funny.   The two houses we saw were interesting and a great way to dive deeper into the colonial lives of the aristocracy.  This was our second visit to Lima so we wanted to see something different than the typical intro to Lima tours and glad we did this tour.

title: Definitely an experience worth having.
text: Pick up in the morning was easy as we confirmed our hotel to be picked up at beforehand and the guides were in contact with us using WhatsApp. The guide was bilingual in Spanish and English and very engaging. Like all bus rides in Peru, it was very bumpy and quite a long ride. We had a coaster bus with a restroom for #1s only. We arrived at the boat launch to view penguins and sea lions (unfortunately we only saw 1 penguin, however there were a lot of sea lions, which was fine as wild animals don‚Äôt do appearances on queue). The boat ride is choppy so if you get sea sick take your tablets before getting on the boat. I would also advise bringing your rain jacket as some persons on our tour got pretty drenched from the water spray coming back to land. After the boat tour, Lunch was arranged while on the bus so it was ready as we arrived at the restaurant. The food wasn‚Äôt anything lavish but it was still very good with one protein meal and chicha/lemonade/water. Initially arriving at the oasis we only had a short time to grab snacks/water/facemasks and select our dinners (to be collected after) before meeting up to go on the dune buggies. We signed up for the addition hour to not feel rushed. The ride through the dunes was exciting with some thrilling steep hills. We stopped for sand boarding (3 hills that got gradually smaller and being required to carry your body boards to the next hill). We also stopped for 2 photo opps, one on top of the dunes and one later for the sunset photo. After the sunset photo we came back to the start point, had about 45-1hr of free time and to pick up/eat the pre-ordered dinners. After this it was a long bus ride back where the lights were turned off and being tired from a full day you can probably fall asleep. As a side note, all bus rides taken in Lima/Cusco are bumpy and sway back and forth pretty much the entire way - if you get car sick definitely take this into consideration.

title: Well organized full day trip
text: One of the best organised day tours I've been to. Luz explained every step of the tour clearly and precisely, repeating everything in the dedicated WhatsApp group. Separately paid extras were also clearly summarised including prices in dollars and soles. We enjoyed all activities and would recommend this company.

title: Scenic Pacific Coast Tour and Desert Extravaganza.
text: From start to end the day was perfect. Everything was very organized and easy to follow. Luz was fantastic, so kind, knowledgeable, and helpful. The day included a two hour boat, seeing animal sanctuary with seals, sea lions, and penguins. Went to a gorgeous winery for a fab meal, big portions for a reasonable price. Finally, the best part, dune bugging and sand boarding (on your stomach) in the desert. I got the 1 hour trip, because i was afraid of motion sickness (i got a little woozy on the boat), but the bugging and sliding were so fun, felt so safe, the perfect dateline rush! Fantastic day!!

title: The dunes were amazing!
text: Overall a very enjoyable trip!  Huachachina was my favourite part.  The dune buggies and sand boarding were very fun and I enjoyed them more than I expected to.  I also enjoyed tasting the different piscos.  The islands were impressive and very pretty but because of the time of year there wasn't a huge amount of animals on them.  The boat driver will turn around to show everyone the views but I think generally you get better views on the left hand side of the boat than the right.  The tour was run by Sol and Mar who were very friendly, informative and kept everything running smoothly!

title: The best of the best
text: If I would come back to Per√π I would choose this tour again with my closed eyes. A big thanks to Mar and Sol for being the guides that everyone wants. They created the best atmosphere for everyone even for me that i was travelling solo. Be ready to see amazing locations with penguins, sea lions and much more. Thanks to Miky to be so funny and loved his music taste on the boat! Thanks also to the star of the day Gonzalo, our buggy driver, he made our day. Pure adrenaline.The best tour ever with the best people.

title: Amazing
text: The Guides Mar and Dol were amazing. The trip went beyond my expectations. I did the 2 hr and buggies and sandoarding experience and it was the perfect ampunt of time.

title: Crazy!
text: Lovely experience in both Islas Ballestas and Huacachina with the dune buggy. Mar and Sol have been very great and sunny persons.

title: Truly an escape from Lima!
text: This tour went above and beyond my expectations! Boat tour/Dune buggy ride were great and both Sol and Mar (tour guides) kept things flowing smoothly overall. Would definitely do this tour again. Just be prepared for a long day- but it was worth it!

title: If you‚Äôre wondering about the sand buggy - do it.
text: My (unexpected) favourite part of the day was the sand buggy! It was great seeing lots of sea lions and birds at Paracas and our guide for the islands, Mickey, was very funny with lots of singing and dancing between facts. The pisco sour tasting was really interesting. Again, a nice level of interactive and fun. Our main guides Marjorie and Sol were very helpful, always available and friendly. Overall, a really good experience.

title: Huacachita and paracas tour review
text: Worth every penny, sol and mar were amazing aswell. Highly recommend!The trip lasts about 17 hours and you get to know amazing places, see penguins eat great food (not included) and experience the huacachina.

title: So Cool
text: This is such a fun experience. Our guide was fantastic, making sure we were seeing everything, and especially a great vantage point for the show. Best of all is skipping the line. We were even able to arrange for them to drive us to the airport afterwards. Definitely recommend.

title: Excellent 3 Day Private Tour of Lima
text: Our family of 4 was on an "Inca Discovery Cruise" in November and we were in Lima for 3 days.  I contacted Mabel at Apullay Tours about 2 months before our cruise to ask if she could assist us with organizing a 3 day private tour of Lima for us.  Mabel did an excellent job on our itinerary, and we saw and experienced so many things in Lima over our 3 days there.Mabel arranged for a van with our very capable driver, Cirilo, who did an amazing job navigating us through some very narrow streets and heavy traffic.  Our guide, Pamela, had excellent English and she was very well qualified as a guide, having completed a 2 year course in tourism management and tour guiding. She provided us with insights into Peru's long history with its indigenous peoples, the Spanish conquest and battles for liberation, as well as contemporary history of Peru.  We are grateful to Pamela for providing us with so much knowledge of Peru and its people.Our son has cerebral palsy and we had brough along on our cruise a fold-up wheelchair to get him around the many cobblestone streets on the trip.  Cirilo was very helpful with driving us to the most optimal drop-off locations and assisting with the fold-up wheelchair, which was greatly appreciated.Some of the 3-day tour highlights were:- Chorrillos: The Morro Solar - One of the city's highest points with an exceptional view of Lima;- Kennedy Park and Love Park in Minaflores;- Magic Water Park and Laser Show that shows the history of Peru projected onto the water fountain's mist;- Local market tour in Surquillo with a delicious sampling of local Peruvian fruit;- Walk through Barranco, a wonderful artistic / bohemian community and art gallery visit- Delicious Peruvian seafood dinner at Cala, an excellent ocean-side restaurant and a perfect place to view the sunset- Visit to the Gold Museum which is an extensive display of Incan gold artifacts and pottery.  Also has a weapons museum on the top floor that was also impressive.- Lunch at El Bolivariano, an authentic Peruvian food experience which was also delicious.It was truly a memorable 3 days in Lima for our family, thanks to the Apullay Tours team.  I would highly recommend their tours to anyone wishing to have an exceptional tour of Lima and to make the most of your time there.

title: Beautiful.
text: The most heart warming displays of water fountains. The water show was mesmerizing. A must see for sure during the evening hours to fully enjoy the experience.

title: Amazing!!!
text: We couldn‚Äòt miss out on the magic water fountain so we booked a tour with ‚ÄûGet Your Guide‚Äú.  Luckily we were the only ones signing up and had basically a private tour.Mable from ‚ÄûApullay Tours‚Äú was a lovely guide and Ernesto was a great driver that picked us up all the way down in Barranco.They drop you off right at the entrance and let you skip the whole queue so there is no waiting involved. Mable gave us a short summary of the film that plays on the waterscreen so you have a good idea what you are about to see. Thanks to her knowledge about the schedule of the park we went directly to the other fountains and had plenty of time to do awesome photos. She has a good idea of posing and made very good pictures of us. She explained a lot about the the culture and made the expiereience unforgettable. It took less than a minute once we left the park and Ernesto was already there to pick us up. They drop you off wherever you want and we had a great time chatting in the car. Mable has great humor and we had a great time driving back to barranco. With some recommendations for bars and restaurants we left the car happy as we could be!Overall an amazing expierience and we would recommend this tour to everybody that visits Lima! text: We thoroughly enjoyed the guided tour along the streets of Lima with our guides Norman & Edwin. We also had the best picarones that I‚Äôve ever tasted in my life and definitely would have never found all these hidden gems on our own.Edwin and Norman were very prepared for the tour - they provided us with our own sporks, had wipes and a cutting board for the fruit we picked up at the market.Please note that the cost of food is not included in the tour, so have cash ready to spend on the day.

title: Just fine, not great!
text: The overall experience was fine.The rides on the bus are very very long. Getting to the different places do take time.The tour guides with us are more companions/chaperons than tour guide. They give basic knowledge of the culture and the area but they‚Äôre not giving deep cultural facts and knowledge whatsoever.1/The excursion on the boat ride and the visit of the island was nice. Cloudy weather that day so take a hoodie (winter season in Peru now). The emcee on our boat could barely speak English as it was meant to be an English tour ride. But we saw flocks of dolphins and birds and sea lions. That was nice.2/Lunch and the wine tasting was real nice. They prepare everyone‚Äôs order on your way to the next destination so by lunch time, every orders are ready upon arrival. Smart!You taste 6 different wines and pisco before, if you wish, purchases on demand.3/Huacachina Oasis: it was probably the highlight of the day with a promise of Buggies and sand boarding. Once we arrived there, the chaperons say we only have 45min overall before we have to get to our next and last stop. The rush kicked in with an awesome buggy ride with an amazing adrenaline hit over the sandy hills. Was Awesome!However, we get to a small hill where the driver gives us handmade wooden boards where we can‚Äôt even stand on and he says we just lay down on them to slide downhill!!!Robbery!!! I was so upset as I was looking for that part of the tour all day. It took a few seconds before  it was over, to soon return to the departing point where we were already late to the meeting point for departure.4/ last stop: a souvenir shop!So we rushed off Huacachina Oasis to get to a souvenir store! A joke!!!!That stop is not only unecessary but was completely unexpected of an end tour.We all barely bought something to snack and drink on with toilets you have to pay for in order to use it.It was already night by then and the long ride back knocked everyone off (2h20min).At hotel in Miraflores by 21h30.Overall, a good tour experience.

title: Frustrated expectation
text: I found it extremely disorganized, from the exit to the return. The bus had minor defects. On the go, the microphone didn't work. On the return, the lack of numbering in the banks next to us, made the light remain strong and direct in us.In the first part of the tour, we lost time with going to a souvenir store to taste "a candy that only we would have la", which is the famous nut with milk candy and bathed with chocolate.In the second part, the tour/tasting of pisk was much more interesting. But it also demanded too much time.Due to this lack of time management, we arrived late in the desert, and it was necessary to get off the bus very early and "run" to get to the mountain in time for sunset. Which was in vain. Several times we were so distant from the guide that we ended up having it seemed like we were alone. When we finally arrived near the mountain, if we had been offered the bugger service that is at the entrance, we would have continued to climb the mountain in time to see the sunset. However, we still had to "run" between tourists and merchants, until we reached the entrance of the mountain. From there, we went on foot and we were still advised not to stop for photos, so we could get to the bugs soon.When we finally caught the bug, instead of being taken to see the little sunset that was still left, they stopped a dune and made the boards available to slip. Another extremely disorganized moment with rude guides. The bug that took us, just went out to get more people, leaving my group without any guidance.Finally, when we returned to the bus, it stopped at the same place that left us. That is, we had to "run" between people and cars, to get to the bus immediately in order to avoid getting to Lima in the morning.

text: An unforgettable Lima experience with Lourdes!Our tour of Lima wouldn't have been the same without Lourdes. She wasn't just a guide ‚Äî she was the heart and soul of the journey. She showed us hidden gems and secret corners of the city we would have never discovered on our own.She made us feel safe and looked after ‚Äî always making sure we stayed together, that our bags were secure, and that no one got lost in the buzz of the city. Her storytelling made history come alive, and her humor kept us smiling the whole way.And the best part? She gave us a thousand beautiful memories through the photos she took ‚Äî capturing every laugh, every view, and every shared moment. Now we don't just remember Lima, we feel it ‚Äî thanks to her.Lourdes is not just a guide, she‚Äôs the kind of person who turns a tour into a lifelong memory.Highly recommended ‚Äî 10/10!

text: Phenomenal show! If you love Jazz, this is a necessary stop :0) Intimate setting and you will have an unforgettable time!

title: Tourist bus not very good
text: One of the guides I speak almost nothing of the places we visited, very little Waiting time between one place and another, does not let other routes

title: NICE TOUR IN MIRAFLORES
text: I really enjoyed the tour and the information provided by the guide Marilyn, the places are nice, especially the seawall. You have been super kind and attentive to me, congratulations!

title: BEST OF MIRAFLORES!!!!
text: For us it has been the best way to know the best of Miraflores!!! The bus was air conditioned and the staff super friendly... 10000% recommended üåüüåüüåüüåüüåüüåü

title: Tourist bus with differential
text: The tour was wonderful, containing the option to get off and off the bus several times. Highlight for the attention and cordiality of the tour guide Marilyn!

title: Standard city tour
text: The basics of sightseeing: you sit on the bus and enjoy the view and landscapes, while the guide explains a little about the region visited. No news.

title: Friendly employees with regular services.
text: All the staff were very friendly but they do not comply with the schedules they mention in their advertising, they are not reliable, I waited for them at a meeting point and the bus never came.

title: BIRTHDAY WALK
text: Yesterday we took the TuriBus in LarcoMar - a guided tour through Miraflores, with some 10-minute stops.When you get on, they give you a guide of the places where we are going to stop, schedules in case you want to take the next TuriBus.so you can get off and on the same bus, or take the next one.We walked around for my granddaughter's birthday, they sang happy birthday to her and we had a great time.

title: ¬°So Happy We Chose the Miraflores Bus Tur√≠stico!
text: Having visited Lima on several recreational occasions, it was GREAT taking a tour to learn about the Miraflores district, its rich history and Lima's cultural background. Vicente, our driver was a master at maneuvering this double-decker bus through the narrow streets. #VeryImpressiveTour guide, Jordan, was just as impressive as he seamlessly spoke in Spanish and English highlighting points of interest throughout the tour. We were fortunate to meet Jordan a day in advance, at one of their bus stops, where he thoroughly explained the tour's features, times and optimal starting point. Jordan is proud of his country and a FABULOUS host with a warm, hospitable and accommodating personality. He made us feel special as though we met a new friend for life. Ticket agent, Pedro was super informative (even beyond the realm of the tour), friendly, fun and funny! If you're looking for a great Miraflores tour experience, where you are treated like a friend, this male trio cannot be out matched! #HighlyRecommended

title: By far it was our best decision to get to know Miraflores in detail! Very grateful for the excellent service.
text: We took the tour with the family and it was incredible to be able to get to know Miraflores at our own pace. The tour allows you to go up and down as many times as you want, we were able to visit the Huaca Puccllana, which is also highly recommended! The bus staff is super friendly and they also give you headphones so you can listen to a super audio guide in English, Portuguese, Quechua and Spanish... 10000% RECOMMENDED!

title: Fun and complete
text: The service is very nice, thanks to the guides and their dedication, a tour only in Miraflores district where I live but the experience on the bus is completely different

title: Bad experience
text: Both get your guide and arutismotours both charge more than normal operators. Better dont go with these people. Tour was more commercial they try to sell products. Tour guide try to talk bad about particular country. Worst experience.

title: If you want a short desert tour and a long restaurant tour, go ahead!
text: Unfortunately, it was a disappointing experience despite all my planning. The tour company arrived 20 minutes late at 4 a.m., then we waited another 20 minutes for someone still asleep in Miraflores. Paracas was okay, but in Huacachina the guide mostly spoke Spanish, translating only half into English, so we missed key points. He was rude about timing, saying he wouldn‚Äôt wait more than 15 minutes at stops, and lost track during sandboarding, leaving us last to slide. For lunch, they took us to an overpriced horse farm clearly aimed at overcharging tourists. The guide made us sit uncomfortably, the food was terrible, and the staff treated us like dollar signs. Overall, we felt disrespected. I would never recommend this expensive tour.

title: False Advertising
text: This trip was falsely advertised. It clearly says that admission to Huacachina Lagoon is included, and sand boarding is extra. My friend and I weren't interested in sand boarding, so we didn't pay for it. When we arrived to the area outside of Huacachina Lagoon, everyone got onto smaller cars, but our guide told us to go wait at the bar and they would be back in 45 minutes. This was about a 25 minute walk away from the oasis, outside of the sand dunes. When we expressed that we wanted to see the oasis, we just didn't want to do the sand boarding, they told us no. We even offered to pay the extra $10 and they still said no. We were forced to wait at a bar outside of the oasis when it clearly said the oasis was included. This was extremely disappointing, and I think we deserve at least a partial refund for this trip. Unfortunately I don't see anywhere on TripAdvisor where that's possible.

title: Show!!!
text: Super punctual staff and the guide Mauris very helpful and attentive.Van new and well reduced group.Everything promised on the tour was fully fulfilled.Quite intense and exhausting because we left 5:30 am and arrived at 23:50 pm in the hotel, but it was planned and also due to the heat, but it is quite worth doing this tour with this team (Peru bucket list).

title: Irresponsible disappointment
text: Abysmal, don't even embark with this operator canceled me with 8 days to go, and now I can't find tour for the 28th in Lima.. less than a star for irresponsible

title: Do not trust this company or TripAdvisor for this type of service
text: I scheduled this tour in advance, until I ended up making a hotel reservation that would stay near the meeting point for the exit of the tour because the departure time would be quite early. Sorry. It was the first time I used TripAdvisor for this purpose (tour reservation), until then only to see people's opinions. I don't know if it was a punctual thing, unfortunately, but by my experience I do not recommend this travel agency or Tripadvisor as a means for this type of service hiring.

title: Lightning trip
text: Punctual in the pickup, friendly, good atmosphere in the vehicle that we were transferred, the fun was when we were taken for the tasting of wines - pisco - macerated

title: Everything impeccable, indicate a lot, go and go!
text: It was amazing, wonderful! This tour is worth every cent, no doubt! I say a thousand times! The places are beautiful, the food from the restaurant we stopped is wonderful, everything perfect!

title: The car was very uncomfortable with air conditioning not working properly.
text: The air√≥ condition didn‚Äôt work properly. We were sitting in the back, couldn‚Äôt breatheWindows not accessible to openReally struggle during long road

title: Very complete tour
text: Excellent Tour, Guide was Pretty Pro. The whole experience. The tour of the islands was very pleasant, the tasting of sweets, wines and spirits was phenomenal. The restaurant where we stopped for lunch very delicious and the staff very attentive. Activities in Huacachina are equally spectacular. Tour indispensable!!!

title: Comfortable airport transfer from Lima to Miraflores hotel
text: The airport transfer from Lima International Airport to our hotel Crown Plaza at Miraflores was done quite comfortably and efficiently. The driver picked us at the exit if the arrivals ...waiting with a placard carrying our name. The transfer took just 35-40 minutes  ...

title: Smooth Transfer to Hotel
text: Aludi tour package was custom just for me vs fixed with large tour operators. Aludi provides private transfers vs herd buses with large operators. Our bags did not arrive so we had to wait and file a report. Our driver had to wait. If we were with a large operator, we would have made the entire bus wait for us for over an hour. Delayed bags are not uncommon. Private transfers are the way to go.

title: Best Experience and Customer Service Ever
text: The Aludi driver picked us up at the airport to drive us to our hotel.  His car was very nice and perfectly clean.  He was an excellent driver and had fantastic people skills.  Before the drive was over, I was already trusting this company and booking a city tour for later that day and a full day tour for the next day.  He ended up being our driver for both tours. My son and I not only had great tours but had so much fun with the Aludi team.  We subsequently booked a 3rd tour with them which was also fantastic.  An amazing bonus for us was that my son left all his money and phone cord in a very remote town - through use of communications, other tour guides and a courier service, Aludi got everything back to us in 2 days.  Despite the work they did to get this back for us, they only asked for reimbursement of the courier charge. The Aludi team will exceed all your expectations.

title: A reliable and attentive team
text: Everything was wonderful, they made our experience in Lima spectacular. The guide's attention was fantastic and very enriching :)

title: THE food tour to do in Lima
text: This tour exceeded all expectations! We had of amazing food in local places and the servings were generous. Our guide, Bruce, was entertaining and enthusiastic! 10/10 would recommend.

title: Amazing and authentic!
text: The tour with Inka Pride was amazing! Our tour guide Bruce did a great job, we had very tasty local food and great conversation. Authentic and fun!

title: Bruce Almighty
text: https://www.tripadvisor.com/AttractionProductReview-g294316-d26863706-Lima_Street_Food_Tour_Markets_Local_Life-Lima_Lima_Region.html

title: Amazing Food Experience with Inka Pride Tours
text: We spent a 5 stars foody tour with Bruce. Very knowledgeable, patient with his explanations. It was nice to know the origin of the Peruvian food. Very agreeable time. We highly recommend Bruce and Inka Pride Tours for smart fun while eating.

title: Amazing Downtown Food Tour with Bruce
text: Bruce was an amazing guide, super friendly and funny! Full of knowledge and stories, he took us to hidden spots and places that our family would have never ventured to. Everything we had to eat was delicious and I can definitely recommend him. 5 stars!

title: Great gastronomy and culture tour!
text: Great tour with interesting explanations and amazing food! Guide was very engaged and enjoyed showing us the real non touristy Lina

title: An Unforgettable Food Adventure
text: Incredible tour with Bruce! We ate so much delicious local food and learned a lot about the culture along the way. This is an area of Lima we would never have ventured into on our own, and we‚Äôre so glad we had the chance to experience it with such a knowledgeable and friendly guide. Highly recommended!Eat a small breakfast before!

The food and the disco sours were delicious, and the info he gave us was really interesting and different to other tours we'd been on. Would recommend!

title: Thanks Bruce
text: Bruce was very nice, we had a great time and learned a lot about Peru and its food. He also offers many other tours. Thanks, Bruce.
